name: bot_add
description: This command adds a bot to your current game. If you specify a team (T or CT), the bot will be added to that team. You can also optionally specify a difficulty and a name (if there is an existing profile).

arguments.label: T / CT
arguments.description: Enter the letter T to add a Terrorist bot or CT to add a Counter-Terrorist bot.

arguments.label: Difficulty
arguments.description: Enter the letter T to add a Terrorist bot or CT to add a Counter-Terrorist bot.

arguments.label: Difficulty
arguments.description:
The difficulty the spawned bot should have. Options are:
easy
normal
hard
expert

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description:
The difficulty the spawned bot should have. Options are:
easy
normal
hard
expert

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description: Optional - if not specified, the bot will have a random name. The name of the bot you wish to add (this name will show in the scoreboard/kill list/chat). The name must have an existing profile (e.g. Mark, Opie, etc).

name: bot_add_ct
description: This console command adds a bot to the CT side. If the bot spawns dead, it will respawn at the start of the next round. You can optionally specify a difficulty and a name (if there is an existing profile).

arguments.label: Difficulty
arguments.description:
The difficulty the spawned bot should have. Options are:
easy
normal
hard
expert

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description:
The difficulty the spawned bot should have. Options are:
easy
normal
hard
expert

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description: Optional - if not specified, the bot will have a random name. The name of the bot you wish to add (this name will show in the scoreboard/kill list/chat). The name must have an existing profile (e.g. Mark, Opie, etc).

name: bot_add_t
description: This command adds a bot to the T side. If the bot spawns dead, it will respawn at the start of the next round. You can optionally specify a difficulty and a name (if there is an existing profile).

arguments.label: Difficulty
arguments.description:
The difficulty the spawned bot should have. Options are:
easy
normal
hard
expert

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description:
The difficulty the spawned bot should have. Options are:
easy
normal
hard
expert

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description: Optional - if not specified, the bot will have a random name. The name of the bot you wish to add (this name will show in the scoreboard/kill list/chat). The name must have an existing profile (e.g. Mark, Opie, etc).

name: cl_crosshairgap
description: This console command will adjust the size of the gap in the middle of your crosshair. The smaller the value, the smaller the gap.

arguments.label: Gap
arguments.description: A number: the size of the gap between each line in your crosshair.

name: cl_crosshairsize
description: This command controls the length and size of the 4 lines that make up a standard crosshair. Using a low value will give your crosshair very slight lines, and using a large value makes your crosshair have very long lines.

arguments.label: Size
arguments.description: A number to represent what size you want your crosshair to be. The default value is 5.

name: cl_crosshairstyle
description: This command sets the style of your crosshair such as its general shape and whether or not it opens up whenever your character moves around.

arguments.label: Style
arguments.description:
Your desired crosshair style (a number). Crosshair styles:
0 - Default CS:GO dynamic crosshair
1 - Static variant of the default crosshair
2 - Classic static crosshair with dynamic dots on each side
3 - Classic dynamic crosshair
4 - Classic static crosshair
5 - Classic static and dynamic crosshair

name: cl_crosshairthickness
description: This console command customizes the thickness of your in game crosshair.

arguments.label: Thickness
arguments.description: A numeric value to decide the thickness of your crosshair. The larger the number, the thicker your crosshair will be.

name: cl_hud_color
description: This is the console command used to change and customize the color of your HUD (heads up display). It can be changed to a variety of colors, which we have listed examples for.

arguments.label: HUD Color
arguments.description: A number from 1 to 10 that is used to alter the HUD color.

name: cl_hud_playercount_showcount
description: This useful console command customizes your HUD by changing the display of players alive on each team from showing each of their Steam avatars to just showing a number for how many of each team is alive.

arguments.description: Use a 1 to change the playercount menu to only show how many players are alive for each team. This can save room on the HUD. Use a 0 to show Steam avatars. 0 is the default setting for this command.

name: cl_hud_radar_scale
description: This useful console command controls how much room in your HUD your radar takes up. You can choose to make it a smaller feature or larger than the default value.

arguments.label: Radar Scale
arguments.description: A number between 0.8 and 1.3. The larger the value, the larger the radar will be. The default value for this command is 1.

name: cl_radar_scale
description: This command adjusts the scale of your radar, which affects how zoomed in or out the radar is. A lot of players use this command to zoom the radar out and have a complete view of the map.

arguments.label: Radar Scale
arguments.description: A number between 0.25 and 1. The smaller the number, the more zoomed out the radar appears. The larger the number, the more zoomed in the radar appears. The default value for this command is 0.7.

name: cl_righthand
description: This is the command that moves your gun to your left hand, also known as the switch hand command. Your gun and other weapons will be on the left side of your screen, which some people prefer.

arguments.description: Use a 0 after this command to move your weapon to your left hand. Use a 1 after this command to move your gun to your right hand.

name: cl_showfps
description: This command produces a simple FPS (frames per second) count in the top left corner of your screen. Unlike the net_graph command, the only value shown is your FPS, which some players like for its simplicity.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn on the FPS counter, and a 0 after the command to turn it off.

name: demo_pause
description: This useful console command is used to pause the demo you're watching. Playback can be resumed with the command demo_resume.

name: demo_resume
description: This useful command is used to resume the demo you're watching, if you have previously paused it. To pause demos, use the command demo_pause.

name: demo_timescale
description: This command sets how quickly the demo is played. In other words, it can be used to fast forward through rounds you're not interested in watching.

arguments.label: Playback speed
arguments.description: Enter a number to represent how fast you want the demo played back. Entering the number 20 plays the demo back 20 times as fast.

name: demo_togglepause
description: Use this command when watching demos to toggle between being paused or not. The good thing about this command is then it will pause or play the demo, depending on if its running when the command is entered.

name: game_mode
description: This command can be used in conjunction with the game_type command to change the type of game you are playing (casual, deathmatch, etc). See argument information for help.

name: game_type
description: This command can be used with the game_mode command to change the game you are playing (e.g. arms race, competitive, etc). See argument information for combinations and help.

name: give
description: This command will give you the item with the specified item code. Find item codes on our give command list.

arguments.label: Weapon Code
arguments.description: The weapon code of the weapon or grenade you wish to spawn (e.g. AK-47 is weapon_ak47).

name: hurtme
description: This command will hurt your character with the specified amount of damage (1 = 1HP).

arguments.label: Damage
arguments.description: The amount of damage to deal. 10 = 10HP.

name: mp_ignore_round_win_conditions
description: This command can be used to enable and disable round win conditions. If round win conditions are disabled (ignored), then the conditions that would usually make a round end (e.g. bomb exploding, team being eliminated) will no longer make the round end - the round would last forever, until manually ended. By default, this command is disabled (meaning win conditions are not ignored).

arguments.description: This command, if enabled, would make the game ignore the conditions that usually end the round (e.g. everyone on a team dying, bomb exploding). When enabled, the round will last forever, or until you manually end it or disable this setting. Default is 0 (do not ignore win conditions).

name: mp_warmup_end
description: This command ends the warmup.

name: noclip
description: This command will toggle noclip for your player. When in noclip, you can fly and will pass through solid objects like walls.

name: say
description: This command will make you say the specified message in chat.

arguments.label: Message
arguments.description: The message to send in chat (to all of server).

name: say_team
description: This command will make you say the specified message in team chat.

arguments.label: Message
arguments.description: The message to send in team chat.

name: sensitivity
description: This command sets your mouse sensitivity to the specified value.

arguments.label: Sensitivity
arguments.description: Your desired mouse sensitivity - e.g. 1 or 1.25.

name: unbind
description: This command removes any bind bound to the specified key.

arguments.label: Key
arguments.description: The key you wish to unbind (remove any and all actions that are bound to it).

name: viewmodel_fov
description: This command sets your client's FOV to the specified number. You can set your FOV to a maximum of 68 using this command. The default field of view is 60.

arguments.label: FOV
arguments.description: A number - your desired field of view. By default this is 60. You can set this to a maximum of 68.

name: viewmodel_offset_x
description: This command sets the X offset of your view model - i.e. how far left or right it is. Your view model is your hand (and the gun in it) that displays in first person mode. The maximum value is 2.5 and the minimum value is -2.5.

arguments.label: X Offset
arguments.description: Set this to a number between 2.5 and -2.5. -2.5 would be closest to the middle of the screen. 2.5 would be closest to the edge of the screen.

name: viewmodel_offset_y
description: This command sets the Y offset of your view model - i.e. how close or far from your character is. Your view model is your hand (and the gun in it) that displays in first person mode. The maximum value is 2 and the minimum value is -2.

arguments.label: Y Offset
arguments.description: Set this to a number between 2 and -2. 2 would be closest to the top of the screen. -2 would be closest to the bottom of the screen.

name: viewmodel_offset_z
description: This command sets the Z offset of your view model - i.e. how far up or down it is. Your view model is your hand (and the gun in it) that displays in first person mode. The maximum value is 2 and the minimum value is -2.

arguments.label: Z Offset
arguments.description: Set this to a number between 2 and -2. 2 would put your viewmodel as far in front of you as possible. -2 put your viewmodel as close as possible to you.

name: voice_enable
description: This command sets whether or not voice communication is enabled for your client. Setting this to 0 will disable voice. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable voice. Set to 1 to enable voice (default).

name: bind
description: This command will bind a command, or list of commands, to a key on your keyboard or button on your mouse. Binds can make your CS:GO experience much more convenient, and is a very important command in the game.

arguments.label: Bind Key
arguments.description: The key that you'd like to assign the subsequent command to.

arguments.label: "Bind Command"
arguments.description: The key that you'd like to assign the subsequent command to.

arguments.label: "Bind Command"
arguments.description: The command, or sequence of commands, that you want to assign to the bind hotkey. If binding multiple commands you need to separate them with a semi-colon (;) and put quotation marks on either side (").

name: bind_osx
description: This command will bind a command, or list of commands, to a key on your keyboard or button on your mouse. This command is for OSX (Mac).

arguments.label: Bind Key
arguments.description: The key that you'd like to assign the subsequent command to.

arguments.label: "Bind Command"
arguments.description: The key that you'd like to assign the subsequent command to.

arguments.label: "Bind Command"
arguments.description: The command, or sequence of commands, that you want to assign to the bind hotkey. If binding multiple commands you need to separate them with a semi-colon (;) and put quotation marks on either side (").

name: bot_difficulty
description: This console command sets the difficulty of any bots you add to a private server. Set this to 0 for easy bots, 1 for normal bots, 2 for hard bots and 3 for expert bots.

arguments.label: Difficulty
arguments.description:
The difficulty bots should have. Options are:
0 - easy
1 - normal
2 - hard
3 - expert

name: bot_quota
description: This command adjusts the maximum number of bots you can have in your server. The default value is 10.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum number of bots your server is allowed to have at any given time.

name: cl_crosshair_drawoutline
description: This console command can be used to enable and disable the small black outline that is around your crosshair. This can enhance crosshair visibility for some players.

arguments.description: Set the number after the command to 1 to apply a black outline to your crosshair, and set the command to a 0 to have no black outline.

name: cl_crosshair_outlinethickness
description: This useful console command adjusts how thick the outline of your crosshair is. It is an important command to adjust to ensure your aim is as good as it can be.

arguments.label: Thickness
arguments.description: The thickness value you want your crosshair outline to be. The default value is 1, and you can choose any value between 0.1 to 3.

name: cl_crosshaircolor
description: This console command sets the color that your crosshair shows up as. You can set a value between 0 and 4.

arguments.label: Color
arguments.description: A number corresponding to a crosshair color.

name: cl_draw_only_deathnotices
description: This console command is especially useful for CS:GO fragmovie makers, as it strips down the UI to only include the crosshair and the kill feed. These are the two things needed in videos.

arguments.description: Add a 1 after the command to turn the command on, and a 0 to turn it off.

name: cl_radar_always_centered
description: This command decided whether or not your radar is always centered to your location. Turning this feature off can be useful, as when you're by the edge of the map less of the radar's space is taken up by empty space, meaning you can see your surroundings more clearly.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to disable having your radar centered around you all the time. Enter a 1 after the command to return the radar to centering around you.

name: cl_radar_rotate
description: This command toggles whether or not your radar rotates as you rotate and look around with your camera. Some players find disabling this feature makes it easier to use the radar.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this console command to prevent the radar from rotating as your character model rotates. Use a 1 after this command to have the radar rotate as you rotate (default).

name: joy_inverty
description: This console command is used to set whether you want to invert the Y axis for looking around on a joystick. When this command is turned on, moving the joystick up, or forward, will make your character look down.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to invert the Y axis, and enter a 0 to leave it as its default setting (moving the joystick forward/up makes your character look up).

name: joy_movement_stick
description: This console command is used to determine which stick on the joystick controls the movement of your player model.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to assign the left stick to control movement, a 1 after the command to assign the right stick to control movement, and a 2 after the command to assign legacy controls to control movement.

name: key_listboundkeys
description: This console command lists all of the keys and buttons you have that have a specific action bound to them (e.g. the space bar being bound to jump).

name: sv_infinite_ammo
description: This command, if set to 1, will give you infinite ammunition for your weapon allowing you to fire your gun continuously. If you set this command to 2, you will have infinite ammo to reload with, but you will still run out of ammo after firing all of the bullets in your gun's clip.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable infinite ammo (default). Set to 1 for never ending ammo in the gun that allows you to shoot forever without reloading. Set to 2 for infinite ammo to reload with, but you still need to reload after shooting all the ammo in the gun.

name: cl_autowepswitch
description: This command changes whether or not you automatically equip a weapon you just picked up.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to automatically equip weapons as you pick them up. Set to 0 to turn off this feature. Most players find auto-equipping guns frustrating, so most will need to set this to 0.

name: cl_color
description: This useful command sets your preference for what color you like to be in matchmaking. This color is shown on the radar and on your Steam avatar when in the lobby.

arguments.label: Color Value
arguments.description: Enter a number from 0-4 that corresponds with one of the available colors in CS:GO.

name: cl_crosshairalpha
description: This command sets how transparent your crosshair is on your screen. The lower the value, the less visible your crosshair is.

arguments.label: Alpha Value
arguments.description: How transparent you want your crosshair to be. Use a low number like 10 to have it barely visible, and a high number like 250 to have it fully colored. Default value for this command is 200.

name: cl_hud_playercount_pos
description: Use this command to adjust where the player count (players who are in the server) menu is shown on your HUD. This also changes where the scoreboard is, that shows rounds won by each team. You can place it at the top of your screen or at the bottom.

arguments.description: Use a 1 to move the player count and score counter to the bottom of your screen, and a 0 to put it at the top of your screen. The command is set to 0 by default.

name: cl_pitchdown
description: This fun command controls how many degrees down from eye level you can move your camera. That means you can edit this command to allow you to look under you, effectively looking through your character model's legs at what is behind you.

arguments.label: Degrees
arguments.description: The degrees you want to be able to look down. The default value for this command is 89 (so you can look straight up at the sky), but this can changed to 200+.

name: cl_pitchup
description: This fun console command controls how many degrees from eye level you can look up into the sky. This can be adjusted to let you look so far around that you end up seeing behind you.

arguments.label: Degrees
arguments.description: The degrees you want to be able to look up. The default value for this command is 89 (so you can look straight down at the floor), but this can changed to 200+.

name: cl_radar_icon_scale_min
description: This console command changes how large your character dot appears on the radar.

arguments.label: Icon Scale
arguments.description: Enter a value between 0.4 and 1 to set how big your character icon appears on the radar. This will be your lobby/character color if playing matchmaking. The default value for this command is 0.6.

name: cl_showpos
description: This command will show you values for where exactly on the map you are located. This will appear in the top left of your screen by default. It also shows your velocity (run speed).

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to enable the display. Enter a 0 after the command to hide the display.

name: clear
description: This console command clears all of the previous entries and data from the developer console. It is good to do every so often to make the console more readable.

name: inferno_damage
description: This fun console command is used to change how much damage molotov and incendiary grenades do . When cheats are activated, you can set this value to be incredibly high or incredibly low.

arguments.label: Damage Per Second
arguments.description: The damage per second (DPS) you want molotovs and incendiaries to do. The default value for this command is 40, though it can be set to crazy values like 1 or 2000 damage per second.

name: inferno_flame_lifetime
description: This console command changes how long the fires burn from molotov and incendiary grenades. It allows you to make them last for just a moment, or for an extended period of time.

arguments.label: Burn Time
arguments.description: How long you want molotov and incendiary grenades to burn for when they explode in seconds. The default value for this command is 7 seconds, but it can be changed to under a second or for minutes at a time.

name: inferno_max_range
description: This command sets the maximum distance that flames from a molotov or incendiary grenade can spread from their initial point of impact with the ground.

arguments.label: Range
arguments.description: The maximum range that flames can spread from where you threw the grenade. The default value for this command is 150.

name: jpeg
description: This command is used to take a screenshot. You can specify the file name in the command.

arguments.label: File Name
arguments.description: The file name you want to save the image as.

name: map
description: Use this console command to instantly change the map you're currently playing to a different map.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: This is the full name of the map you want to play, such as de_mirage. Find map codes on our map code list.

name: mp_afterroundmoney
description: This command sets the amount of money that is award to every player on every team at the end of each round, regardless of win/loss. Default is 0 (win/loss bonus is set with a different command).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of money to give each player on each team after every round (regardless of win/loss).

name: mp_autokick
description: This command sets whether or not the auto kick feature should be enabled. The auto kick feature kicks people for being idle (AFK) and team damage. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to disable all auto kick features. Set this to 1 (default) to enable auto kick features (i.e. auto kicking for AFK and for too much team damage/killing).

name: mp_autoteambalance
description: This command can be used to enable or disable the auto team balance feature. This feature will swap players around teams at the end of a round if there are an unequal amount of players on either time (i.e. if team A has 1 player and team B has 3, at the end of the round, 1 player from team B would be automatically moved over to team A).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to disable auto team balancing. Enter 1 here to enable auto team balancing (default).

name: net_graph
description: This command will enable (set to 1) and disable (set to 0) the net graph display, which shows ping, FPS and other client variables.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable net graph. Set to 1 to enable net graph. Set to 2 to print in and out network data. Set to 3 to draw data on payload.

name: notarget
description: This command toggles whether or not bots are aware of your player. When this is enabled, bots will not attack you (or even react to you).

name: sv_grenade_trajectory
description: This command, if enabled (1), shows the trajectory of grenades (as colored lines). Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not show grenade trajectory (default). Set to 1 to show grenade trajectory.

name: viewmodel_presetpos
description: This command will set your X/Y/Z viewmodel offsets to a preset configuration. See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
A number to represent your desired preset. Options are:
1 - Desktop
2 - Couch
3 - Classic

name: -cl_show_team_equipment
description: This command disables the effect of the +cl_show_team_equipment, which puts the names/equipment of the members of your team permanently above their head.

name: +cl_show_team_equipment
description: This command puts the names of your teammates and the equipment they're carrying above their head permanently (usually just shows at the start of the round). Use -cl_show_team_equipment to disable.

name: mp_drop_knife_enable
description: This command allows players to drop their knives.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to allow players to drop their knife (G to drop on default). Enter a 0 after the command to disable this feature (default setting).

name: sv_autobunnyhopping
description: This command, if set to 1, will make you automatically bunny hop by holding down the space bar. Default is disabled (1).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Set to 1 to enable automatic bunny hopping when you hold down the space bar.

name: snd_mvp_volume
description: This useful console command sets how long the MVP music is when a player with a MVP kit wins MVP award that round.

arguments.label: Volume
arguments.description: The volume of MVP music. The default value for this command is 1. Set this number lower to reduce the volume.

name: sv_ledge_mantle_helper
description: This console command, when enabled, makes it easier to crouch jump into windows or ledges.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to turn it off, a 1 after the command to turn on jump help only for windows or vents (default), and a 2 after the command to turn on jump help for all ledges.

name: sv_prime_accounts_only
description: This command, if set to 1, makes it so that only prime accounts can connect to the server. Default on most servers is 0 (meaning non-prime players can connect).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to allow all CS:GO accounts to connect. Set to 1 to allow only CS:GO accounts with the prime status to connect to the server.

name: BindToggle
description: This command assigns a hotkey (key on your keyboard, or button on your mouse) to switch through the various values a specified console command has (when pressed or clicked). This is useful for setting up binds that toggle a certain feature. For example,"voice_enable" would be toggled between 0 and 1 (disabled and enabled).

arguments.label: Bind Key
arguments.description: This is the key you want to assign your bind toggle command to.

arguments.label: "Bind Command"
arguments.description: This is the key you want to assign your bind toggle command to.

arguments.label: "Bind Command"
arguments.description: The console command you want to assign to the hotkey. Be sure to enter it without any numbers/values after it.

name: cl_autobuy
description: This command is used to set up your autobuy preferences, meaning you can purchase the most vital gear each round by just typing "autobuy" into your console once this is set up.

arguments.label: Weapon codes
arguments.description: Enter as many weapon codes as you'd like to assign to your autobuy. We have a full list of weapon codes here.. Enter the weapon codes without the "weapon_" attached. The correct format to enter them is with just the weapon name and a space between each one: weapon1 weapon2 weapon3 weapon4.

name: cl_crosshaircolor_b
description: This console command allows you to set the color of your crosshair with detail, by adjusting its level of blue. The same command exists for red and green.

arguments.label: Blue Value
arguments.description: The blue RGB value (up to 255) for the amount of blue color used in your crosshair color.

name: cl_crosshaircolor_g
description: This console command allows you to set the color of your crosshair with detail, by adjusting its level of green. The same command exists for red and blue.

arguments.label: Green Value
arguments.description: The green RGB value (up to 255) for the amount of green color used in your crosshair color.

name: cl_crosshaircolor_r
description: This console command allows you to set the color of your crosshair with detail, by adjusting its level of red. The same command exists for green and blue.

arguments.label: Red Value
arguments.description: The red RGB value (up to 255) for the amount of red color used in your crosshair color.

name: cl_crosshairgap_useweaponvalue
description: When activated, this command will dynamically adjust the size of your crosshair depending on what weapon you have equipped at the time.

arguments.description: Use the number 1 after this command to enable your crosshair changing as you change guns, and use a 0 to turn this feature off.

name: cl_disablehtmlmotd
description: This command can be used to disable HTML "messages of the day" (MOTDs)in the client (by setting it to 1). HTML MOTDs are the the web pages/text that pops up when you join a server, sometimes they play volume or loud ads. Default is 0, which makes HTML MOTDs enabled.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to disable HTML motds. Enter 0 to turn them back on (default).

name: cl_forwardspeed
description: This movement console command is used to set the speed you run at when moving forward.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: Enter a value to set your running speed. The higher the value, the faster you'll move, up until 1000 where going any higher will bug your movement. The default value is 450.

name: cl_hideserverip
description: This console command is used to hide the IP of your server in your console. This is particularly useful if you're streaming and don't want viewers to be able to catch your IP address, giving them the chance the DDoS the server.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after this command to activate the hide IP command, and a 0 to turn the command off. Using the command "status" will still show the IP, though.

name: cl_hud_healthammo_style
description: This command is used to toggle between whether or not you want your health & armor bars at the bottom of your screen to show their numeric value (e.g 80 health) and a bar to represent this, or just show the number.

arguments.description: Use a 1 to only show a number value for your health and armor rating, and use a 0 to show a number and a bar that is filled in depending on how much health and armor you have.

name: cl_idealpitchscale
description: This console command adjusts the pitch of the sound in game, and can cause shooting bullets sound different to usual.

arguments.label: Pitch Value
arguments.description: A number that represents the pitch you want to change to. The default value for this command is 0.8.

name: cl_rebuy
description: This console command sets the order in which the game client rebuys your gear. It can be adjusted to give priority to other purchases, such as defuse kits, grenades and more.

arguments.label: Item Order
arguments.description: The order that you want the rebuy command to buy items with. The default value for this is Armor PrimaryWeapon Flashbang SmokeGrenade Defuser HEGrenade Flashbang SecondaryWeapon Molotov IncGrenade Decoy Taser. Change these around to fit your preferences when rebuying. It will purchase as many things as possible with your available cash.

name: cl_sidespeed
description: This movement console command sets how quickly you can move while running sideways.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The speed you want to run at. The higher the number, the faster you'll go, up until 1001 where you'll just begin to bug out. Default value for this command is 450.

name: inferno_friendly_fire_duration
description: This command sets how long after you've damaged a teammate with a molotov or an incendiary grenade the server tells you that you've damaged someone on your team.

arguments.label: Duration
arguments.description: The time, in seconds, that you want the server to tell that you damaged a teammate with fire. The default value for this command is 6 (seconds).

name: inferno_scorch_decals
description: You can use this console command to prevent molotovs and incendiary grenades you throw from leaving scorch decals (scorch marks) on the ground once they burn out.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to prevent fire grenades from leaving scorch decals, and a 1 after the command to leave them on (default).

name: listissues
description: This useful console command produces a list in your developer console of the different things you can vote for in your server . This includes voting to change the map and voting to kick a player.

name: m_rawinput
description: This command enables raw input from your mouse, if set to 1 (default). When raw input is enabled, input is taken directly from your mouse and your operating system settings (like acceleration, delay, etc) will not come into play.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after the command to turn off rawinput, and a 1 after the command to turn it on (default).

name: mm_dedicated_search_maxping
description: This console command is used to set your max preferred ping when connecting to matchmaking servers. It can be beneficial to adjust this command if you find yourself being put in laggy servers.

arguments.label: Max Ping
arguments.description: The maximum ping of a server you join. The lower you set this, the less laggy your matches might be, but it usually increases the time it takes to find a game. The default value for this command is 150.

name: mp_buy_allow_grenades
description: This command sets whether or not players can purchase any form of grenade from the buy menu. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable the buying of grenades. Enter 1 to to enable (default).

name: mp_buy_anywhere
description: This command can be used to set whether or not players can access the buy menu when they are outside of the buyzone. Note that they still need to be within the buy time period - you can change the buy time period with mp_buytime.

arguments.description:
Your desired setting. Options are:
0 - default, only in buy zones
1 - buy anywhere for all teams
2 - buy anywhere for terrorists only
3 - buy anywhere for counter-terrorists only

name: mp_buy_during_immunity
description: This command makes it so that players can buy when they are immune, regardless of the current buy time. This is used commonly in deathmatch servers. See argument information for options. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description:
Your desired setting. Options are:
0 - default, disabled
1 - both teams can buy when they are immune (just after they spawn)
2 - only terrorists can buy when they are immune
3 - only counter-terrorists can buy when they are immune

name: mp_buytime
description: This command sets the amount of time (in seconds) that players have after a round starts to purchase items. This is the time period AFTER the round countdown. So players have the countdown at the start of the round (usually 15 seconds), plus this time period to buy.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of seconds that players have to access and use the buy menu after the round begins.

name: mp_c4timer
description: This command sets how many seconds it takes for the bomb to explode after it has been planted by the terrorists. Default is 40 seconds or 35 seconds, depending on gamemode.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of seconds it takes for the C4 to detonate after it has been planted.

name: mp_competitive_endofmatch_extra_time
description: This command sets the amount of time (in seconds) that the scoreboard will show for (or voting time there will be) after a competitive match ends. Default is 15 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time in seconds the scoreboard will show for after a competitive match ends. If there is voting (e.g. for overtime or extra map), this time will be used.

name: mp_ct_default_grenades
description: This command sets the default grenades that counter terrorists spawn with. Default is none (0). Separate multiple grenades with spaces.

arguments.label: Grenade Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the grenades you wish for CTs to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_ct_default_grenades
description: This command sets the default grenades that counter terrorists spawn with. Default is none (0). Separate multiple grenades with spaces.

arguments.label: Grenade Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the grenades you wish for CTs to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_ct_default_melee
description: This command sets the default melee weapon that counter terrorists spawn with at the start of the round. Default is weapon_knife.

arguments.label: Weapon Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the melee weapons you wish for CTs to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_ct_default_primary
description: This command sets the default primary weapon that counter terrorists spawn with at the start of the round. Default is none (0).

arguments.label: Weapon Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the primary weapons you wish for CTs to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_ct_default_secondary
description: This command sets the default secondary weapon that counter terrorists spawn with at the start of the round. Default is weapon_hkp2000.

arguments.label: Weapon Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the secondary weapons you wish for CTs to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_death_drop_c4
description: This command sets whether or not the C4 (bomb) is droppable. Default is 1 (droppable).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to make the bomb undroppable. Enter 1 here to make it so that the bomb can be dropped (default).

name: mp_death_drop_defuser
description: This command sets whether or not defuse kits are dropped on death. Default is 1 (dropped on death).

arguments.description: Enter a 0 here to make it so that defuse kits are not dropped on death. Enter a 1 here to make it so that they are dropped (default).

name: mp_death_drop_grenade
description: This command sets which grenade (if any) to drop when a player is killed. See argument information for help. Default is 1 (their best).

arguments.description:
Enter either of the following:
0 - drop no grenades on death
1 - drop the best grenade on death (most valuable)
2 - if there is a grenade in the hand of the "deathee" at the time of death, drop that, if not, drop their most valuable grenade

name: mp_death_drop_gun
description: This command sets which gun should be dropped when a player is killed. Default is 1 (their best).

arguments.description:
Enter either of the following:
0 - drop no guns on death
1 - drop the best gun on death (most valuable)
2 - if there is a gun in the hand of the player at the time of death, drop that, if not, drop their most valuable gun

name: mp_deathcam_skippable
description: This command sets whether or not the deathcam can be skipped. Default is 1 (skippable).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to make it so that the death cam cannot be skipped. Enter 1 here to make it so that the death cam can be skipped (default).

name: mp_default_team_winner_no_objective
description: If your map does not have an objective, this command will set who wins the game when the time runs out.

arguments.label: Team
arguments.description: The team you wish to be the winner when the time runs out.

name: mp_defuser_allocation
description: This command can be used to set whether or not players should receive defusers (for free) at the start of the round, and if so, who should receive the defusers.

arguments.description:
The way defusers should be allocated at the start of the round. Possible values are:
0 - no free defusers
1 - random players
2 - all players

name: mp_disable_autokick
description: This command will stop the user with the specified userid from being autokicked. Note that this user id is not their steam ID, the user ID is the number that shows in the "status" command.

arguments.label: User ID
arguments.description: The ID of the user you wish to disable auto kick for. The user ID is the first number before a player's name in the list of players that shows when you type "status" in console.

name: mp_display_kill_assists
description: This command will set whether or not assists are shown in the killfeed. Default is yes (1).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to not display assists in the kill feed. Enter 1 here (default) to show assists in the kill feed.

name: mp_dm_bonus_length_max
description: This command sets the maximum duration of the bonus time in deathmatch. A random time between this value and mp_dm_bonus_length_min will be chosen.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The maximum duration of the bonus time (seconds).

name: voice_scale
description: This command sets the volume of voice communications (i.e. how loud all other players microphones are). Default is 1 (loudest), 0 would mute, 0.5 would be 50% volume.

arguments.description: A number between 0 and 1 to repesent how loud the voices of your teammates (or other people using microphones) should be. 0 would be muted, 1 would be loudest, 0.2 would be 20% volume.

name: +use
description: This command will prompt you to perform the "use" action on an item or object if its applicable. For example, this command will make you plant the bomb if you're on a bombsite carrying the bomb when you use it. It can also open doors if you're in front of one. It acts in a similar way to the E key on a default keyboard setup. Use the -use command afterwards, as otherwise you will not be able to use this command again.

name: -use
description: If you have previously used the +use command, you must run this command after (to deactivate it), so that you can use the +use command again.

name: addip
description: This console command bans the specified IP from the server for the specified amount of minutes. Specify 0 as the amount of minutes to ban permanently.

arguments.label: Minutes Banned
arguments.description: The number of minutes you want to ban somebody for. Use the value 0 for a permanent ban. Entering 60 here would ban someone for an hour.

arguments.label: IP Address
arguments.description: The number of minutes you want to ban somebody for. Use the value 0 for a permanent ban. Entering 60 here would ban someone for an hour.

arguments.label: IP Address
arguments.description: The IP address you want to add to the server's ban list (i.e. the IP address to ban).

name: alias
description: The alias command in CS:GO allows you to assign a longer command or commands to a custom phrase that you enter into your console.

arguments.label: Alias
arguments.description: The alias for the command(s) that you enter. In other words, the phrase that is typed into the console to run the alias commands. If you were to enter "example" (without quotes) here, typing example into the console would run the commands you specify.

arguments.label: "Command"
arguments.description: The alias for the command(s) that you enter. In other words, the phrase that is typed into the console to run the alias commands. If you were to enter "example" (without quotes) here, typing example into the console would run the commands you specify.

arguments.label: "Command"
arguments.description: The command or list of commands that you want to execute when the alias command is activated/entered into the console. If you are entering more than one command, you will need to surround the list of commands with quotation marks (") and separate each command with a semi-colon. For example, "buy ak47; buy p250;" (if you wanted to buy an AK-47 and a P250).

name: banid
description: This command will ban the user with the specified ID from the server, and add them to the banlist so that they cannot reconnect. The user ID of a user can be obtained by typing status into the console: the user ID is first number before a player's name in the list of players that is printed by that command.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: The number of minutes you want to ban the user for. Use the value 0 to permanently ban them.

arguments.label: User ID
arguments.description: The number of minutes you want to ban the user for. Use the value 0 to permanently ban them.

arguments.label: User ID
arguments.description: The user ID of the person you want to ban from the server. Find the ID of a user by typing "status" into the console. The ID is the first number before a player's name in the list of players.

name: bot_dont_shoot
description: This command can be used to prevent NPC characters (bots) from being able to fire guns.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to stop bots from being able to shoot their weapons, and 0 to allow them to fire as normal.

name: bot_kill
description: This command kills all of the bots in your selected criteria. Unlike the bot_kick command, this doesn't remove them from server, and means that all killed bots will respawn on the next round.

arguments.label: Kill Criteria
arguments.description:
Optional. You can specify any of the following here to specify the type of bot(s) you wish to kill:
Specify T or CT to kill bot(s) from the terrorist or counter-terrorist team only.
Specify a bot's name (e.g. Opie) here to kill the bot with that name.
Specify a bot's difficulty (easy, normal, hard, or expert) here to kill bot(s) with that difficulty.

name: bot_knives_only
description: This console command forces all bots on the server to use knives.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to only allow bots to use knives, and 0 to turn the command off. Enter mp_restartgame 1 after this command for it to take effect.

name: cl_backspeed
description: This console command changes how quickly your character runs backwards.

arguments.label: Movement speed
arguments.description: The higher this command, the faster you'll walk back. The highest you can set this command is 1000 without it bugging out. This makes you move faster running backwards. Setting it to 10 makes you move inch by inch when going backwards. 450 is the command's default value.

name: cl_bobamt_lat
description: This console command adjusts how much your viewmodel & gun barrel moves side to side when you're running.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value attached to how much your gun barrel moves side to side as you run. The higher the command is, the more your gun barrel moves side to side. The highest this command goes is 2 and the lowest is 0.1. Default value is 0.4

name: cl_cmdrate
description: This command sets the max number of command packets that are sent from your client to the CS:GO servers each second.

arguments.label: Packets sent
arguments.description: The max number of packets you want sent. The default for this command is 64, the maximum is 128 and the minimum is 10.

name: cl_crosshairdot
description: This command adds a dot in the center of your crosshair. If you reduce cl_crosshairsize to 0, you can set it so you only have a dot.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after the command to enable a dot crosshair, and a 0 after it to disable the dot.

name: cl_scoreboard_mouse_enable_binding
description: This command allows you to change what key turns mouse selection on while you have the scoreboard open . This is defaulted to +attack2 (usually right-click), and is what lets you use your mouse to click on people's names when you toggle open the scoreboard.

arguments.label: Bind Key
arguments.description: The key you want to bind to this command.

name: cl_spec_mode
description: This useful console command is used to save your most recent spectator mode and settings for the next time you spectate a game.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to save your current spectator settings.

name: cl_wpn_sway_scale
description: This fun command adjusts how much your gun sways when you look around with the camera. On law values the weapon will hardly move, and at high values a slight movement will have your gun flying around.

arguments.label: Sway Value
arguments.description: A number to adjust how much your weapon sways as you look around. The default value is 1.6. The higher the number, the more your weapon sways.

name: demo_gototick
description: Forces the demo you're watching to skip to a certain tick.

arguments.label: Tick
arguments.description: The tick you want your demo to skip to. Important to note that a Valve matchmaking server produces 64 ticks a second. You can enter the tick you want to skip to as a raw number (e.g. 7000) or as a minute value (e.g. 20min).

name: exit
description: This command will quit your game.

name: inferno_max_flames
description: This command is used to set the maximum number of flames that can be created from a single molotov or an incendiary grenade.

arguments.label: Max Flames
arguments.description: The max amount of flames you want to be able to spawn. Sadly, setting it to a number like 1,000 won't produce 1,000 flames when using a molotov or incendiary grenade.

name: inferno_per_flame_spawn_duration
description: This command is the time in seconds that each new flame in an incendiary grenade or molotov will try to create new flames.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The time until new flames will try and spawn more new flames. The default value for this command is 3 seconds.

name: invnext
description: This command switches to the next item in your inventory. If you have your rifle equipped it will swap to your pistol, and if you have your pistol equipped it will swap you to your knife.

name: invnextgrenade
description: This command switches what you have equipped to the next grenade in your inventory. That means if your rifle is drawn you will switch to a grenade, and then using the command again will cycle you through to the next available grenade on you.

name: invnextitem
description: This command switches to the next item in your inventory. This does not include guns, so will move between items such as your knife and grenades only.

name: invnextnongrenade
description: This command equips the next item in your inventory that isn't a grenade. It also ignores knives, so will only switch between the guns you have in your inventory.

name: invprev
description: This command works backwards through your inventory, equipping you with the item that is the previous selection of what you currently have out. That means that using this command when you have your knife out equips your pistol, and using it with your pistol out equips your rifle (if you have one).

name: m_pitch
description: This command controls the sensitivity of your Y axis . That means it only adjusts your look sensitivity when looking up or down.

arguments.label: Y Sensitivity
arguments.description: The sensitivity you want to set to your Y axis (up/down). The default value for this command is 0.022. To balance your sens on all angles, you need to use the m_yaw command that controls your X axis sensitivity.

name: m_yaw
description: This console command is used to adjust your mouse sensitivity only on the X axis , which is looking left/right.

arguments.label: X Sensitivity
arguments.description: This is the sensitivity value you want to use on the X axis. This will only change how fast you move around when looking left or right. The default value for this command is 0.022. To balance the two values, you'll need to use the m_pitch command that controls the Y axis.

name: mp_give_player_c4
description: This command sets whether or not a player (on T side) should be given a bomb at the start of the round. Default depends on gamemode, for demolition gamemodes, this setting is enabled (1).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make the C4 not be spawned. Enter 1 to make the C4 be given to a random T at the start of the round.

name: sv_maxvelocity
description: This command sets the maximum speed any moving object in the game can reach. Default is 3500. Use sv_maxspeed for player speed.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The maximum speed that any moving object can reach (regardless of other settings).

name: player_nevershow_communityservermessage
description: This console command is used to toggle between whether you want to show the custom message whenever you join a community server that has one.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to never show the welcome message in community servers, and enter a 0 to show the messages (default).

name: +showscores
description: This command will make the in game scoreboard appear. Unlike holding TAB, it will stay on your screen without you needing to press anything. Disable it with the -showscores command.

name: +zoom
description: This command will make make your AWP, or any other weapon with a scope (e.g. scout) scope in. The weapon will continue to be scoped in/out until the command -zoom is used. The command may activate the "zoom" feature of other weapons like the stab of a knife or the burst fire switch of the glock.

name: -score
description: This command hides the CS:GO scoreboard if you brought it up with a command like +score.

name: -showscores
description: This command dismisses the scoreboard if you've brought up it permanently through a command like +showscores or +score.

name: bot_freeze
description: This cheat command prevents bots (NPC characters) from being able to move.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to prevent bots from moving, and 0 to set them back to normal and resume their movement.

name: bot_loadout
description: This command sets what bots in your server will spawn with, such as particular weapon and grenade setups.

arguments.label: Weapon Codes
arguments.description: A list of weapon codes, separated by spaces. For example, to make bots spawn with an AK-47 and a flashbang, you'd enter: "ak47 flashbang". See command examples for more help.

name: bot_max_vision_distance_override
description: This command overides the max distance value that bots are set, meaning they will or won't (depending on setting) be able to see you from much further across the map than usual.

arguments.description: -1 is the default value for this command, which leaves this command off. Turn it on by replacing that value with a 1.

name: bot_mimic
description: This command, if enabled (set to 1), will make all bots relay your actions. If you jump, all bots will jump, if you shoot, all bots will shoot, etc.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here (default) for normal bot behaviour. Enter 1 here to enable bot_mimic and have all bots mimic your actions.

name: bot_stop
description: This command, if set to 1, causes bots to stop what they're doing. This means they will stop moving, shooting and all other processes until you turn the command off (by setting it to 0, which is default).

arguments.description: Enter 1 to stop all bots from doing what they're doing and stand still, and 0 to turn the command off and resume bots movement and actions back to normal.

name: callvote
description: This command brings up the option to call a vote in game, either to kick a player or to change map. You can select which vote you're calling after entering the command, and if the vote you call then receives a large majority of player votes to one side or another that decision is forced (e.g. the player you're voting to kick would be kicked if the large majority of players voted yes).

name: changelevel
description: This command is used to change the map you're playing on.

arguments.label: Map Name
arguments.description: The name of the map you want to transition to in it's technical name. Here is a full list of map codes.

name: cl_crosshair_dynamic_maxdist_splitratio
description: This console command is what determines the ratio of the inner and outer lines when using the cl_crosshairstyle 2 command.

arguments.label: Ratio
arguments.description: The ratio you want to use to determine how extreme the crosshair animation is (can only be used with cl_crosshairstyle 2, which causes your crosshair to open up when moving to convey that you'll be inaccurate if you shoot. Default value is 0.35, and you can set a ratio between 0.1-1.

name: cl_crosshair_dynamic_splitalpha_innermod
description: When using cl_crosshairstyle 2, this is the command that adjusts the transparency of the inner crosshair.

arguments.label: Alpha Value
arguments.description: The value you want to use to dictate the transparency of the inner crosshair on cl_crosshairstyle 2. The default value is 1, and you can choose a value between 0 and 1.

name: cl_crosshair_dynamic_splitalpha_outermod
description: When using cl_crosshairstyle 2, this is the command that adjusts the transparency of the outer crosshair.

arguments.label: Alpha Value
arguments.description: The value you want to use to dictate the transparency of the outer crosshair on cl_crosshairstyle 2. The default value is 0.5 and you can choose a value between 0.3 and 1.

name: cl_crosshair_dynamic_splitdist
description: When using cl_crosshairstyle 2, this command sets how far apart the two crosshairs move apart when your character model moves.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The number to adjust how much the two crosshairs move away from each other. Default value is 7.

name: cl_disablefreezecam
description: This console command is used to disable the freezecam that replays your death to you in certain servers. Some players choose to remove it to save time and reduce tilt.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to turn off the freezecam. Enter 0 to turn the freezecam back on.

name: cl_hud_background_alpha
description: This console command adjusts how transparent some areas of your HUD (heads up display) appear on your screen. An example of this is how visible the shaded box is behind your current amount of money to the left of your screen.

arguments.label: Alpha Value
arguments.description: A number between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.5. Set this higher to increase the visibility of shading on the HUD, and set this lower to make shading less visible.

name: cl_hud_bomb_under_radar
description: This command toggles whether or not your HUD (heads up display) includes the image of a bomb underneath your radar whenever you are carrying the bomb.

arguments.description: Set this command to 1 to turn on the bomb underneath the radar when you're the bomb carrier, and set it to 0 to turn the bomb image off.

name: cl_resend
description: This command sets the amount of time the game client will wait before resending a connection attempt, should the previous one have failed.

arguments.label: Wait time
arguments.description: The number of seconds you'd like the client to wait after encountering a failed connection attempt before trying to connect again. The default value for this command is 2 (seconds). You can enter a number between 1.5 and 20.

name: cl_show_clan_in_death_notice
description: This console command determines whether or not a player's clan tag shows up in your kill feed. By default this is turned on, but it can be turned off.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after this command to show clan tags of player's in the kill feed, and use a 0 to turn clan tags off in the feed.

name: inferno_flame_spacing
description: This console command changes the distance between separate flame spawns when using molotov and incendiary grenades.

arguments.label: Spacing
arguments.description: The distance you want between flame spawns. The default value for this command is 42.

name: joystick_force_disabled_set_from_options
description: Sets external controllers you've connected to the game enabled or disabled, depending on the command's setting. This command manually changes the selected option for whether controllers are enabled in the game settings, too.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to enable a controller, and a 0 after the command to disable being able to use controllers.

name: key_findbinding
description: This console command produces a list in your developer console of what certain keys are bound to, such as the B key on your keyboard being bound to opening the buy menu.

arguments.label: Bind Key
arguments.description: The key that you want to see what is bound to. This command works best when entering letters from your keyboard (D, S, T, etc) so see if it shows up with those.

name: kick
description: This command is used to kick, or to vote to kick, a certain player in the game, that you specifiy by entering their username.

arguments.label: Username
arguments.description: The username of the player you want to kick.

name: kill
description: This command will kill your character instantly, whatever health they are on.

name: m_customaccel
description: This command is used to choose what level of custom mouse acceleration you have. It can be set to disabled, or from a couple of choices.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after the command to turn custom acceleration off (default). Enter a 1 after the command to turn on custom max acceleration, meaning your camera will move faster the quicker you move your mouse. Enter a 2 after this command to turn on custom mouse acceleration, but for your X and Y axis sensitivity to be set by the m_pitch and m_yaw commands respectively. Enter a 3 after the command to turn on custom mouse acceleration, but for the mouse acceleration to be affected by your sensitivity .

name: m_customaccel_exponent
description: This is the command that sets what speed you need to be moving your mouse before the custom mouse acceleration kicks in, if you have that command enabled too.

arguments.label: Start Point
arguments.description: This is the value that dictates when your mouse acceleration begins speeding up your mouse. The higher you set this command, the sooner its activated, and the more out-of-control your mouse becomes. The default value for this command is 1.05.

name: m_customaccel_max
description: This is the console command that determines the limit for how fast your mouse can move depending on how fast you're moving it in real life. It can be set to have no limit.

arguments.label: Max Point
arguments.description: This value is used to determine the cut off point of you moving your mouse when the mouse movement in game will no longer get sped up. The default value for this command is 0, which sets there to be no limit.

name: m_customaccel_scale
description: This is the command that determines what the value is for the custom mouse acceleration command. The higher this is, the faster your mouse acceleration will be.

arguments.label: Scale
arguments.description: How high or low you want your mouse acceleration to be. The default value for this command is 0.04.

name: m_mouseaccel1
description: This console command sets the mouse acceleration value for its initial threshold, up to 2x movement speed.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value you want to set mouse acceleration to for the initial speed threshold (up to 2x). The default value for this command is 0.

name: m_mouseaccel2
description: This console command sets the mouse acceleration value for its second threshold, up to 4x movement speed.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value you want to set mouse acceleration to for the second speed threshold (up to 4x). The default value for this command is 0.

name: m_mousespeed
description: This is the command used to set your preferences for Windows mouse acceleration.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to turn it off. Enter a 1 after the command to turn on windows mouse acceleration and turn on the initial threshold value set in the m_mouseaccel1 command. Enter a 2 after this command to turn on windows mouse acceleration and turn on the secondary threshold, set by the m_mouseaccel2 command.

name: mp_halftime
description: This command sets whether or not teams are switched at half time. Default is 1, which is enabled.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable team switching at half time. Enter 1 to enable team switching at half time (default).

name: mp_halftime_duration
description: This command sets the duration of half time, in seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The duration of half time, in seconds. Default is 15.

name: unbindall
description: This command removes all binds from all keys. Note that this will remove binds from keys like W, A, S and D, so you won't be able to move until re-binding.

name: bot_kick
description: This console command is used to kick bots from the server. You can select from kicking all bots, a certain team's bots, or only bots of a certain difficulty depending on what values you enter with the command.

arguments.label: Kick Criteria
arguments.description:
Optional. You can specify any of the following here to specify the type of bot(s) you wish to kick:
Specify T or CT to kick bot(s) from the terrorist or counter-terrorist team only.
Specify a bot's name (e.g. Opie) here to kick the bot with that name.
Specify a bot's difficulty (easy, normal, hard, or expert) here to kick bot(s) with that difficulty.

name: bot_place
description: This will spawn a bot on your server based on where your player model is standing. You don't need to add anything additional to this command - its plain form will spawn a bot in front of you. You sometimes need to enter this command a few times for it to place a bot.

name: buddha
description: Entering this command toggles buddha mode on and off. Buddha mode means that you still take damage when shot, but you can't die. When you reach 0 hp your health bar will show 1 hp, no matter how much you keep getting shot. It works very similarly to the "god" command to toggle god mode.

name: buyrandom
description: This console command purchases a random primary and secondary weapon. You do need the funds to make the purchase though, meaning this command is mainly used in deathmatch and other servers where you have unlimited money.

name: cash_player_killed_enemy_factor
description: This command sets how much money is earned or lost by killing an enemy player with one of the main weapons (default pistols, primary rifles like the AK/M4, etc)

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money a player earns or loses when killing an enemy. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount of money lost whenever you kill a player.

name: cl_crosshairusealpha
description: Adjusts the transparency of your crosshair.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to reduce crosshair transparency, and set it to 1 to increase its transparency.

name: cl_disable_ragdolls
description: This command is used to turn ragdolling off, something that can sometimes cause dead bodies to behave weirdly as it attempts to display the animation in a more detailed way.

arguments.description: Use the value1 after the command to disable ragdolling, and 0 to turn the effect back on.

name: cl_drawhud
description: This command can be used to completely hide all features of your HUD (heads up display) or to enable them to show again.

arguments.description: Add a 1 after the command to turn the HUD on, and a 0 to hide all aspects of the HUD.

name: cl_maxrenderable_dist
description: This command allows you to set the max distance from the camera that an object can be rendered onto your screen.

arguments.label: Render Distance
arguments.description: The maximum distance away from you that you want objects to be rendered. Set to a lower value for objects to potentially render late, and a high value for objects to render as soon as possible. High values could cause performance drops for players on older computers.

name: cl_radar_square_with_scoreboard
description: This command decided whether the radar is a square or a circle whenever you toggle the scoreboard open.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to make the radar shape change to a square when you open the scoreboard. Enter a 0 to keep the radar a circle whenever you open the scoreboard. The default value is 1 (square).

name: cl_showhelp
description: This console command controls showing on-screen help tips while you're in game. You can turn this off in the settings menu and also with this command.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to turn off in-game help pointers, and enter a 1 after the command to show in-game help (default).

name: cl_spec_stats
description: This command is used to hide or show stats in spectator mode, something many observers choose to hide.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after this command to turn spectator stats off, and a 1 after the command to turn them on (default).

name: crosshair
description: You can use this console command to toggle whether or not your crosshair is visible in game.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after the command to hide your crosshair, and a 1 to make it appear again.

name: demo_listhighlights
description: This command produces a list of the highlights data extracted from the demo you're watching. Data will be pasted into your developer console.

name: demo_listimportantticks
description: Use this command for a list of the ticks that the game client determined to be important in a specific demo.

name: rcon
description: This command will issue the specified rcon command (i.e. issues the specified command on your server). Rcon means remote console - it allows you to execute server commands from the client.

arguments.label: Command
arguments.description: The command you wish to run using rcon (run on the server).

name: rcon_address
description: The IP address of the remote console you wish to connect to (default is the address of your own server). Change this only if the rcon address for the server you are connected to is different from the server's IP.

arguments.label: IP Address
arguments.description: The remote IP address you wish to use for rcon.

name: rcon_password
description: This command will authenticate you for rcon with the specified password.

arguments.label: Password
arguments.description: The password for rcon on your server.

name: sv_noclipspeed
description: This command sets the speed multiplier for noclip mode. With this set to 5 (default) you can reach speeds 5 times as fast as those set by sv_maxspeed.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount to multiply the server's player max speed by for those in noclip mode.

name: voice_forcemicrecord
description: This command, if set to 0, will make CS:GO not use your operating system's device set as the default microphone device.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make CS:GO not use the device set as default microphone in your operating system. Set to 1 to use default operating system microphone (default, recommended setting).

name: voice_loopback
description: This command, if set to 1, will make your microphone playback via your speakers (i.e. you will hear your microphone). Default is 0 (disabled). Usually there is a little delay, this is normal.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not use voice loopback, you will not hear your microphone be played back to you. Set to 1 to hear your microphone output be played through your speakers.

name: voice_loopback
description: This command, if set to 1, will make your microphone playback via your speakers (i.e. you will hear your microphone). Default is 0 (disabled). Usually there is a little delay, this is normal.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not use voice loopback, you will not hear your microphone be played back to you. Set to 1 to hear your microphone output be played through your speakers.

name: voice_threshold
description: This command sets the volume theshold at which your microphone will be enabled if you are using voice activation. In other words, when your microphone is louder than this value, it will be transmitted in-game.

arguments.label: Threshold
arguments.description: The volume theshold to activate your microphone at (when on voice activation).

name: bot_allow_grenades
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use grenades. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_machine_guns
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use machine guns. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_pistols
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use pistols. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_rifles
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use rifles. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_rogues
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to "go rogue" randomly, when bots are rogue, they don't respond to radio commands. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_shotguns
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use shotguns. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_snipers
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use sniper rifles. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_allow_sub_machine_guns
description: This command, if set to 1, allows bots to use SMGs. Default is 1, set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow, set to 1 to allow (default).

name: bot_coop_idle_max_vision_distance
description: This command sets the maximum distance at which bots can see enemies in cooperative missions when they are idle, dormant, hiding or asleep.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: A number - the distance they can spot enemies at when idle in cooperative missions. Default 1400.

name: bot_ignore_players
description: This command, if set to 1, will make bots be unable to see/react to players that aren't bots. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 1 to stop bots from being able to see you, and 0 to turn their vision back on to full.
Enter 1 to stop bots from being able to see you, and 0 to turn their vision back on to full.
Set to 0 to make bots not ignore players. Set to 1 to make bots ignore players.

name: cameraman_override
description: This command (if set to 1) will make you override the primary camera man, provided you are the secondary camera man.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to override primary camera man as secondary camera man. Set to 0 to disable.

name: mp_damage_headshot_only
description: Turning this command on means that damage to other players can only be done through headshots. Time to test your aim.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to enable it and turn on headshot only mode. Enter a 0 after the command to disable the command (default).

name: +alt1
description: This command activates the ALT1 (left ALT) key on your keyboard (the same as holding down the ALT key). Use -alt1 to deactivate.

name: +alt2
description: This command activates the ALT2 (right ALT) key on your keyboard (the same as holding down the ALT key). Use -alt2 to deactivate.

name: +attack
description: This console command causes you to attack repeatedly. Use the command -attack to stop this. If you have a gun equipped while using this command it will make you fire until you need to reload.

name: +attack2
description: This command will activate your secondary attack repeatedly. To stop this, use the -attack2 command. For example, this command makes you scope in with an AWP, or stab if you have your knife out.

name: +back
description: This command will make your character move backwards continuously. Type -back into your console to disable this.

name: +break
description: This command wil activate the break key on your keyboard. Usually called "Pause / Break". This command does not work with most keyboard formats.

name: +duck
description: This movement console command will make your character crouch, similarly to how holding the left CTRL key on a keyboard works. -duck will make you stand up again.

name: +forward
description: This movement command makes your character move forward infinitely. Use -forward to disable this.

name: +graph
description: This console command brings up a graph on your screen displaying stats like FPS, ping and choke. It is similar to using your net graph.

name: +jump
description: This movement command causes your character to jump once into the air. It will also unbind your jump key, so enter -jump into your console to fix this.

name: +movedown
description: This command only works in noclip mode and in demos: this command will make you (or your free-roam camera in demos) move downwards. Use -movedown to stop moving downwards.

name: +moveleft
description: This command will make your character move to the left. The -moveleft console command will stop your character from moving to the left after running this command.

name: +moveright
description: This command will make your character move to the right. The -moveright console command will stop your character from moving to the left after running this command.

name: +moveup
description: This command only works in noclip mode and in demos: this command will make you (or your free-roam camera in demos) move upwards. Use -moveup to stop moving upwards.

name: +reload
description: This command will prompt your character to reload their weapon if any bullets have been fired, and if not deactivated, will cause your character to reload instantly after firing a single bullet. Deactivate this command with the -reload command.

name: +right
description: This command makes your camera spin endlessly to the right. Using the command -right will stop this effect.

name: +score
description: This command will bring up the match scoreboard that displays statistics such as kills, deaths, and how many MVP medals each player has. Use the command -score to hide the scoreboard.

name: -alt1
description: This command will deactivate the alt1 key, which is usually activated with the +alt1 command.

name: -alt2
description: This console command stops the action that the command +alt2 commands.

name: -attack
description: This is the command needed to stop firing or attacking if you've the +attack command.
