name: -attack2
description: This is the command you need to stop the infinite attack cycle that +attack2 causes, such as repeatedly stabbing if you have your knife equipped.

name: -back
description: Using this console command stops your character walking backwards if you previously used the +back command.

name: -duck
description: If you're crouched, this cheat command will make you stand back up.

name: -forward
description: This is the command to use to stop your character walking forward if you've got them in an endless movement cycle.

name: -graph
description: This cheat command will dismiss the statistics graph that can be summoned by using the +graph command.

name: -movedown
description: This command will deactivate the +movedown command (will stop you or your camera from moving downwards).

name: -moveleft
description: This cheat command stops your character from moving if they've been set to move endlessly to the left.

name: -moveright
description: This command prevents your character from moving any further if they've been set to move endlessly to the right.

name: -moveup
description: This command will deactivate the +moveup command (will stop you or your camera from moving upwards).

name: -reload
description: This command will deactivate the +reload command (as after using the +reload command, you will instantly reload after firing any bullets).

name: -right
description: This console command stops your camera from spinning in circles if you've set it to rotate endlessly to the right.

name: -speed
description: This command will return the speed of your character back to running speed/normal if you've slowed it down with a command like +speed.

name: -strafe
description: This command disables the effect from the +strafe command, where your mouse will move your character sideways rather than look around with the camera.

name: -zoom
description: This command breaks the infinite loop cycle of scoping in and out on a scoped weapon like the AWP or stabbing with your knife that +zoom causes.

name: bot_crouch
description: This command, if set to 1, will make all bots in the game crouch. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make bots not crouch (default). Set to 1 to make all bots crouch.

name: bot_join_team
description: This console command is used to set which team bots should join when adding more to a server with the "bot_add" command. You can choose between Terrorist side, Counter-Terroists or any team.

arguments.label: T / CT / Any
arguments.description:
The team that any bots that are added with "bot_add" (or a similar command) should join by default. The values you can choose from are:
T
CT
Any

name: bot_quota_mode
description: The mode that the number of bots should be controlled by. Options are: normal, fill and match. Normal is normal behaviour. Fill will fill the server with as many bots as "bot_quota" is set to. Match will keep a 1 human : bot_quota ratio of bots.

arguments.label: Mode
arguments.description:
The quota mode to set bots in. Options are:
normal
fill - the amount of bots in the server will be the same as bot_quota
match - the ratio of humans to bots will me maintained as 1 human:bot_quota (where bot_quota is the amount set with the bot_quota command)

name: bot_randombuy
description: This command clears the preference settings of what bots are programmed to buy, and instead casues them to purchase items randomly with the money they have.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to make your bots buy items randomly, and 0 to turn the command off and return their buying habits to normal.

name: bot_snipers_only
description: This cheat command restricts bots to only be able to use sniper rifles, such as the AWP.

name: bot_zombie
description: Puts bots into zombie mode, causing them idle and not to attack or fire their guns.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to make bots idle and not attack anybody, and 0 to turn this command off and allow them to attack enemies.

name: buymenu
description: This command will show or hide the buy menu, as long as you are standing in the buy zone and are within the time limit to buy items. It works similarly as pressing B on a default keyboard setup.

name: c_maxdistance
description: This command controls how far away your camera be at a maximum from your camera in third person mode. Set c_mindistance to the same value to avoid third person camera stuttering.

arguments.label: Maximum distance
arguments.description: The maximum distance you want your third person camera to be from your character.

name: c_mindistance
description: This command controls how close the minimum distance your camera can be away from your character when in third person mode. Set c_maxdistance to the same value to avoid third person camera stuttering.

arguments.label: Minimum distance
arguments.description: The minimum distance that your camera can be from your player.

name: cash_team_elimination_bomb_map
description: This console command sets how much money each team member earns when they eliminate all 5 enemies in a bomb defusal map , like Mirage or Dust II.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money each team member earns for winning a round in a bomb defusal map. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount taken from each player.

name: cl_bobup
description: Adjusts how much your viewmodel & weapon bobs up when running.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value attached to your viewmodel bobbing up and down. The default is set at 0.5.

name: cl_fixedcrosshairgap
description: This console command alters the gap inbetween the pips (the four lines that form a crosshair) when using the fixed crosshair.

arguments.label: Gap
arguments.description: A number that determines how large the gap in your crosshair is. The larger the number, the larger the crosshair gap. The default value is 3.

name: cl_freezecameffects_showholiday
description: This command is used to set whether or not the freezecam (kill cam) is decorated in a festive theme, such as with snow around to commemorate Christmas.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after the command to turn on festive freezecams, and a 0 to turn it off. These may not work on every server.

name: cl_showloadout
description: Use this console command to toggle between showing your current loadout or not. This includes your weapons and grenades that show up in the bottom left of your screen.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to show your loadout, and a 0 to hide your loadout.

name: cl_spec_follow_grenade_key
description: This console command is used by observers or anybody spectating the game. It assigns a key that you can press to follow the trajectory of a grenade as it's being thrown.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 to set the follow grenade command to your left ALT key (LALT), enter a 1 to set it to your left shift (LSHIFT) button, and use a 2 to set it to +reload.

name: cl_spec_show_bindings
description: You can use this console command in spectator mode to toggle a list of the spectator binds that are possible to set up.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn on the list of spectator binds (default), and enter a 0 to hide the display.

name: getpos
description: This command would print your current location to the console (both position and camera angle) as setpos and setang commands. Using these commands will return you to the position you are at when you typed the getpos command.

name: getpos_exact
description: This command would print to the console your origin and camera angle to the console.

name: inferno_initial_spawn_interval
description: This command sets how long it takes for a molotov or incendiary grenade to bloom out and reach its maximum spread. If you set this value higher than the time the molotov is active, it will never reach its full size and stay contained to just a small section of where you threw it.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The time it takes for the molotov/incendiary grenade to spread to its entire reach. The default value for this command is 0.02 (seconds).

name: inferno_max_child_spawn_interval
description: Use this command to set the longest period of time that can pass before a molotov or incendiary grenade's child flames spawn.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The max time it will take for a grenade's child flames to spawn in second. The higher you set this, the longer it takes. Default value for this command is 0.5.

name: joy_sidesensitivity
description: This is a joystick command that sets what sensitivity your sideways camera movement uses. The higher you set this value, the less you need to move the joystick to look sideways.

arguments.label: Sensitivity
arguments.description: The sensitivity of sideways movements on your joystick. The default value for this command is 1.

name: load
description: This command allows you to load a saved file. You can use this when you're not in multiplayer to bring up a demo file of yours or something similar.

arguments.label: Game Name
arguments.description: The file name of the game you want to load.

name: writeid
description: This command saves the list of user IDs that have been banned to banned_user.cfg, so that the bans apply even after the server restarts.

name: writeip
description: This command saves the list of IPs that have been banned to banned_ip.cfg, so that the bans apply even after the server restarts.

name: mp_buy_allow_guns
description: This console command adjusts the rules in your server on what guns players can purchase.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to limit players to only buying pistols. Enter a 2 to limit players to only buying SMGs. Enter a 4 to limit players to only buying rifles. Enter a 8 to limit players to only buying shotguns. Enter a 16 to limit players to only buying sniper rifles. Enter a 32 to limit players to only buying heavy machine guns (e.g. the negev.) Enter a 255 to allow players to purchase anything (default).

name: +speed
description: This console command will slow down the movement speed of your character. Type the command -speed to return your movement speed back to normal.

name: +strafe
description: This command prevents your mouse from being able to adjust where your player model is looking. Instead, your mouse will cause you to move to the side, or strafe. Turn this off with the -strafe command.

name: +voicerecord
description: This a useful console command that, when activated, will start continuously transmitting what you say to your teammates in game, meaning you don't need to hold down a mic hotkey. The command -voicerecord disables this command and stops transmitting what you say to your team. Check our examples for a way to bind this to a key.

name: -voicerecord
description: This console command will stop transmitting voice communication if you've used a command that lets you communicate without holding down a hotkey. Check the examples for a bind to toggle between transmitting voice and not doing so.

name: ammo_338mag_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .338 MAG ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level. This ammo is used only by the AWP.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with .338 MAG ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_357sig_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .357 SIG ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level. This ammo is used by the: P228, P250 and P2000. The P250, however, has a value that's set/overriden by the ammo_357sig_p250_max command.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with .357 SIG ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_357sig_min_max
description: This command sets the clip size (amount of bullets before you need to reload) for guns with .357 SIG ammo. If this value is lower than the default, this is the amount you will receive in your clip when you respawn with, or buy guns with this ammo. If higher than the default, you will need to top-up your clip with the givecurrentammo command.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum camount of bullets guns with .357 SIG ammo should be able to have in their clip at any given time.

name: ammo_357sig_p250_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for the P250 (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo the P250 should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_357sig_small_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .357 SIG ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level. This ammo is used by the: P228, P250 and P2000. The P250, however, has a value that's set/overriden by the ammo_357sig_p250_max command.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of bullets the P250 can have in its clip at any given time.

name: ammo_45acp_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .45 ACP ammo (the amount of extra bullets you carry to reload with). This is also the amount of ammo that you will respawn with/receive when you buy a gun. This ammo is used by the: MAC-10, UMP45 and the USP-S. The USP-S, however

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with .45 ACP ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_50AE_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with .50 AE ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_556mm_box_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo 5.56mm ammo boxes should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_556mm_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with 5.56mm ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_556mm_small_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of "small" guns with 5.56mm ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_57mm_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with .57mm ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_762mm_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with 762mm ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_9mm_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with .50 AE ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with 9mm ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_buckshot_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ammo you can carry for guns with buckshot ammo (the amount of extra bullets you spawn with/receive when you buy a gun, that you can reload with). If this value is lower than the default amount, you will spawn with this amount of extra ammo. If this is higher than the default amount that you spawn with, you will need to use the givecurrentammo command to top your ammo up to its new maximum level.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of extra ammo guns with buckshot ammo should be able to carry at any given time.

name: ammo_grenade_limit_default
description: This command sets the amount of any grenade type that isn't a flashbang you can carry at a given time, provided you have room in your grenade slots. With this at 1 (default) you could carry only 1 HE grenade at any given time, with this at 2, you could carry 2 HE grenades at any given time, etc.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of a grenade type (that isn't a flashbang), that you can carry at any given time.

name: ammo_grenade_limit_flashbang
description: This command sets the maximum amount of flashbangs you can buy/carry at any given time.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of flashbangs that you can carry at any given time.

name: ammo_grenade_limit_total
description: This command sets the maximum total amount of grenades you can carry at any given time. With this at 3, you can only carry a total of three grenades at any given time.

arguments.label: Maximum Amount
arguments.description: The maximum total amount of grenades you can carry on your person at any given time.

name: bot_all_weapons
description: Using this command will allow bots on a private server to use all weapons if the option to do so has been disabled.

name: bot_chatter
description: This command sets the rules for what the bots can say in game. Possible values are "off", "radio", "minimal", or "normal".

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The rule you want your bots speech to be set to. Choose from "off", "radio", "minimal", or "normal".

name: bot_show_battlefront
description: This command highlights the areas of the map where rushing bots (and players if they run straight from spawn) from both teams will encounter each first. This is areas such as A Ramp and the Window in mid on Mirage. It can be useful to see where you will encounter enemies when rushing, though it does need cheats enabled.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to enable the highlights on your screen to show areas where rushing players will meet, and 0 to turn this effect off.

name: cash_player_bomb_defused
description: This command changes how much money a player earns for defusing the bomb. It can't give more than the max amount of money you can hold in a specific server.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of cash gained or lost by defusing the bomb. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that money lost when defusing

name: cash_player_bomb_planted
description: This cheat command alters how much money a player gets for planting the bomb. You can't earn more than the max money on a specific server.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of cash gained by planting the bomb. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that money lost when planting the bomb.

name: cash_player_bomb_planted
description: This cheat command alters how much money a player gets for planting the bomb. You can't earn more than the max money on a specific server.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of cash gained by planting the bomb. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that money lost when planting the bomb.

name: cash_player_killed_teammate
description: This cheat command sets how much money is earned or lost for killing a teammate.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The money you earn or lose for killing a teammate. Using a minus sign (-) before the number sets the command to take money from a player when they kill a teammate.

name: cash_player_rescued_hostage
description: Sets the money earned or lost for rescuing a hostage safely in hostage mode.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The money earned or lost for rescuing a hostage. Use a minus sign (-) before the value to have rescuing a hostage cost players money, and enter the number without a minus sign to make it award players.

name: cash_team_elimination_hostage_map_ct
description: This console command sets how much money each team member earns on the CT side when they eliminate all 5 Terrorists on a hostage map.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: This is the amount of money each CT earns for winning a round on a hostage map by elimation. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount taken from each player instead of earned.

name: cash_team_elimination_hostage_map_t
description: This command sets how much money each Terrorist earns for winning a round in a hostage map by elimination.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: This is the amount of money each T earns for winning a round on a hostage map by elimation. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount taken from each player instead of earned.

name: cash_team_hostage_alive
description: This command sets the amount of money earned or lost for a hostage surviving a round. The default is $0.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: This is the amount of money each team earns when a hostage survives the whole round. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount taken from each player instead of earned.

name: cash_team_hostage_interaction
description: This console command chooses how much money is earned or lost for a player interacting with a hostage.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: This is the amount of money each player earns when interacting with a hostage. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount taken from each player instead of earned.

name: cash_team_loser_bonus
description: This command sets the base cash earned by a team for losing a round. This then rises in set increments, which is controlled by a separate command.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: This is the amount of money each player earns after losing their first round since a win. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount taken from each player instead of earned.

name: cash_team_loser_bonus_consecutive_rounds
description: This console command sets the cash increase for a string of losses to climb by. Having this value at $500 (default) means each consecutive lost round awards $500 more than the previous to the losing team, up until 5 lost rounds in a row.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: This is the amount of money that is added onto the round bonus for losing consecutive rounds, capped at a total of 5 lost rounds. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have reduce the cash earned by your desired value.

name: cash_team_planted_bomb_but_defused
description: This command sets the amount of money the Terrorist team earns for planting a bomb that is ultimately defused. This stacks along with the round loss bonus. The default value is $800.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money that the Terrorist team earns for planting the bomb if it is then defused by the CT's. Use a minus sign (-) before the number you enter to make the T side lose that amount on this event.

name: cl_clanid
description: This console command will generate a unique ID based on the current clan tag you have active. If you aren't displaying a clan tag, the command won't do anything.

name: cl_dm_buyrandomweapons
description: When this command is enabled, each time you spawn in deathmatch you will have a random weapon.

arguments.description: Enter 1 here to enable random weapons on spawn in DM. Enter 0 to disable random weapons (default).

name: cl_freezecampanel_position_dynamic
description: This command adjusts whether freezecams (kill cams) show movement in its kill panel. By default this is set to on.

arguments.description: Use a 0 after this command to turn it off, and a 1 to turn the panel movement back on again.

name: cl_game_mode_convars
description: Use this command to produce a list of the active convars in your current game server, such as bot difficulty and the game mode you're playing.

name: cl_jiggle_bone_debug
description: This command shows the player debugging information related to the bone physics in NPCs and other character models. It will create light beams showing how each bone is working at that time, so is useful for fixing issues with physics.

arguments.description: Use a 1 to turn this command on and display bone information. Use a 0 to turn it off. Default value is 0 (off).

name: cl_observercrosshair
description: This is the console command that controls whether or not you have a crosshair when spectating/observing players.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to enable having a crosshair when observing, and 0 to disable it.

name: cl_ragdoll_gravity
description: This console command dictates the gravity that controls the physics of ragdolls (death animations).

arguments.label: Gravity Value
arguments.description: A number to represent how much gravity you want influencing ragdolling. The default value is 600. The lower the value, the less gravity used.

name: cl_reload_hud
description: This command is used to reset the HUD scale back to default, and tweaks the border settings back to their original value.

name: clear_anim_cache
description: This command wipes (clears) the animation cache, which frees up its memory until the next time you need to streaming animblock.

name: clear_debug_overlays
description: This command is used to wipe (clear) all the debug overlays active.

name: demolist
description: Prints the demo sequence list in your developer console for you to see.

name: demos
description: This command returns you to the homescreen of CS:GO, though in some cases it can crash your game .

name: inferno_spawn_angle
description: This console command adjusts the angle from which child flames burn to their parent. You can use it to edit slightly the way that molotovs spread when they burn.

arguments.label: Degrees
arguments.description: The angle in degrees that the child flames burn based off their parents position. The default value for this command is 45 degrees.

name: inferno_surface_offset
description: This command edits the surface offset used in incendiary grenades and molotovs when they hit the ground and begin burning.

arguments.label: Offset
arguments.description: The desired offset you want your fire grenades to burn at. The default value for this command is 20.

name: joy_response_move
description: This console command sets the movement stick reponse mode on a joystick.

arguments.description: The number you enter will be assigned with a certain setting. See our examples column for a list of these.

name: key_updatelayout
description: Use this console command to update your in game keyboard layout to match your current keyboard layout on windows.

name: light_crosshair
description: This command prints the luxel value of your crosshair in the console.

name: listdemo
description: When in a demo file, putting this command into your console will show you a list of the contents in this particular demo.

name: slot0
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 0.

name: slot1
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 1.

name: slot10
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 10.

name: slot11
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 11.

name: slot2
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 2.

name: slot3
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 3.

name: slot4
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 4.

name: slot5
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 5.

name: slot6
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 6.

name: slot7
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 7.

name: slot8
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 8.

name: slot9
description: This command switches your active slot (what you are holding in your hand) to slot 9.

name: voice_mute
description: This command mutes the user with the specified ID. Find the ID of a user with the voice_show_mute command.

arguments.label: Player #
arguments.description: The player # of the user you wish to mute, find player numbers by typing "voice_show_mute" (without quotes) into the console.

name: voice_show_mute
description: This command prints a list of players (with their player #s) who can be muted.

name: voice_unmute
description: This command unmutes a player who you have previously muted with the voite_mute command. Use voice_reset_mutelist to reset all mutes.

arguments.label: Player #
arguments.description: The player number of the user you wish to unmute. Find player numbers with the voice_show_mute command.

name: mp_anyone_can_pickup_c4
description: This console command allows any player, T or CT, to pick up the C4 if it's on the ground.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after the command to turn it off, and only allow T's to pick up the C4, and enter a 1 after the command to turn it on and allow anybody to pick up the bomb.

name: mp_c4_cannot_be_defused
description: This console command sets whether or not the C4 can be defused once it has been planted.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on and make it impossible to defuse the C4 (bomb), and a 0 after the command to turn it off (default).

name: mp_consecutive_loss_max
description: This command is used to set how many rounds in a row it takes for teams to start earning the max loss bonus.

arguments.label: Rounds Lost
arguments.description: The number of rounds lost in a row it takes before max lose bonus kicks in. The default value for this command is 4.

name: mp_coop_force_join_ct
description: When this command is turned on, whenever a real player joins the server (not a NPC), they will auto join the CT side.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to enable it and force new players to join the CT side, and enter a 0 after this command to disable it (default).

name: mp_coopmission_bot_difficulty_offset
description: This command sets the difficulty offset modifier for bots during co-op missions only.

arguments.label: Offset
arguments.description: How much you want to offset the difficulty of bots. The default value for this command is 0 (off).

name: mp_death_drop_taser
description: This console command is used to decide whether or not the taser (zeus) is dropped when a player dies.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn on the command and allow tasers (zeus') to be dropped on death (default). Enter a 0 after the command to turn it off and not let tasers drop on death.

name: +camdistance
description: Third person mode only command. This command will put your client in "cam distance mode", when in cam distance mode, moving your mouse will zoom the camera in and out (changing the camera distance).

name: +camin
description: Third person mode only command. This command will zoom your camera as close-in as it possibly can zoom to your player (or the player you're spectating).

name: +cammousemove
description: This command will stop your mouse movements from controling your player, allowing you to move the camera to a different position. For example, you could move the camera in front of the player after enabling this command: if this command was not enabled, your player would rotate as you move your mouse. Use -cammousemove to re-activate normal behaviour.

name: +camout
description: Third person mode only command. This command will move your camera as far out as it possibly can be from your character (or the player you're spectating). Use -camout to revert to normal.

name: +campitchdown
description: Third person mode only. This command will set your camera's pitch value (the pitch axis, aka the up/down axis) to its lowest possible value, making your camera face the player from the ground. Use -campitchdown to restore to normal.

name: +campitchup
description: Third person mode only. This command will set your camera's pitch value (the pitch axis, aka the up/down axis) to its highest possible value, making your camera face the player from the sky. Use -campitchup to restore to normal.

name: +camyawleft
description: Third person mode only. This command will rotate your camera in a leftwards direction around your character along its yaw axis (left/right). Use -camyawleft to restore to normal.

name: +camyawright
description: Third person mode only. This command will rotate your camera in a rightwards direction around your character along its yaw axis (left/right). Use -camyawright to restore to normal.

name: +commandermousemove
description: This command will move the mouse of the Commander from the "Weapons Course", which has since been removed from the game.

name: +jlook
description: This console command allows you to use a joystick to move your camera.

name: +klook
description: This command prevents you from being able to move forward with your keyboard. Use the -klook command to disable it.

name: +left
description: This command causes your camera to endlessly rotate in a left direction. Using the -left command will end the cycle.

name: +mat_texture_list
description: Toggles a display of the textures in the game. This command can frequently crash your CS:GO client, so use with caution.

name: +showbudget
description: This console command brings up a display panel on your screen that displays various technical statistics about CS:GO and your network. Entering -showbudget will hide the panel.

name: +showbudget_texture
description: Using this cheat command brings up a display on the left side of your screen that displays statistics about your game textures on a per frame basis. These include skybox textures, world textures and more. -showbudget_texture will hide this graph.

name: +showbudget_texture_global
description: This command will summon a technical display onto your screen giving you detailed statistics on textures in CS:GO. You can dismiss is with the -showbudget_texture_global command.

name: +showvprof
description: This cheat command will cause you to open the VPROF display in CS:GO, giving you statistics on the game, world rendering and displacement rendering. Hide it with the command -showvprof.

name: +vgui_drawtree
description: This console command causes a graph to appear on the right side of your screen display an assortment of technical statistics about CS:GO's rendering and popups. The command -vgui_drawtree will hide the display.

name: -break
description: This command wil activate the break key on your keyboard. Usually called "Pause / Break". This command does not work with most keyboard formats.

name: -camdistance
description: Third person mode only command. This command will take your client out of "cam distance mode", when in cam distance mode, moving your mouse will zoom the camera in and out (changing the camera distance). By disabling this mode, your mouse will control the angle/rotation of the camera around the player.

name: -camin
description: Third person mode only command. This command zoom your camera back to its original position, if you have previously ran the "+camin" command.

name: -cammousemove
description: Provided you have previously used the +cammousemove, this command will make your player be controlled by your mouse movements (as well as the camera) again.

name: -camout
description: Provided you have previously used the +camout command, this command will restore your camera to its previous position.

name: -campitchdown
description: This command will restore your camera to its previous position, provided you have previously ran the +campitchdown command.

name: -campitchup
description: This command will restore your camera to its previous position, provided you have previously ran the +campitchup command.

name: -camyawleft
description: This command will stop your camera from attempting to move left as a result of the +camyawleft command.

name: -camyawright
description: This command will stop your camera from attempting to move rightas a result of the +camyawright command.

name: -commandermousemove
description: This command will stop the mouse of the commander (from the Weapons Course) moving.

name: -jlook
description: This cheat command can be used to prevent a joystick that you may have plugged into your computer from being able to adjust where the in game camera is looking.

name: -jump
description: This command will deactivate the effect of the +jump command.

name: -klook
description: This command will allow you to move forward using your keyboard if you've purposefully or accidentally disabled that function.

name: -left
description: This is the console command that will stop your camera from rotating to the left on an unlimited loop, such as the command +left does.

name: -mat_texture_list
description: This command hides the display of CS:GO textures that +mat_texture_list brings up. Both commands can frequently cause CS:GO to crash though, so use carefully.

name: -showbudget
description: This command is used to dismiss the show budget graph that is brought up with the command +showbudget.

name: -showbudget_texture
description: This is the command used to dismiss the statistics panel that +showbudget_texture summons.

name: -showbudget_texture_global
description: This console command is what will dismiss the panel that +showbudget_texture_global will put on your screen.

name: -showvprof
description: Hides the graph produced when using the +showvprof command.

name: -vgui_drawtree
description: This command dismisses the display produced by the +vgui_drawtree.

name: _autosave
description: This command saves your game in certain single-player instances of CS:GO.

name: _bugreporter_restart
description: This command restarts the bug reporter .dll

name: _resetgamestats
description: This console command will wipe your current game stats and start a new file for you, so don't use if you want to keep your stats in tact.

name: achievement_debug
description: When sv_cheats 1 is on this command will turn on achievement debug messages.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to turn on achievement debug messages. Enter a 1 here to turn them off.

name: achievement_disable
description: This console command turns off in-game achievements in CS:GO.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to turn achievements on. Enter 1 here to turn achievements off.

name: ai_disable
description: Causes NPCs (bots) to bypass their logic programming and instead just perform their idle animations.

name: ai_drawbattlelines
description: This console command will cause battle lines to show where an NPC has moved to to decide whether ground has been lost or gained.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to to deactivate the "draw battle lines" feature (default). Enter 1 here to enable the draw battle lines feature (which will draw the battle lines of AI on the screen).

name: ai_drop_hint
description: This command draws up a list of the different hint types you can trigger in CS:GO.

arguments.label: Hint ID
arguments.description:
The ID of the drop hint you wish to activate (e.g. 12 for "Act Busy"). All drop hint IDs:
0 - None
2 - World: Window
12 - Act Busy
13 - World: Visually Interesting
14 - World: Visually Interesting (Don't Aim)
15 - World: Inhibit Combine Mines
16 - World: Visually Interesting (Stealth)
100 - Tactical: Cover Medium
101 - Tactical: Cover Low
103 - Tactical: Pinch
105 - Tactical: Enemy Disadvantage
107 - Tactical: High Ground
400 - Antlion: Burrow Point
401 - Antlion: Thumper Flee Point
700 - Crow: Flyto Point
900 - Follow: Wait Point
901 - Jump Override
902 - Squad Transition Point
903 - Act Busy: Exit Point
904 - Strider
950 - Ally MoveAway Point
1100 - CS Port: Hostage Escape

name: ai_resume
description: This command resets NPC (bots) movements if they are bugged from the command ai_step.

name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
description: This command sets how high you can set NPCS (bots) to bump up ground walkers when checking steps.

name: ai_setenabled
description: This cheat command toggles whether or not AI customization is on, similarly to the effect of ai_disable.

arguments.description: Enter 1 here to enable AI (default). Enter 0 here to disable AI.

name: ai_step
description: This command causes NPCs (bots) to freeze after finishing their last action.

name: ai_test_los
description: This command tests the line of sight of NPCs (bots). Use with caution: this command can make your game client crash.

name: ainet_generate_report
description: This console command generates a report inside the developer console.

name: ainet_generate_report
description: This console command generates a report inside the developer console.

name: ainet_generate_report_only
description: This command creates a report inside the developer console.

name: air_density
description: This console command changes the air density inside of CS:GO. This is only used in drag computations.

arguments.label: Air Density
arguments.description: The number you wish to set the CS:GO air density (used in drag computations) to. This is capped at 10,000,000,000.

name: askconnect_accept
description: This command causes you to accept a redirect request if your server has sent you one.

name: asw_engine_finished_building_map
description: This is a command used to notify the game engine that a map has been finished being built. It won't be used by the majority of CS:GO players.

name: audit_save_in_memory
description: This command initiates an audit in CS:GO's save-to-memory system.

name: autobuy
description: If you have set up an autobuy command with the cl_autobuy command then this command will attempt to purchase those items.

name: autosave
description: This command will save your game in certain single player instances in CS:GO.

name: autosavedangerous
description: This console command saves your game in certain single player modes of CS:GO.

name: bench_end
description: This console commands ends the testing of your average framerate that the command bench_start counts.

name: bench_showstatsdialog
description: This command will show you your recent benchmark stats if you've recently tested them.

name: bench_start
description: This cheat command will begin testing your average framerate (FPS) over a period of time. You can end the test and receive your results with the command bench_end.

name: bench_upload
description: This console command uploads your most recent result from a benchmark test (triggered by bench_start and ended with bench_end) to the Valve servers.

name: benchframe
description: This command takes a snapshot from a particular frame in a CS:GO demo.

arguments.label: Demo Name
arguments.description: The name of the demo you want a snapshot from.

arguments.label: Frame
arguments.description: The name of the demo you want a snapshot from.

arguments.label: Frame
arguments.description: The number of the frame you want a snapshot from.

arguments.label: TGA Filename
arguments.description: The number of the frame you want a snapshot from.

arguments.label: TGA Filename
arguments.description: The file name of the .tga file you want to look at on your computer.

name: blackbox_dump
description: This console command dumps the values of your black box in your developer console for you to view their data and file location.

name: bot_autodifficulty_threshold_high
description: Sets the difficulty rating of bots to high. The default value for bots' difficulty is 5, the minimum is -20 and the maximum is 20.

name: bot_autodifficulty_threshold_low
description: Sets the difficulty rating of bots to low. The default value for bots' difficulty is 5, the minimum is -20 and the maximum is 20.

name: bot_debug
description: This command will toggle (0 = disabled, 1 = enabled) bot debug features.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 (default) to disable bot debug features. Set this to 1 to enable bot debug features.

name: bot_debug_target
description: This console command debugs bot issues but is primarily used for testing purposes.

name: bot_defer_to_human_goals
description: This command prevents bots from doing scenario tasks when it is set on.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: Set to 0 to turn off and 1 to turn it on.

name: bot_defer_to_human_items
description: This console command prevents bots from taking scenario items when it is set on.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: Set to 0 to turn off and 1 to turn it on.

name: bot_join_after_player
description: This cheat command can be used to only have bots join the server you're on once another live player joins, which can be helpful to balance teams.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to not allow bots to join the game server until another player joins, and 0 to allow them to spawn as normal.

name: bot_pistols_only
description: Restricts bots on your server to only use pistols, meaning they can't use other weapons like Rifles or SMGs.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 to force bots to only use pistols, and 0 to turn this command and allow them to use any gun.

name: bot_show_nav
description: This is command, when enabled (set to 1), will show each bots navigation mesh.

arguments.description: Enter 1 here to enable the display of bot navigation meshes, enter 0 here to disable the display of bot nav meshes (default).

name: bot_show_occupy_time
description: This command brings up a display on your screen showing each area that can be first reached by either team. This is most of a map, so this command will cause low FPS for players using older and less powerful computers.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to enable this command, and 0 to turn it off.

name: budget_averages_window
description: This command sets the number of frames you want the game client to test when figuring out your average frame count.

arguments.label: Tested Frames
arguments.description: The number of frames used per second in the calculation of your average frame rate. Default value is set at 30.

name: budget_background_alpha
description: This command alters the translucency of the budget panel. Its default is set at 128.

arguments.label: Translucency
arguments.description: The translucency value you want the budget panel to appear in.

name: bug
description: This command shows the bug reporting UI in certain instances in game, though typically won't work in servers.

name: bugreporter_username
description: Sets your username for the bug reporter.

name: buildcubemaps
description: This command is used by the development team. Using it can cause your weapon to vanish from the screen, so avoid using it.

name: building_cubemaps
description: This command is used by the development team. Using it can cause your weapon to vanish from the screen, so avoid using it.

name: buildmodelforworld
description: This command is used by the development team and can cause your game client to crash , so avoid using it.

name: cache_print
description: This command prints a list into your console of all of the cached resources you have saved, along with how much memory they're taking up and what percentage that is of your total available space.

name: cache_print_lru
description: This command, just like the "cache_print" command, prints out a list of the cached resources you have into your developer console, as well as how much space that takes up in your files.

name: cache_print_summary
description: This console command prints only the summary of all your cached content in game. This means it doesn't spam your developer console with thousands of lines of data, letting you see what resources you have cached in a user friendly manner.

name: cam_collision
description: You can use this command to attempt to make the third person experience in CS:GO run smoother, activated with the command "thirdperson". When turned on, it can prevent your camera from coliding with walls around the map.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to attempt to reduce camera collisions with walls when in thid person mode, and a 0 to disable this.

name: cam_command
description: This command adjusts your in game camera view between first person (default) and third person.

arguments.description: Using a 1 after this command will set your camera to third person. 0 and 2 set the camera to first person.

name: cam_idealdelta
description: This command adjusts the speed that your camera attemps to fix any discrepancies between its angles when in third person mode.

arguments.label: Camera speed
arguments.description: Enter your desired camera speed when its troubleshooting. The default value is 4.

name: cam_ideallag
description: This command controls how fast you can move your camera around when in third person mode. The default value is 4.

arguments.label: Camera speed
arguments.description: Use a low number, like 0.1, to make your camera move quickly in third person, and a higher number like 50 to make it move slowly.

name: cam_showangles
description: This command will enable a menu in the top right of your screen displaying the exact statistics for your camera angles when in third person.

arguments.description: Use the number 1 after the command to turn the menu on, and 0 to close it.

name: cam_snapto
description: This command will snap your camera up its default position when in third person mode.

arguments.description: Use the value 1 after the command to snap the camera to default position. Use a 0 after the command to reset the camera so you can perform the action again.

name: cash_player_damage_hostage
description: This command sets the money lost or earned for damaging a hostage. By default this deducts $30 from the player for each time the hostage is damaged, and can be set to deduct even more or to award the player.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money given to or taken from the player upon damaging a hostage. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that money lost when shooting a hostage.

name: cash_player_get_killed
description: This command sets the money earned or lost for getting killed by an enemy. By default this is $0, but can be changed to either award the player or take money from them.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money a player earns or loses from being killed. Use a positive number to give money on this action, and use a minus sign (-) before the number to make getting killed cost players money.

name: cash_player_interact_with_hostage
description: This command sets the money earned or lost for interacting with a hostage. By default this is $150, but can be changed to either award the player more or take money from them.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money a player earns or loses from interacting with a hostage. Use a positive number to give money on this action, and use a minus sign (-) before the number to make interacting with hostages cost players money.

name: cash_player_killed_enemy_default
description: This command sets how much money is earned or lost by killing an enemy player with a default weapon.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money a player earns or loses when killing an enemy. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount of money lost whenever you kill a player.

name: cash_player_killed_hostage
description: This console command dictates how much money is earned or lost when a player kills a hostage.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money a player earns or loses when killing a hostage. Use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount of money lost whenever you kill a hostage.

name: cash_player_respawn_amount
description: Sets how much money players respawn with.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money earned or lost for respawning. You can use a minus sign (-) before the number to have that amount of money lost whenever you respawn.

name: cash_team_rescued_hostage
description: This command changes the amount of money that the whole team earns for one player rescuing the hostage.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of cash that each team member earns for one of the players rescuing a hostage. The default value for this is $0. Use a minus sign (-) before the number you enter to cause team members to lose money on this event.

name: cash_team_terrorist_win_bomb
description: This command sets the amount of cash won by each player on the Terrorist team when they win a round by the bomb exploding.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money earned by each T on a round won via the bomb exploding. Use a minus sign (-) to cause players to lose the amount of money you set on this event happening.

name: cash_team_win_by_defusing_bomb
description: This console command sets the amount of money the CT team earns for winning a round by defusing the bomb.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The amount of money earned by each CT on a round won via defusing the bomb. Use a minus sign (-) to cause players to lose the amount of money you set on this event happening.

name: cash_team_win_by_hostage_rescue
description: This cheat command changes the amount of money won by team members when they win a round by rescuing a hostage.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The money earned by each member of the team when victory is achieved by rescuing the hostage successfully. Use a minus sign (-) before the number you enter to make players lose that amount of money on a hostage rescue win.

name: cash_team_win_by_time_running_out_bomb
description: This command sets the amount of money that the CT players earn from winning a round by the time running out, meaning the Terrorists didn't get a bomb down or eliminate all the CT's in the required time limit.

name: cash_team_win_by_time_running_out_hostage
description: This command sets the amount of money won by the team guarding the hostages if they win the round by not allowing any hostages to be rescued within the time limit.

arguments.label: Money Earned/Lost
arguments.description: The cash earned by each team member for winning a round by keeping all hostages from being rescued. Use a minus sign (-) before the number you enter to make players lose that amount of money on time-running-out win.

name: cast_hull
description: This command tests the game's hull collision detection by spawning a blue, cube-shaped object from the position your player model is standing across to reach the nearest solid surface you're looking at.

name: cast_ray
description: This console command tests the game's collision detection by spawning a small ray from where your character is standing to where they are looking.

name: cc_findsound
description: This command searches the game files for the file name you specify in the argument.

arguments.label: File Name
arguments.description: The file name of the sound you want to find. If successful, you will see a string of text emitted in game.

name: cc_flush
description: This cheat command flushes the game's cached and async'd captions, though you'll rarely be able to see them.

name: cc_lang
description: Attempts to adjust the game's close caption language settings. As this command is rarely used, most of the languages you enter won't be found and the client will default you to English.

arguments.label: Language
arguments.description: The language you want closed captions to appear in, in the rare case they do. Unfortunately most languages won't be found and you'll be defaulted to English.

name: cc_linger_time
description: This command sets how long closed captions linger on the screen for.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The time you want captions to show on screen. Default value is 1.

name: cc_predisplay_time
description: This command is used to determine how long the delay is before showing a closed caption compared to when it's triggered.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The time you want to wait for closed captions to appear on your screen. Default value is 0.25.

name: cc_random
description: This command should emit a random caption, but commonly causes the CS:GO client to crash, so use with caution.

name: cc_subtitles
description: This command decides whether or not to show subtitles in CS:GO during times where there are voiceovers.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after the command to turn on subtitles, and a 0 to turn them on.

name: ch_createairboat
description: This command should spawn an airboat in front of you, but produces an error message when used stating it can't create it as it's an unknown entity.

name: ch_createjeep
description: This command should spawn a jeep in front of you, but produces an error message when used stating it can't create it as it's an unknown entity.

name: changelevel2
description: This command changes the map you're playing on into a single player instance. Doing this can cause the map you're trying to load into to freeze.

arguments.label: Map Name
arguments.description: The name of the map you want to switch to in it's technical form. Here is a full list of map codes.

name: cl_allowdownload
description: This command is client based and allows you to download customization files to the game.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to allow for downloads, and set to 0 to disable them.

name: cl_allowupload
description: This command is client based and allows you to upload customization files to the game.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to allow for uploads, and set to 0 to disable them.

name: cl_avatar_convert_rgb
description: This console command converts any PNG avatars (steam profile pictures) in the avatars directory to RGB images.

name: cl_bob_lower_amt
description: This console command adjusts how much your gun barrel moves back towards you when you're running.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value attached to your gun barrel moving towards your player. The higher this command is, the more your gun barrel will move. The highest this command can go is 30, and the lowest it can go is 5. The default value is 21.

name: cl_bobamt_vert
description: This command changes how much your viewmodel & gun barrel moves up and down when you're moving forward.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value attached to how much your viewomodel/gun barrel moves up and down as you run. The higher the command, the more exaggerated the movement is. The command is capped at 2 and goes to 0.1 at its lowest. 0.25 is the default value of this command.

name: cl_camera_follow_bone_index
description: This command adjusts how the camera follows the index of the bone.

arguments.description: The different settings for the command. -2 disables the command, -1 sets it to follow the root bone and 0 sets it to the bone index.

name: cl_clearhinthistory
description: This command clears the game's memory of what in game hints (that pop up on your screen to prompt you to do something) it has shown you. This can make it show you those hints again.

name: cl_clock_correction
description: This command gives you the ability to toggle between being able to correct the in game clock.

arguments.description: Enter 1 after the command to enable clock correction, and 0 to disable it.

name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount
description: This console command adjusts the maximum number of milliseconds it is possible to adjust the clock by.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The number of milliseconds you want to adjust the client clock by. The default value for this command is 200.

name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset
description: This console command sets the maximum value (in milliseconds) the clock offset can be set to.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The max number of milliseconds to set the clock offset to.

name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset
description: This console command sets the minium value (in milliseconds) the clock offset can be set to.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The minimum number of milliseconds you can set the clock offset to.

name: cl_clock_showdebuginfo
description: This console command will produce a range of data in your developer console in an attempt to debug your client's clock.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after the command to turn on debugging, and a 0 to turn it off.

name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms
description: The maximum amount of time the clock can be falty before it latches on to the server's clock in milliseconds.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The time in milliseconds before the client clock switches to the server clock if it's buggy.

name: cl_csm_server_status
description: This command allows you to check in on the server status.

name: cl_csm_status
description: Produces several statistics in your developer console about the status of your CSM.

name: cl_custommaterial_debug_graph
description: This command summons a debug graph to the left side of your screen in game.

arguments.description: Enter 1 here to display the graph. Enter 0 here to hide it.

name: cl_decryptdata_key
description: This console command can be used to decrypt GOTV messages if you know the message ID.

arguments.label: Message
arguments.description: The ID of the message that you want to decrypt.

name: cl_decryptdata_key_pub
description: This cheat command can be used to decrypt GOTV messages, if you know the message ID.

arguments.label: Message
arguments.description: The ID of the message that you want to decrypt.

name: cl_detail_avoid_force
description: This command alters the force with which you'd like to avoid players.

arguments.label: Percentage
arguments.description: A multiplier from 0 to 1 that represents your desired percentage (default value is 0.4 = 40%).

name: cl_download_demoplayer
description: This command is used to decide whether or not downloading an external resource is allowed in the demo player.

arguments.description: Use the examples section to see which number to use in your command.

name: cl_downloadfilter
description: This determines what files can be downloaded from a few different options.

arguments.label: Filter
arguments.description: Set your command with either all, none or nosounds, depending on what download filter you want to make.

name: cl_entityreport
description: This console command is used in debugging issues with the game. It produces a detailed list of statistics on your screen about the different entities used.

arguments.description: Add a 1 after the command to turn on the entity report, and use a 0 after the command to turn it off.

name: cl_extrapolate_amount
description: This console command adjusts how many seconds the game client extrapolates entities for when prompted.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The number of seconds you want to extrapolate for.

name: cl_find_ent
description: This command finds and then produces a list of all the client entites that exist within CS:GO that match a substring you enter.

arguments.label: Substring
arguments.description: The substring of the entities you want to compile a list of.

name: cl_find_ent_index
description: This command searches the game files and produces a list in your console of all client side entities that match the index you specifiy.

arguments.label: Index
arguments.description: The index you want a list of entities for.

name: cl_flushentitypacket
description: This command is used for debugging and foces the game engine to flush an entity packet.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of entity packets you want to flush.

name: cl_forcepreload
description: This command is to decide whether or not preloading should be forced on a server.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on, and a0 to turn it off. By default it is set to 0 (off).

name: cl_fullupdate
description: Using this command causes the server to produce and send a full update packet.

name: cl_fullupdate
description: Using this command causes the server to produce and send a full update packet.

name: cl_ignorepackets
description: This is a command used in debugging. It forces the game client to ignore packets.

arguments.description: Set the command to 1 to ignore packets, and 0 to turn the command off. The default value for this command is 0 (off).

name: cl_interp
description: Changes and sets your interpolation amount. This command can't be altered while playing, meaning you must be on the main menu or spectating a match.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: A number between 0 and 0.5 to set the interpolation amount to. The default value for this command is 0.03125.

name: cl_interp_ratio
description: This command sets the interpolation amount. The final value is determined from this command's value divided by the value of cl_updaterate.

arguments.label: Interp Ratio
arguments.description: The number you'd like to set the interpolation amount to on this command. Default value for this is 2.

name: cl_interpolate
description: This command, if set to 1, enables interpolation (default). Setting this command to 0 disables interpolation.

arguments.description: Use a 0 to turn this command off, and a 1 to turn it on. By default this is set to 1 (on).

name: cl_lagcompensation
description: This console command is used to compensate for server-side lag that can affect weapon performance. It can't be adjusted while playing, meaning you need to be in spectator mode or on the main menu.

arguments.label: Lag Compensation
arguments.description: A numeric value that dictates lag compensation. The default value for this command is 1.

name: cl_leafsystemvis
description: This command produces a display in the top right of your screen that cycles through the various entities in use by showing their file names.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to turn the command on, and 0 to turn the command and its display off.

name: cl_leveloverview
description: Using this command will tell you in your developer console exactly where you're standing on your current map. It can also make your screen turn black. Simply enter the command cl_leveloverview 0 to fix that.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to turn the level overview command on and see your precise location on the map, and set to 0 to turn the command off.

name: cl_mainmenu_blog_file
description: This command loads in the blog file you specify.

arguments.label: File Name
arguments.description: The file name of the blog entry you want to load.

name: cl_modemanager_reload
description: This cheat command reloads the metaclasses panels for anyone playing on a vgui screen.

name: cl_mouselook
description: This console command controls how you look around in game. You can set it between your mouse (default) or your keyboard.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to use your mouse to look around, and 0 to use your keyboard. 1 is the default value for this command. This command cannot be adjusted while connected to a server, so you'll need to be on the main menu to use it.

name: cl_obs_interp_enable
description: This command is used to enable interpolation between multiple observer targets.

arguments.description: Set to 1 to enable this command (default), and 0 to disable it.

name: cl_overdraw_test
description: This console command covers your screen with a foggy grey panel, making it difficult to see anything and can slow your fps. To turn it off, use the command cl_overdraw_test 0.

arguments.description: Enter 1 after the command to enable the grey overlay, and a 0 after it to disable the effect.

name: cl_panelanimation
description: This command produces a list of the properties used in panel animation and pastes them in your developer console.

name: cl_particles_show_bbox
description: This command produces several green boxes around the map displaying their C_FUNC values. You can produce more boxes by shooting your weapon.

arguments.description: Enter 1 after the command to turn on the feature, and a 0 after to turn it off.

name: cl_particles_show_controlpoints
description: This command highlights areas of the game being adjusted by what you're doing. For example, shooting your gun will highlight your gun barrel and the bullet holes your shots create.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn this effect on, and enter a 0 to turn it off. By default it is set to 0 (off).

name: cl_pclass
description: Use this command to dump a group of entities based on their prediction classname.

arguments.label: Class
arguments.description: The prediction class of the entity you're dumping.

name: cl_pdump
description: This command dumps info about ongoing entities on your actual game screen, rather than into your developer console.

arguments.description: Add a 1 at the end of the command to enable the data feed on your screen, and use a -1 at the end to turn it off. The default value for this command is -1 (off).

name: cl_phys_timescale
description: This is the console command that adjusts the timescale of client-side physics in game, also known as ragdolling.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The number of seconds you want ragdolling to be set to. The default value for this command is 1.

name: cl_precacheinfo
description: This command fills your developer console with technical information related to your pre cache info.

name: cl_pred_track
description: This command tracks changes to the entity index of the field name that you enter.

arguments.label: Entity Index
arguments.description: The entity you want to track the field you enter after this part of the command.

arguments.label: Field Name
arguments.description: The entity you want to track the field you enter after this part of the command.

arguments.label: Field Name
arguments.description: The field name of the item you want to track across the entity index you entered before this.

name: cl_predict
description: This command performs a prediction on the client side. It can't be edited while playing, so you'll need to be in the main menu to use this command.

arguments.description: A value to produce a client side prediction. The default value for this command is 1.

name: cl_predictioncopy_describe
description: This command produces a techical breakdown in your developer console of the entity index that you enter.

arguments.label: Entity Index
arguments.description: The entity index that you want to produce a list of data from.

name: cl_predictionlist
description: This command summons a display in the top right corner of your screen showing what entities are currently being predicted in your client. This can include weapons, player models and more.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to enable the prediction list of entities, and a 0 to hide it. It can take a moment after disabling the menu for the effect to take place.

name: cl_predictweapons
description: This command performs a prediction of weapon effects on the client side. It can't be used while playing, so can only be used from the main menu.

arguments.description: The default value for this command is 1. Set it to 0 to predict weapons, and set it to 1 to cancel this.

name: cl_reloadpostprocessparams
description: This commands reloads post processor commands from the targeted file in the command.

arguments.label: Target File
arguments.description: The file you want to reset post processor parameters for.

name: cl_remove_all_workshop_maps
description: This console command removes all maps that you've saved from the community workshop to your game. If you have several maps saved and don't want to lose them, don't use this command.

name: cl_remove_old_ugc_downloads
description: Use this console command to remove old UGC downloads from your game files.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after this command to wipe old UGC downloads from your client. The default value for this command is 0, which leaves it off.

name: cl_removedecals
description: This command doesn't work as intended. Use the command r_cleardecals instead to remove blood and bullet holes from around the map.

name: cl_report_soundpatch
description: This cheat command produces a value in your developer console of the number of current sound patches in the client.

name: cl_resend_timeout
description: This is the total amount of time allowed to the client to resend a connect request to a server.

arguments.label: Wait time
arguments.description: The number of minutes maximum the client can wait before resending a failed connect attempt to a server. The default value for the command is 60 minutes, and you can enter a value between 1.5 minutes and 20,000 minutes.

name: cl_rumblescale
description: You can use this console command to adjust the sensitivity of rumble effects in game.

arguments.label: Scale
arguments.description: A number from 0 to 1 you'd like to set the rumble scale to. The default value for this command is 1.

name: cl_showanimstate_activities
description: Use this command to enable showing activities in the client animation display.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after this console command to turn on showing activities in the animation display, and use a 0 to turn it off.

name: cl_showents
description: Produces a list in your developer console of all of the active entities in the client.

name: cl_showerror
description: Produces a list of error commands in your console if any are relevant.

arguments.description: Use a 1 after this command to enable it in its simplest form, use a 2 to produce the most detailed report on any active errors, and use a 0 to turn the command off. If nothing shows up and you've tested several inputs into the game (shooting, moving, etc) there may be no errors.

name: cl_showpluginmessages2
description: Determines whether or not plugins to the game client can show you messages.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to allow plugins to show messages, and use a 0 after the command to prevent them from showing messages. By default this command is set to 0 (off).

name: cl_skipfastpath
description: This interesting console command prevents items on the map from rendering if they are seen to go through the model fast path.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn on skip fast path, and enter a 0 to turn the command off.

name: cl_skipslowpath
description: This console command prevents items on the map that are deemed to disrupt the slow path not render. Commonly, this includes your character model's hands and weapons.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn on skip slow path, and enter a 0 to turn the command off.

name: cl_soundemitter_flush
description: Use this console command to flush (clear) the server's sounds.txt system.

name: cl_soundemitter_reload
description: This console command reloads the server's sounds.txt system.

name: cl_soundscape_flush
description: This console command's use is to flush (clear) the soundscapes of the game client.

name: cl_ss_origin
description: This command will paste your origin data in your developer console in script format.

name: cl_steamscreenshots
description: Enter this command into your console to toggle between saving screenshots direct to Steam or not.

name: cl_teamid_overhead
