description: Use this command in your console to print a list of the user IDs that are currently banned from the server you're on.

name: listip
description: Use this command in your console to print a list of the IP addresses that are currently banned on the server you're on.

name: listmodels
description: This console command produces a list of all the models that have been loaded into your session.

name: listRecentNPCSpeech
description: This console command creates a list in your developer console of the most recent 5 things that NPCs have said.

name: loadcommentary
description: This command loads in any game commentary that is saved. It can also open your game menu as well.

name: loader_dump_table
description: This command prints a list of values into your developer console of queued loads and jobs to do for the client.

name: locator_split_len
description: This is a client only command.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: This console command has a default value of 0.5f.

name: locator_split_maxwide_percent
description: This is a client only command.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: This command has a default value of 0.80f.

name: lockMoveControllerRet
description: This is a client only command.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: log
description: Using this command begins logging server data to your file and your console.

arguments.label: On/Off
arguments.description: Enter the word on after the command to start logging, and off after the command to end logging.

name: log_dumpchannels
description: This console command is used to dump all of the information pertaining the logging channels in game into your developer console.

name: log_flags
description: This cheat command produces a detailed list in the developer console on how to set up flags for the logging channel.

name: log_level
description: This cheat command produces a detailed list in the developer console on how to set up the spew level for the logging channel.

name: logaddress_add
description: This command allows you to set the IP address and port number for a remote host to use.

arguments.label: IP address:port
arguments.description: Enter the IP address and port number that you want to use in the format of IP:port.

name: logaddress_del
description: This command allows you to remove an IP address and port number for a remote host.

arguments.label: IP address:port
arguments.description: Enter the IP address and port number that you want to use in the format of IP:port.

name: logaddress_delall
description: This command is used to remove all of the UDP addresses logged in the server list.

name: logaddress_list
description: This lists all of the network addresses currently being used by logaddress.

name: lookstrafe
description: This command is used to toggle the client only look strafe command on and off.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn look strafe on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: loopsingleplayermaps
description: This console command should begin to run the single player maps in CS:GO on a loop, though it can be faulty and not work.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to begin looping maps, and a 0 to turn the cycle off (default).

name: m_forward
description: This console command is used to set the mouse forward factor.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The forward factor you want to use for your mouse settings. The default value for this command is 1, and it can be set anywhere from 0.0001 to 1,000.

name: m_side
description: This console command is used to set your mouse side factor.

arguments.label: Side Factor
arguments.description: The side factor you want to set this command to. The default value is 0.8.

name: map_background
description: This command will make the specified map become the background of the main menu. May not work since Panorama mode (new CS:GO UI).

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you wish to set as the background of the main menu.

name: map_commentary
description: This command starts playing the specified map with commentary.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you wish to load with commentary.

name: map_commentary
description: This command starts playing the specified map with commentary.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you wish to load with commentary.

name: map_edit
description: This command may not work. It should load the specified map in edit mode.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you wish to edit.

name: map_setbombradius
description: This command sets the bomb damage to the specified value and adjusts the radius to 3.5 the damage amount.

arguments.label: Damage / Radius
arguments.description: Your desired bomb damage, the radius will be 3.5 this amount. If you enter 10 here, the bomb damage would be 10 and radius 35.

name: map_showbombradius
description: This command shows the bomb radius from the center the map's bomb plant spot(s).

name: map_showspawnpoints
description: This command will show the map's spawn points. Invalid spawn points will be of the red color (valid are green). Will be hidden after 60 seconds.

name: mapcycledisabled
description: If you set this command to 1 (default 0), the same map will be replayed at the end of each game (instead of moving to the next map in the map pool).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not disable map cycling, and have more than one map (default). Enter 1 to disable map cycling and make it so that the same map is restarted at the end of each game.

name: mapgroup
description: This command will set the server's map group to the specified map group. Map groups are the groups of maps that a server will cycle through.

name: maps
description: This command prints to console a list of all of the maps you have installed/downloaded.

name: maxplayers
description: This command sets the maximum amount of players that can connect to your server (i.e. the player cap).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of players that can connect. 10 would mean only 10 can connect at any given time.

name: mp_backup_restore_list_files
description: This command lists backup round files that match the specified prefix. The order they are listed in is most recent to least recent.

arguments.label: Prefix / Limit
arguments.description: If you specify a number here, the number of backup round files listed will be limited to this number (the most recent will be shown). If you specify a non-number (words), only backup files with this prefix will be listed. If you do not specify anything here, the default prefix (backup_) will be searched for.

name: mp_backup_restore_load_autopause
description: This command sets whether or not the game should be automatically paused when a backed up round is restored. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to disable the auto pause after the load of a backup. Enter 1 here to enable the pause of the game after loading a round backup file.

name: mp_backup_restore_load_file
description: This command will load the specified backup file and restore the game to the round after the last round saved in the backup file. Data saved includes the current scores, player kills, player deaths and player cash.

arguments.label: Backup File
arguments.description: The name of the backup file you wish to restore. Find round backup file names with mp_backup_restore_list_files. You should include the .txt file extension.

name: mp_backup_round_auto
description: This command sets whether or not backups are stored in-memory to handle reconnecting players. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable this setting, and only load backups from disk. Enter 1 to enable this setting (default).

name: mp_backup_round_file
description: This command can be used to set the files prefix. If you set a prefix here (other than backup), rounds will be saved to files with the following name format: PREFIX_date_time_team1_team2_mapname_roundnum_score1_score2.txt.

arguments.label: File Prefix
arguments.description: Default is "backup". The prefix for the round backup files. Round files will be saved as: PREFIX_date_time_team1_team2_mapname_roundnum_score1_score2.txt

name: mp_backup_round_file_last
description: This command will print the name of the latest round backup file that was saved.

name: mp_backup_round_file_pattern
description: This command can be used to change the file name format of backup files. See argument info for help.

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description:
Your desired name format. These variables will be replaced with their actual values:
%prefix% will be replaced with the file prefix
%date% will be replaced with the date of the backup
%time% will be replaced with the time of the backup
%team1% will be replaced with the name of team 1
%team2% will be replaced with the name of team 2
%map% will be replaced with the map name
%round% will be replaced with the round #
%score1% will be replaced with the first team's score
%score2% will be replaced with the second team's score

name: mp_dm_bonus_length_min
description: This command sets the minimum duration of the bonus time in deathmatch. A random time between this value and mp_dm_bonus_length_max will be chosen.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The minimum duration of the bonus time (seconds).

name: mp_dm_bonus_percent
description: This command sets the percentage of extra points that should be added when someone gets a kill with a bonus weapon during the bonus time.

arguments.label: Percentage
arguments.description: The percentage of extra points that should be added. 50 = 50%. If 50 percent and the amount of points was usually 8, 12 would be added.

name: mp_dm_time_between_bonus_max
description: This command sets the maximum time between each bonus time period. A duration between this value and mp_dm_time_between_bonus_min will be randomly chosen.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The maximum duration between each bonus time (seconds).

name: mp_dm_time_between_bonus_min
description: This command sets the minimum time between each bonus time period. A duration between this value and mp_dm_time_between_bonus_max will be randomly chosen.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The minimum duration between each bonus time (seconds).

name: mp_do_warmup_offine
description: This command sets whether or not there should be a warmup period when you are in a private game / offline with bots. Default is no warmup (0). There is a typo in this command in CS:GO - mp_do_warmup_offine is the command, NOT mp_do_warmup_offline

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to make it so that there is not a warmup in bot games (default). Enter 1 here to enable warmup in bot / offline games.

name: mp_do_warmup_period
description: This command sets whether or not there is a warmup period in games. Default is enabled (1). This does not apply to offline with bot games, use the mp_do_warmup_offine (that's not a typo) command instead.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to disable the warmup period. Enter 1 here (default) to have a warmup period before the match.

name: mp_dump_timers
description: This command prints round timers to the console. Used for debugging.

name: mp_endmatch_votenextleveltime
description: This command sets how much time (in seconds) players have to vote for the next map at the end of the game.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The time, in seconds, that players have to place their vote for the next map. Default is 20.

name: mp_endmatch_votenextmap
description: This command enables and disables the option for players to vote for the next map at the end of the game. Default is 1 (which allows players to vote).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make it so that players cannot vote for the next map (random). Enter 1 (default) to allow players to vote for the next map.

name: mp_endmatch_votenextmap_keepcurrent
description: This command sets whether or not the current map is allowed to be voted for at the end of the game. Default is enabled, meaning players can vote again for the same map.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disallow players for voting for the map that was just played. Enter 1 (default) to allow players to vote for the same map again.

name: mp_force_assign_teams
description: This command can enable or disable the force assignment of teams. If force team assignment is enabled, players do not get a choice of which team to join, they are automatically placed on a team. By default this setting is disabled (players can choose their team).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to allow players to choose their team (default). Set this to 1 to not let players choose their team (and have the game automatically assign a team).

name: mp_force_pick_time
description: This command sets the duration, in seconds, that the game will allow for a player to choose a team. After this time period, a team is automatically chosen for them. Default duration is 15 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The time, in seconds, that a player has to choose a team before they are automatically given a team.

name: mp_forcecamera
description: This command sets the scope spectators have (i.e. who players can spectate when they die). See argument information for scopes.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to allow players to spectate any team. Set this to 1 to allow players to only spectate their own team. Set this to 2 to disallow spectating, players will be shown a black screen until the next round.

name: mp_forcerespawnplayers
description: This command may not work. It should force all dead players to respawn.

name: mp_free_armor
description: This command, if set to 1 (enabled), will make each player spawn with armor and a helmet at the start of the round. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter a 0 here to disable free armor and helmet at the start of the round (default). Enter 1 to enable this feature.

name: mp_freezetime
description: This command sets how long players are frozen for at the start of each the round. This freeze time allows players to buy their gear and discuss tactics before the round begins. Default is 15 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that players should be frozen for at the start of the round.

name: mp_friendlyfire
description: This command can be used to enable and disable friendly fire. When friendly fire is enabled, players can damage their own teammates. The default setting for this command depends on gamemode. Competitive game modes have friendly fire enabled, casual do not.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 here to disable friendly fire, meaning teammates won't be able to hurt eachother. Enter a 1 here to enable friendly fire.

name: mp_ggprogressive_random_weapon_kills_needed
description: If you have set mp_ggprogressive_use_random_weapons to enabled (1), this command can be used to set the amount of kills that are required to progress to the next weapon. Default is 2. This is used for gamemodes such as Arms Race (Gun Game).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of kills that are needed to progress to the next weapon.

name: mp_ggprogressive_round_restart_delay
description: This command sets how long it takes for an Arms Race (Gun Game) match to restart after someone has won. Default is 15 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that it takes for the game to restart after an Arms Race match has ended.

name: mp_ggprogressive_use_random_weapons
description: If you enable this setting, in Arms Race mode, random weapons from each progression category will be selected, as opposed to the same weapons.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable this setting. Enter 1 to enable this setting.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_defuse_bonus
description: This command sets the amount of bonus upgrades CTs will be awarded with if and when they defuse a bomb in Arms Race (Gun Game).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of bonus upgrades CTs receive for defusing the bomb in Arms Race.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_detonation_bonus
description: This command sets the amount of bonus upgrades Ts will be awarded when they successfully detonate a bomb in Arms Race (Gun Game).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of bonus upgrades Ts receive for detonating the bomb in Arms Race.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_pts_for_flash
description: This command sets the amount of kill points required in order for a player to receive a bonus flashbang grenade in Arms Race.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of kill points required for a bonus flashbang.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_pts_for_he
description: This command sets the amount of kill points required in order for a player to receive a bonus HE grenade in Arms Race.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of kill points required for a bonus HE grenade.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_pts_for_molotov
description: This command sets the amount of kill points required in order for a player to receive a bonus molotov, or incendiary grenade, in Arms Race.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of kill points required for a bonus molotov or incendiary grenade.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_pts_for_upgrade
description: This command sets the amount of kill points required for a player to receive a weapon upgrade in Arms Race.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The number of kill points required for a weapon upgrade.

name: mp_ggtr_bomb_respawn_delay
description: This command sets the amount of seconds to delay before the bomb should become available to someone who has respawned in Gun Game (i.e. after respawning, you must wait this duration before being able to use the bomb).

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The delay, in seconds, someone who has just respawned has to wait before they can use the bomb in Arms Race.

name: mp_ggtr_end_round_kill_bonus
description: This command sets the amount of bonus points that a player receives, in demolition mode, when a knife kill is the winning kill for the round.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of bonus points to award when a kill with a knife is the round winning kill.

name: mp_ggtr_halftime_delay
description: This command sets the halftime "break" or "delay" duration for TR mode. Default is 0 (half time disabled).

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that half time should last for.

name: mp_ggtr_last_weapon_kill_ends_half
description: This command sets whether or not the half should be ended when a player gets a kill with the final weapon in Arms Race mode.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable this feature (default). Enter 1 to end the current half when a player gets a kill with the final weapon in Arms Race.

name: mp_ggtr_num_rounds_autoprogress
description: This command sets how many rounds a player must go without an upgrade before an upgrade is automatically given to them. Default is 3, meaning if a player went for 3 rounds in Arms Race mode without an upgrade, then they would automatically receive an upgrade on the fourth.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of rounds a player should go without an upgrade before automatically being given one (Arms Race).

name: mp_halftime_pausetimer
description: This command can make it so that the match is paused at half time, and will not resume until unpaused manually. By default this is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make it so that the match is not paused at half time - after the halftime countdown, gameplay will be resumed. Enter 1 to pause the match at half time until resumed.

name: mp_hostages_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of hostages that should be spawned at the start of the round.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of hostages that should be spawned at the start of the round. Default is 2.

name: mp_hostages_rescuetime
description: This command sets whether or not extra time should be added to the round if/when a hostage is rescued. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make it so the extra time is not added when a hostage is rescued. Enter 1 to enable extra time when a hostage is rescued (default).

name: mp_hostages_rescuetime
description: This command sets whether or not extra time should be added to the round if/when a hostage is rescued. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make it so the extra time is not added when a hostage is rescued. Enter 1 to enable extra time when a hostage is rescued (default).

name: mp_hostages_run_speed_modifier
description: This command sets how run speed is affected when you are carrying a hostage. 0.5 = half speed, 1.5 = 150% speed.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The number to multiply run speed by when you are carrying a hostage.

name: mp_hostages_spawn_farthest
description: This setting, if enabled, makes hostages spawn at the furthest possible location. By default this is set to 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to make it so that hostages spawn at a randomly selected location (out of the pre-defined locations) (default). Enter 1 here to make hostages spawn at the furthest possible location.

name: mp_hostages_spawn_force_positions
description: This command can be used to force spawn positions. Enter each spawn position you wish to be the same every round (the number of the spawn position), with each spawn potion separated by a comma.

arguments.label: Positions
arguments.description: Enter each spawn position you wish to force each round, each position should be separated by a comma. To force position 2 and 3, you'd enter "2,3" (quotes not needed).

name: mp_hostages_spawn_same_every_round
description: This command will set whether or not the location of hostages is randomized each round, or the same throughout the game. Default is 1 (same for entire match).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make hostages spawn at random locations at the start of each round. Enter 1 to make it so that hostages spawn in the same locations as round 1 every round (the first round will still be randomized, but subsequent rounds will be the same positions.)

name: mp_hostages_takedamage
description: This command sets whether or not hostages can take damage. Default is 0 (unable to take damage).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to make it so that hostages cannot take damage (default). Set this to 1 to allow hostages to take damage.

name: mp_humanteam
description: This command can be used to restrict non-bot players to a specified team. Default is any team. See argument information for options.

arguments.label: Any / CT / T
arguments.description: Enter "any" to allow players to join any team. Enter "t" to allow non-bot players only on terrorist team. Enter "ct" to allow non-bot players only on counter-terrorist team.

name: mp_join_grace_time
description: This command sets the amount of time (in seconds) that a player can join the game for after a round starts. If they join after this period, they will be added to the spectators until the next round.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that a player can join a team for after the round has started. Default is 0 (players cannot join after round has started).

name: mp_limitteams
description: This command sets the maximum amount of different in players that there can be between two teams. If this was set to 1, if the CT team had 3 and T team had 2, a new player would not be able to join the CT team. Setting this to 0 disables the check. Default is 2.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum difference in players each team can have. A player cannot join a team, if them joining would make the difference in players between this team and the other team larger than this number. Set to 0 to disable team limiting.

name: mp_logdetail
description: This command sets the server "combat" logging setting. See argument information for help.

arguments.description: Set to 0 (default) to turn attack logging off. Set to 1 to only log enemy combat damage. Set to 2 to only log friendly combat damage. Set to 3 to log all forms of combat damage (both friendly and enemy).

name: mp_match_can_clinch
description: This command sets whether or not the game should be automatically ended when it is not possible for another team to catch up. For example, in competitive, when a team gets 16 rounds, it would be impossible for the other team to catch up (so the match would be ended). If this setting was set to 0 (disabled), the game would not be ended when 16 rounds were reached. By default is this 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to make it so that the game will be played out, regardless of whether or not it is impossible for one of the teams to catch up with the score and win. Set this to 1 (default) to end the match when one team reaches a score that would make it impossible for the other team to catch up.

name: mp_match_end_changelevel
description: This command sets whether or not the map should perform a changelevel when the next map is the same map. Default is off (0), meaning scores/etc will be reset at the end of a match, and the map will not be loaded again if it is the same.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to not change the level at the end of the game if the map is the same (default). Set this to 1 to reload the game's map if it is the same.

name: mp_match_end_restart
description: This command sets whether or not, at the end of the game, the current game (and map) is simply restarted or if a new map is loaded.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to not restart the current map, and instead load the next map at the end of the game. Set this to 1 to restart the match (as opposed to loading the next map) at the end of the match in play.

name: mp_match_restart_delay
description: This command sets how long it takes, in seconds, for a match to restart. This countdown is used at the end of a match, not when the mp_restartgame command is used.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the game should countdown for, before restarting the match (at the end of a match).

name: mp_maxmoney
description: This command sets the maximum amount of money that any player can have at a given time. Maximum possible value is 65,535 due to technical limitations.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of money that a player can have at any given time. A player's balance will not go above this amount, it will be capped at this value.

name: mp_maxrounds
description: This command sets the maximum amount of rounds that the server will play for.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of rounds that the server will play before restarting.

name: mp_molotovusedelay
description: This command sets the number of seconds that a player must wait after acquiring a molotov before they can use it.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that a player must wait before being able to use a molotov they have just acquired.

name: mp_overtime_enable
description: This command can be used to enable or disable overtime. Overtime is when extra rounds are played out to decide a winner, if the match ends with a tie. By default this is disabled (0). Set the amount of overtime rounds with mp_overtime_maxrounds.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to disable overtime (default). Enter 1 here to enable overtime.

name: mp_overtime_halftime_pausetimer
description: This command can be used to enable or disable the pausing of the match in between each overtime half. If set to 1 (enabled), the match will pause after each overtime half and require a manual unpause before it is resumed. Default is 0 (off).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to disable a pause in between each overtime half (default). Enter 1 here to enable a pause (that has to be manually unpaused) at the end of each overtime half.

name: mp_overtime_maxrounds
description: This command sets the maximum amount of rounds for each overtime session. Half time will be made at half of this value (i.e. at 6 max rounds, half time will be after 3 rounds).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of rounds for each overtime session. The amount required to win will be automatically adjusted.

name: mp_overtime_startmoney
description: This command sets the amount of cash that players start with at the beginning of each overtime half. Default is 10,000.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of money that each player should have at the start of an overtime half.

name: mp_pause_match
description: This command will pause the match at the end of the current round. Resume with mp_unpause_match.

name: mp_playercashawards
description: This command sets whether or not players should be able to earn money for performing in-game actions.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to disable. Set this to 1 to enable.

name: mp_playerid
description: This command sets what players can see in the status bar. See argument information for help.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to show all names, set this to 1 to show only your team's names, set this to 2 to show no names.

name: mp_playerid_delay
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that the game should wait before showing information in the status bar. Default is 0.

name: mp_playerid_hold
description: This command sets the amount of seconds the status bar should hold old information for before updating with new information. Default is 0 (always updating).

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the status bar should wait before updating with new information.

name: mp_radar_showall
description: This command sets who (if anyone) should be able to see the position of both teams on the radar. See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - default, you can only see your own team positions
1 - everyone can see everyone on the radar
2 - terrorists can see counter-terrorists
3 - counter-terrorists can see terrorists

name: mp_randomspawn
description: This command sets whether or not players should spawn randomly (e.g. in deathmatch). If not enabled (default for non-deathmatch gamemodes), players will spawn at the map's spawn locations (T or CT spawn, relative to team). See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - no random spawns
1 - everyone spawns in random locations (like deathmatch)
2 - only terrorists spawn at random locations, CTs spawn at their spawn
3 - only CTs spawn at random locations, terrorists spawn at their spawn

name: mp_randomspawn_los
description: This command, if enabled, will make the server try to spawn players outside of the line of sight of another player (i.e. spawn players in locations that other players aren't looking at).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to disable line of sight check. Set this to 1 to try to spawn players in locations that aren't currently in the view of any players.

name: mp_respawn_immunitytime
description: This command sets how many seconds players will be immune for after they respawn, used for deathmatch gamemodes. Default is 0 in non-deathmatch gamemodes.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that players should be immune for after spawning in the map.

name: mp_respawn_on_death_ct
description: This command will set whether or not counter-terrorists will respawn after dying.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make it so that CTs only respawn at the start of the next round. Set to 1 to make CTs respawn after death.

name: mp_respawn_on_death_t
description: This command will set whether or not terrorists will respawn after dying.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make it so that terrorists only respawn at the start of the next round. Set to 1 to make terrorists respawn after death.

name: mp_respawnwavetime_ct
description: This command sets how often "respawn waves" happen, in seconds, for CT players. Respawn waves respawn all dead players. At 10 seconds, every 10 seconds any dead CT players will be respawned. Requires mp_respawn_on_death_ct to be set to 1.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, between respawn waves.

name: mp_respawnwavetime_t
description: This command sets how often "respawn waves" happen, in seconds, for terrorist players. Respawn waves respawn all dead players. At 10 seconds, every 10 seconds any dead terrorist players will be respawned. Requires mp_respawn_on_death_t to be set to 1.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, between respawn waves.

name: mp_restartgame
description: This command will restart the game. If you specify a number as a parameter, this amount of seconds will be counted down before the restart happens.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: Optional - the amount of seconds to count down for before restarting the game. If not specified, game will restart in 1 second.

name: mp_round_restart_delay
description: This command sets the delay before the next round starts after a round has been won.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, before the next round starts after a round ends.

name: mp_roundtime
description: This command sets the maximum amount of minutes that a round takes before it is won/lost. In demolition, after this time is up, the round win is handed to the counter-terrorists. Use decimals for seconds, 1.92 = 1m55s.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: The amount of time, in minutes, that a round should last for. Use decimals for seconds, 0.5 would be 30s.

name: mp_roundtime_defuse
description: If this command is set to 0, mp_roundtime is used for round time. This command sets the amount of time that a round in any bomb-defusal gamemode takes, in minutes. Use decimals for seconds.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: The amount of time, in minutes, that a round of bomb defusal should take. 0.75 would be 45 seconds.

name: mp_roundtime_hostage
description: If this command is set to 0, mp_roundtime is used for round time. This command sets the amount of time that a round in any hostage gamemode takes, in minutes. Use decimals for seconds.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: The amount of time, in minutes, that a round of hostage should take. 0.75 would be 45 seconds.

name: mp_scrambleteams
description: This command randomizes the teams (switches Ts to CTs and vice versa randomly) and restarts the game.

name: mp_solid_teammates
description: This command sets whether or not your teammates are solid. If teammates are solid, you cannot walk through them. Default is 1 (enabled, meaning you can't walk through your teammates).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to make teammates non-solid (you can walk through them). Set this to 1 to make teammates solid (you cannot move through them, but you can stand on top of them, etc).

name: mp_spawnprotectiontime
description: If someone team kills within the amount of time set by this command after round start (i.e. if someone kills someone within 5 seconds of the round starting), they will be kicked from the server. You can disable this by setting the command to 0.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, someone has to team-kill within (since the start of the round) in order to get kicked from the server. Set to 0 to disable.

name: mp_spec_swapplayersides
description: This command toggles the sides on which the player/team names are on when spectating. Default is 0, set to 1 to move to other side.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 for default side. Set this to 1 to move player names/team names to other side for spectators.

name: mp_spectators_max
description: This command sets the maximum amount of spectators that a game can have.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of spectators that a match can have. Default is 2.

name: mp_startmoney
description: This command sets how much money players are given at the beginning of a half. Default is 800.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of money that players on all teams should start each half with.

name: mp_swapteams
description: This command switches the teams (Ts would play as CTs and vice versa) and restarts the game (including scores).

name: mp_t_default_grenades
description: This command sets the default grenades that terrorists spawn with. Default is none (0). Separate multiple grenades with spaces.

arguments.label: Grenade Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the grenades you wish for Ts to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_t_default_melee
description: This command sets the default melee weapon that terrorists spawn with at the start of the round. Default is weapon_knife.

arguments.label: Weapon Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the melee weapons you wish for Ts to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_t_default_primary
description: This command sets the default primary weapon that terrorists spawn with at the start of the round. Default is none (0).

arguments.label: Weapon Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the primary weapons you wish for Ts to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_t_default_secondary
description: This command sets the default secondary weapon that terrorists spawn with at the start of the round. Default is weapon_glock.

arguments.label: Weapon Code(s)
arguments.description: The weapon codes of the secondary weapons you wish for Ts to spawn with by default. If multiple, separate them with spaces. Find codes here.

name: mp_td_dmgtokick
description: This command sets the amount of damage that a player has to do to their teammates in order to get kicked.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of damage (HP) a player must do in order to be kicked from the server for team damage.

name: mp_td_dmgtowarn
description: This command sets the total damage level at which players are warned they might be kicked from the server.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The total amount of damage players must do to teammates before they are warned that they will be kicked if they do more.

name: mp_td_spawndmgthreshold
description: This command sets the amount of damage that players have to do at the start of the round (default is within 5 seconds of start, but can be changed with mp_spawnprotectiontime) before they are kicked. Default damage amount is 50.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of damage players have to do at the start of a round in order to be kicked.

name: mp_teamcashawards
description: This command sets whether or not teams can earn money by performing in-game actions. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable. Set to 1 to enable (default).

name: mp_teamflag_1
description: This command sets the team 1 flag as the flag of the country with the specified alpha 2 code.

arguments.label: Country Alpha 2 Code
arguments.description: The alpha 2 code of the country that you wish to set as team 1's flag. For example, US for United States.

name: mp_teamflag_2
description: This command sets the team 2 flag as the flag of the country with the specified alpha 2 code.

arguments.label: Country Alpha 2 Code
arguments.description: The alpha 2 code of the country that you wish to set as team 2's flag. For example, US for United States.

name: mp_teamlogo_1
description: This command sets the logo of team 1 to the specified logo. Logo file should be placed in the "resource/flash/econ/tournaments/teams" folder.

arguments.label: Shorthand Code
arguments.description: The shorthand code of the team flag you wish to set. E.g. navi for Na`Vi

name: mp_teamlogo_2
description: This command sets the logo of team 2 to the specified logo. Logo file should be placed in the "resource/flash/econ/tournaments/teams" folder.

arguments.label: Shorthand Code
arguments.description: The shorthand code of the team flag you wish to set. E.g. navi for Na`Vi

name: mp_teammatchstat_cycletime
description: The command sets how often the team match stats should be cycled.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of seconds a match stat should be cycled for. Default is 45.

name: mp_teammates_are_enemies
description: This command, if enabled (set to 1), will make all teammates enemies. By default this is disabled.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make teammates non-enemies. Set to 1 to make teammates enemies.

name: mp_teamname_1
description: This command sets the name of team 1.

arguments.label: Team Name
arguments.description: Your desired team name for team 1.

name: mp_teamname_2
description: This command sets the name of team 2.

arguments.label: Team Name
arguments.description: Your desired team name for team 2.

name: mp_teamprediction_pct
description: This command will set the "prediction" for the counter-terrorist team to win the match. A value between 1 and 99 should be specified. Prediction for terrorist team will be calculated based on this value and automatically applied.

arguments.label: Prediction
arguments.description: The prediction that the CT team will win (a value between 1 and 99). Terrorist team prediction will be "100 - prediction".

name: mp_timelimit
description: The maximum duration of each game, in minutes. By default this is disabled (set to 0). If the total duration of the current map lasts longer than this value, the current map will end and the next map will begin play.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: Specify 0 to disable timelimit (default). The maximum amount of minutes that a map can last for.

name: mp_tkpunish
description: This command sets whether or not team killers/damagers should be punished in the following round. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not delay punishment of team damagers to next round. Enter 1 to delay punishment of team damagers to next round.

name: mp_unpause_match
description: This command unpauses the match, or cancels a pause that is set for the next round.

name: mp_use_respawn_waves
description: This command sets whether or not respawns should be done in waves (on deathmatch and other gamemodes where players respawn). Default is 0 (disabled). Waves mean dead players are respawned every x seconds (e.g. every 10 seconds all dead players are respawned, as opposed to relatively a few seconds after their death).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable respawn waves. Set to 1 to enable respawn waves.

name: mp_verbose_changelevel_spew
description: This command enables debugging messages for map changes. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable changelevel debugging. Set to 1 to enable debugging messages in console when a map is loaded (default).

name: mp_warmup_pausetimer
description: This command, if set to 1, will make the warmup last forever. Set to 0 (default) to disable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make the warmup count down as usual. Set to 1 to pause the warmup timer (meaning warmup won't end until your resume or forcefully end it).

name: mp_warmup_start
description: This command starts the warmup.

name: mp_warmuptime
description: This command sets how long the warmup lasts, in seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: Your desired warmup duration, in seconds.

name: mp_warmuptime_all_players_connected
description: This command sets the warmup countdown to switch to when all players connect. If the warmup countdown is already below this value, the countdown will not be changed.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The duration to shorten the warmup to when all players are connected to the server.

name: mp_weapons_allow_map_placed
description: This command, if disabled (0), will make it so weapons are not removed from the floor when the match starts. Default is enabled (1), meaning weapons are removed from the floor when the match starts.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to not remove weapons from the map ground when the match starts. Set this to 1 to clear all weapons on the floor when the match starts (default).

name: mp_weapons_allow_randomize
description: If you set this command to a value over 0, each buy menu category will be filled this amount of random weapons. With this set to 1, 1 weapon from rifles would be available for purchase, 1 from pistols, etc (would be changed each round to a new random weapon).

arguments.label: 0 / Amount
arguments.description: Set to 0 disable (default). Enter a number above 0 as the desired amont of random weapons from each category you want to make available for purchase.

name: mp_weapons_allow_zeus
description: This command sets whether or not the zeus (taser) can be purchased from the buy menu or not. Default is 1 (allowed to be purchased).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make it so that people cannot buy the zeus. Enter 1 to make it so that people can buy the zeus (default).

name: mp_weapons_glow_on_ground
description: This command sets whether or not weapons on the ground have a glow around them. By default this is disabled (set to 0).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make it so that weapons don't glow on the ground (default). Enter 1 to make weapons on the ground glow.

name: mp_win_panel_display_time
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that the win panel should be shown in between rounds. Default is 3 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the win panel should be displayed for.

name: needbackup
description: This command makes your character perform the "Need Backup!" radio command sending a message in chat and over sound.

name: net_allow_multicast
description: This command sets whether or not multicast is enabled. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to disable the multicast network setting. Enter 1 here to enable the multicast setting (default).

name: net_blockmsg
description: This command can be used to block incoming messages (network messages, not chat messages). Default is 0 (disabled). 1 would disable all messages. You can specify a network message name to block only that message.

arguments.label: 0 / 1 / Name
arguments.description: Set to 0 for acceptance of all network messages (default). Set to 1 to block all network messages. Enter a network message name to block only that message.

name: net_channels
description: This command prints to console network channel information.

name: net_droponsendoverflow
description: This command, if enabled, will end a connection (e.g. kick a player) when the client sends too much data (causing a buffer overrun). Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not drop on send overflow (default). Enter 1 to drop connections when too much data is sent.

name: net_droppackets
description: This command will drop the specified amount of packets. If you were to enter 10, the next 10 packets your client receives would be dropped.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of packets to drop. 10 would make the next 10 packets you receive be dropped.

name: net_dumpeventstats
description: This command prints to console debug information about network events.

name: net_fakejitter
description: This command will will cause your client to "jitter" (fake lag) for the specified amount of milliseconds.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The amount of milliseconds to fake jitter for. 1000 = 1 second.

name: net_fakelag
description: This command will simulate lag (high latency/packet delay) for the specified amount of milliseconds.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The amount of milliseconds to fake lag for. 2000 = 2 seconds.

name: net_fakeloss
description: This command will simulate packet loss on the specified percentage of packets (i.e. 50% would drop 50% of packets).

arguments.label: Percentage
arguments.description: The percentage of packets to drop (to simulate packet loss). 20 = 20%.

name: net_graphheight
description: This command sets the height of the net graph display in pixels. This is the amount of pixels it will be from the bottom of the screen. Default is 64.

arguments.label: Pixels
arguments.description: The distance, in pixels, to position the net graph from the bottom of the game,

name: net_graphmsecs
description: This command sets the amount of seconds that the latency graph should represent. Default is 400.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The amount of milliseconds that the latency graph should repesent. 1000 = 1 second.

name: net_graphpos
description: This command sets the position of the screen the netgraph display is placed at. Default is position 1 (right corner). Left corner is 0. Middle is 2.

arguments.label: Position #
arguments.description: The position number to position the net graph display in. 0 = left, 1 = right, 2 = middle.

name: net_graphproportionalfont
description: This command sets whether or not net graph font should be made proportional. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable. Enter 1 to enable proportional font.

name: net_graphshowinterp
description: This command sets whether or not interpolation should be shown in net_graph (when on a setting above net_graph 1).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not show interpolation. Enter 1 to show interpolation (default).

name: net_graphshowlatency
description: This command sets whether or not latency should be shown in net_graph (when on a setting above net_graph 1).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not show latency. Enter 1 to show (default).

name: net_graphshowsvframerate
description: This command, if set to 1, will draw the server framerate graph. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not show sv framerate. Enter 1 to show sv framerate (default).

name: net_graphsolid
description: This command sets whether or not the net graph display is solid. Default is enabled (1).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to make the graph not solid. Enter 1 to make the net_graph solid (default).

name: net_graphtext
description: The command sets whether or not the text fields like FPS, etc should be drawn in net_graph. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not show the net graph text fields. Enter 1 to show them (default).

name: net_maxroutable
description: This command sets the maximum packet size for the client before they are split.

arguments.label: Bytes
arguments.description: The maximum packet size, in bytes, before they are split.

name: net_public_adr
description: This command sets the public IP of the server (NAT/DHCP).

arguments.label: IP Address
arguments.description: The public IP address of the server.

name: net_showreliablesounds
description: This command, if set to 1 (default 0), will enable the printing of information about reliable sounds to the console.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable (default). Enter 1 to enable debug printing.

name: net_showsplits
description: This command, if set to 1 (default 0), will enable the printing of information about split packets to the developer console.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable (default). Enter 1 to enable debug printing.

name: net_showudp
description: This command, if set to 1 (default 0), will enable the printing of information about UDP packets to the console.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable (default). Enter 1 to enable debug printing.

name: net_showudp_oob
description: This command, if set to 1 (default 0), will enable the printing of information about OOB UDP packets to the console.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable (default). Enter 1 to enable debug printing.

name: net_showudp_remoteonly
description: This command, if set to 1 (default 0), will enable the printing of information about remote UDP packets to the console.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable (default). Enter 1 to enable debug printing.

name: net_splitrate
description: The maximum amount of fragments (parts) of a split packet that can be sent/read each server frame.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of split packets that can be read each server frame.

name: net_start
description: This command will start multiplayer network sockets.

name: net_status
description: This command prints to console information about your network.

name: net_steamcnx_allowrelay
description: This command will set whether or not steam connections are allowed to attempt to use relay servers as fallback. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disallow. Enter 1 to allow (default).

name: nextdemo
description: This command will make the next demo in your current demo sequence be played.

name: nextlevel
description: This command will make the server load/progress to the specified map at the end of the current game. In other words, this command sets the next map in the map cycle.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the next map to cycle to. View our map code list for map codes.

name: pause
description: This command will pause the game, provided you have sv_pausable set to 1 (otherwise this command won't work).

name: ping
description: This command prints to the console your current ping (to the server you're connected to).

name: play
description: This command will play the specified sound.

arguments.label: Sound
arguments.description: The name of the sound you wish to play.

name: play_distance
description: This command sets the distance at which sounds played with the sound command are played from. Default is 1.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The distance at which sounds played with the play command are played.

name: play_with_friends_enabled
description: This command sets whether or not play with friends is enabled. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable play with friends. Enter 1 to enable (default).

name: playdemo
description: This command plays the specified demo file. Demos should be placed in your Steam\steamapps\common\Counter-Strike Global Offensive\csgo folder. If you place them in your "replays" folder, you need to specify "replays/" before the demo name.

arguments.label: Demo File Name
arguments.description: The name of the demo file, placed in Steam\steamapps\common\Counter-Strike Global Offensive\csgo. You do not need to specify the .dem part of the file name. If you put the demo in replays folder, specify "replays/" before the name.

name: player_botdifflast_s
description: This command sets the difficulty of bots when they are the last man standing. Default is 2.

arguments.label: Difficulty
arguments.description:
Your desired difficulty. Options are:
0 - easy
1 - normal
2 - hard
3 - expert

name: player_competitive_maplist_8_4_0_EF00F6A0
description: This command sets your competitive map list. Separate each map code with a comma (no space).

arguments.label: Map List
arguments.description: A list of map codes to set as your competitive map list. Separate maps with commas and no space.

name: player_debug_print_damage
description: This command, if set to 1, will print debug information about all of the damage your player takes to the console. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable debug information (default). Set to 1 to print debug information about all damage done to your player to console (information printed as/when damage is done to you).

name: playflush
description: This command plays the specified sound file after reloading it from your files (incase of changes made since the file was loaded).

arguments.label: Sound
arguments.description: The name of the sound file you wish to play.

name: playgamesound
description: This command plays the specified sound that is defined the game_sounds.txt file.

arguments.label: Sound
arguments.description: The name of the sound from the game_sounds.txt file you wish to play.

name: playoverwatchevidence
description: This command will play the evidence for your current overwatch case.

name: quit
description: This command is the same as the "exit" command, it will close your game.

name: radarvisdistance
description: This command sets the distance at which an enemy will appear on your radar without your crosshair/view being on them. Default is 1000.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The maximum distance at which someone can be for them to show on your radar without you having your crosshair over them.

name: radarvismaxdot
description: Note that this command sets the setting for the server (so players on the server have this setting), not your client specifically. This command sets how closely you must point at a player in order to see them beyond the maximum distance set with radarvisdistance. Default is .996.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value for how closely you have to point at any enemy for them to show on your radar.

name: radarvismethod
description: Note that this command sets the setting for the server (so players on the server have this setting), not your client specifically. This command sets which radar visibility method is used. If set to 0, the classic method will be used. Default is 1, which is the newer and more realistic method.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to use classic radar visibility method. Set to 1 to use more realistic, newer radar visibility method (default).

name: radarvispow
description: Note that this command sets the setting for the server (so players on the server have this setting), not your client specifically.The degree to which you can look away from an enemy and still see them as a red dot on the radar.

arguments.label: Degree
arguments.description: The degree to which you can look away from a target and have them still appear on your radar (e.g. .4).

name: radio1
description: This command opens radio menu 1.

name: radio2
description: This command opens radio menu 2.

name: radio3
description: This command opens radio menu 3.

name: rangefinder
description: This command prints to console information about your position and range.

name: rate
description: This command sets the rate at which your client can receive network data in bytes. Set this to a lower value if you have a bad internet connection.

arguments.label: Rate (Bytes/s)
arguments.description: Your desired network rate in bytes per second.

name: rebuy
description: This command will make you attempt to repurchase the items you most recently purchased from the buy menu in the order set by the cl_rebuy command. Default order is "Armor PrimaryWeapon Flashbang SmokeGrenade Defuser HEGrenade Flashbang SecondaryWeapon Molotov IncGrenade Decoy Taser".

name: recompute_speed
description: This command recomputes clock speed.

name: record
description: This command will start recording your current game as a demo. You need to specify a filename to save the demo as. Use the "stop" command to stop recording. Demo will be saved in Steam\steamapps\common\Counter-Strike Global Offensive\csgo.

arguments.label: Demo File Name
arguments.description: The name of the file to save the demo as.

name: regroup
description: This command will make you perform the "regroup" radio command.

name: reload
description: This command will reload the most recent saved game.

name: remote_bug
description: This command will start a bug report with data from the currently connected rcon machine.

arguments.label: Default Value
arguments.description: Need to research default value as not crawled

name: removeallids
description: This command unbans all players from your current server.

name: removeid
description: This command removes the specified user ID from your server's ban list.

arguments.label: Steam ID
arguments.description: The steam ID of the user you wish to unban.

name: removeip
description: This command removes the specified IP address from your server's ban list.

arguments.label: IP Address
arguments.description: The IP address you wish to unban.

name: report
description: This command will make you perform the "report" radio command.

arguments.label: Default Value
arguments.description: Need to research default value as not crawled

name: reportingin
description: This command will make you perform the "reporting in" radio command.

name: reset_expo
description: This command will reset all player scores, team scores, etc at the end of the current roud.

name: reset_gameconvars
description: This command resets most game convars to their default values (useful if you've broken something).

name: respawn_entities
description: This command makes all entities that are in the map by default respawn.

name: restart
description: This command will restart the current game - reloading the map, scores, etc.

name: retry
description: This command will make you attempt to reconnect to the last server you were connected to.

name: roger
description: This command will make you perform the "roger that" radio command.

name: save
description: This command saves the current game.

name: scandemo
description: This command will scan the specified demo file for specific events and print the data to console.

arguments.label: Demo File Name
arguments.description: The name of the demo you wish to scan. Should be located in Steam\steamapps\common\Counter-Strike Global Offensive\csgo. If located in replays, specify "replays/" before the name.

name: screenshot
description: This command will take a screenshot of your game/client.

name: script
description: The command runs the specified text as a script.

arguments.label: Script Text
arguments.description: The text to run as a script.

name: script_client
description: The command runs the specified text as a client script.

arguments.label: Script Text
arguments.description: The text to run as a script.

name: sectorclear
description: This command makes you perform the "Sector clear!" radio command.

name: server_game_time
description: This command sets your server's game time (curtime) to the specified time in seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to set the server's game time to.

name: servercfgfile
description: This command sets your server's config file to the specified config file.

arguments.label: Config File Name
arguments.description: The name of the config file to use as the server's config file.

name: setang
description: This command sets your view to the specified pitch, yaw and (optional) roll.

arguments.label: Pitch
arguments.description: Your desired pitch angle (your player's will be set to this).

arguments.label: Yaw
arguments.description: Your desired pitch angle (your player's will be set to this).

arguments.label: Yaw
arguments.description: Your desired yaw angle (your player's will be set to this).

arguments.label: Roll
arguments.description: Your desired yaw angle (your player's will be set to this).

arguments.label: Roll
arguments.description: Optional. Your desired roll angle (your player's will be set to this).

name: setinfo
description: This command can be used to add a new user info value.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The value of the user info key.

name: setpos
description: This command teleports your player to the specified X, Y and Z coordinates.

arguments.label: X
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the location you wish to move your character to.

arguments.label: Y
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the location you wish to move your character to.

arguments.label: Y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the location you wish to move your character to.

arguments.label: Z
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the location you wish to move your character to.

arguments.label: Z
arguments.description: The Z coordinate of the location you wish to move your character to.

name: setpos_player
description: This command moves the specified user to the specified X, Y and Z coorinates. User ID is the number that's shown in the "status" command next to their name (usually 1-10).

arguments.label: User ID
arguments.description: The user ID of the user you wish to teleport, this is the number next to a player's name in the list of players printed by the "status" command.

arguments.label: X
arguments.description: The user ID of the user you wish to teleport, this is the number next to a player's name in the list of players printed by the "status" command.

arguments.label: X
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the location you wish to move the player to.

arguments.label: Y
arguments.description: The X coordinate of the location you wish to move the player to.

arguments.label: Y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the location you wish to move the player to.

arguments.label: Z
arguments.description: The Y coordinate of the location you wish to move the player to.

arguments.label: Z
arguments.description: The Z coordinate of the location you wish to move the player to.

name: shake
description: This command shakes the screen.

name: shake_stop
description: This command stops the screen from shaking (usually started by the shake command).

name: shake_testpunch
description: This command makes your screen shake as-if you were just punched.

name: showbudget_texture
description: This command enables the texture budget panel, if set to 1. Default is disabled (0).

name: showbudget_texture_global_dumpstats
description: This command prints to console texture budget debug information.

name: showconsole
description: This command opens the console.

name: showtriggers_toggle
description: This command will toggle the rendering of trigger brushes in your current map.

name: singlestep
description: This command, if set to 1, will make the game enginge run in single step mode. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable single step mode (default). Enter 1 to put the engine in single step mode.

name: skill
description: This command sets the game skill level (a value between 1 and 3).

name: skip_next_map
description: This command will make the next map in the server's map rotation be skipped.

name: spec_allow_roaming
description: This command may only work in demos/GOTV (and not on servers/matchmaking). Setting this to 1 will enable free roaming of the spectator camera. Default is 0 (no free roam).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable free roaming (default). Set to 1 to allow free roaming.

name: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_b
description: This command may only work in demos/GOTV (and not on servers/matchmaking). This command sets the B part of the RGB value for the spectator freeze cinematic lighting.

arguments.label: B
arguments.description: The blue value of your RBG value. Other commands to set RGB: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_g, spec_freeze_cinematiclight_r

name: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_g
description: This command may only work in demos/GOTV (and not on servers/matchmaking). This command sets the G part of the RGB value for the spectator freeze cinematic lighting.

arguments.label: G
arguments.description: The green value of your RBG value. Other commands to set RGB: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_b, spec_freeze_cinematiclight_r

name: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_r
description: This command may only work in demos/GOTV (and not on servers/matchmaking). This command sets the r part of the RGB value for the spectator freeze cinematic lighting.

arguments.label: R
arguments.description: The red value of your RBG value. Other commands to set RGB: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_g, spec_freeze_cinematiclight_b

name: spec_freeze_cinematiclight_scale
description: This command may only work in demos/GOTV (and not on servers/matchmaking). This command sets the scale of the spectator freeze cinematic lighting. Default is 2.

name: spike
description: This command generates a fake lag spike.

name: spincycle
description: This command is used to debug issues with the game and may cause your client to crash. It will make the engine spin cycle.

name: ss_enable
description: This command, if set to 1, enables split screen support in single player games (doesn't work in multiplayer).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable split screen (default). Set to 1 to enable.

name: ss_map
description: This command starts playing on the specified map with the maximuim possible amount of split screen players.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you wish to play splitscreen mode on.

name: ss_splitmode
description: This command sets the splitscreen mode the game is in. Default is 0 (the game decides the optimal setting). 1 is horizontal (a player on either side). 2 is vertical (one player at top, one player at bottom).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to let the game decide the optimal split screen mode (recommended). Enter 1 for horizontal split screen. Enter 2 to for vertical split screen.

name: star_memory
description: This command prints to console memory stats.

name: startdemos
description: This command starts to play demos in the current demo sequence.

name: startmovie
description: This command will start to record the game as a video (as if you were recording with a screen recorder). The file name is required, and the file type is recommended as it specified how the video is saved (as an avi, wav (sound), etc).

arguments.label: File Name
arguments.description: The name of the file to save the movie as.

arguments.label: File Type
arguments.description: The name of the file to save the movie as.

arguments.label: File Type
arguments.description: The type of video file to make, options are avi, raw, tga, jpg, wv or jpeg_quality.

name: startupmenu
description: This command opens up the initial menu screen, provided you aren't in a game.

name: stats
description: This command prints to console information about the server's performance.

name: status
description: This command prints to console information about the server your connected to, including the map, the players, your connection status and more.

name: sticktog
description: This command will make your character perform the "Stcik together, team" radio command.

name: stop
description: This command will end the recording of a demo started with the "record" command.

name: stopdemo
description: This command stops playback of a demo (i.e. if you are wathcing a demo, it will exit you out of the demo).

name: stopvideos
description: This command stops all videos currently playing on the screen.

name: store_version
description: This command sets which version of the store is to display in-game. Default is 1 (latest).

arguments.label: Version
arguments.description: The version of the store to display, a number.

name: sv_accelerate
description: This command sets how fast you accelerate when your player walks. Default is 5.5. Higher values make you accelerate faster, lower values make you accelerate slower. Your maximum speed is still capped, change this with sv_maxspeed.

arguments.label: Acceleration
arguments.description: The amount of acceleration a player should have. Default is 5.5.

name: sv_accelerate_use_weapon_speed
description: This command sets whether or not your acceleration should be affected by the weapon you are holding. By default this is enabled (1). If set to 0, your acceleration speed won't be affected by the weapon you're holding (e.g. an AWP won't make you accelerate slower).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable the weapon you're holding affecting your acceleration. Enter 1 to make it so that your weapon affects your acceleration (default).

name: sv_airaccelerate
description: This command sets how fast you accelerate when in the air. Default is 12.

arguments.label: Acceleration
arguments.description: The amount of acceleration your player should have when in the air. Default is 12.

name: sv_allow_thirdperson
description: This command sets whether or not third person mode is allowed on the server. Default is 0 (not allowed).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow third person (default). Set to 1 to allow third person.

name: sv_allow_votes
description: This command sets whether or not votes (e.g. timeout votes) are allowed. Default is allowed (1), set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable/disallow players from calling votes. Set to 1 to allow players to start votes.

name: sv_allow_wait_command
description: This command sets whether or not the wait command is allowed. Default is 1 (allowed).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow the wait command. Set to 1 to allow the wait command.

name: sv_allowdownload
description: This command sets whether or not clients can download files from the server (e.g. map files). Default is 1 (allowed).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow clients downloading files. Set to 1 to allow (default).

name: sv_allowupload
description: This command sets whether or not clients can upload files to the server (usually customization files).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow clients uploading files (default). Set to 1 to allow.

name: sv_alltalk
description: This command sets whether or not players can hear the voice communications of the enemy team. Default is 0 (can't hear enemies).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make it so that players only hear the voice communications their own team. Set to 1 to make it so that players can hear the voice communitions of their enemy team.

name: sv_alternateticks
description: This command, if enabled (1), will only simulate entities (e.g. bots) on even numbered ticks. Reduces server load. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Set to 1 to only simulate entities on even numbered ticks (reduces server load).

name: sv_arms_race_vote_to_restart_disallowed_after
description: This command sets the gun level at which a vote to restart the game is not allowed in Arms Race. If this is set to 5, after someone reaches gun level 5 (or above), a vote to restart the game would not be allowed. Default is 0 (disabled, vote allowed at any time).

arguments.label: Level
arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable this feature. The level which, after it has been reached, votes to restart the game are not allowed.

name: sv_auto_full_alltalk_during_warmup_half_end
description: This command, if enabled (1), will make it so that "alltalk mode" (voice communications are sent to and heard by enemies) is enabled during warmup, halftime and at the end of the game. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable alltalk during warmup, halftime and at the end of the game. Set to 1 to allow players to hear and communicate (voice) with enemies at warmup, half time and at the end of the game.

name: sv_bounce
description: This command sets the "bounce multiplier" for when collision between two entities are made. For example, with this at a value above 1, you will bounce when you jump on the head of a teammate.

name: sv_cheats
description: This command sets whether or not cheat commands are allowed on the server. Cheat commands are commands that affect gameplay (and not just your client). Default is disabled (0), set to 1 to enable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable cheat commands. Set to 1 to enable cheat commands.

name: sv_clearhinthistory
description: This command clears the server's memory of hints displayed to players.

name: sv_coaching_enabled
description: This command, if set to 1, allows for a player to spectate/communicate with a team as a coach. Default is disabled (0). Use "coach t" or "coach ct" to become a coach after enabling.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable coaching (default). Set to 1 to enable coaching.

name: sv_competitive_minspec
description: This command sets whether or not client convars are limited to their minimum/maximum values (e.g. field of view) to prevent players from getting a big competitive advantage. Default is 1 (enabled), which is recommended.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable forcing the client convars to their minimum/maximum values. Set to 1 to disallow the client setting convars outside of their min/max values (default and recommened).

name: sv_competitive_official_5v5
description: This command, if set to 1 (enabled), forces the server to show a 5v5 scoreboard and allows spectators to see outline glows of players through walls.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable. Set to 1 to enable.

name: sv_consistency
description: This command sets whether or not "critical files" should be checked and be consistent with the server's files. If enabled, this will kick a player if they don't have consistent (i.e. different/changed) files.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not check for file consistency (default). Set to 1 to check for file consistency on critical files.

name: sv_contact
description: This command sets the contact email for the server. Default is 0 (no contact email).

name: sv_damage_print_enable
description: This command sets whether or not the damage a player dealt/received (in the current round) is printed to the console when they are killed. By default this is enabled (allowing you to see the damage you dealth/received in the console after you die). Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not show damage dealt/received in console. Set to 1 to enable the printing of damage players receive and deal in the console (default).

name: sv_dc_friends_reqd
description: This command sets whether or not players can directly connect to a game (i.e. with the IP address or via invite) when the game has started. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not allow players to connect to the game once it has started. Set to 1 to allow players to connect to the game directly once it has started.

name: sv_deadtalk
description: This command, if enabled (1), allows dead players to speak to those still alive. Default is enabled (1), set to 0 to not allow dead players to speak to players still alive. On either setting, dead players can hear both dead and alive players.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow dead players from speaking to those still alive. Set to 1 to allow dead players to speak to alive players.

name: sv_downloadurl
description: This command sets the URL at which clients can download files that they are missing.

arguments.label: URL
arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Specify a URL here as a URL for players to download missing files from.

name: sv_footstep_sound_frequency
description: This command sets how frequent player footsteps are heard, both from other players and each player themselves. 0 would make footsteps very frequent (like the sound is being spammed), 0.97 is default.

arguments.label: Frequency
arguments.description: Your desired frequency of footsteps. 0 being very frequent and 1 being less frequent.

name: sv_force_transmit_players
