description: This command, if set to 1 (enabled), will transmit data about every player to clients regardless of whether or not a player is visible to the client. This is by default set to 0, meaning you will only receive data about a player if they should be visible - this is a feature to prevent wall hacks,etc from seeing across the entire map.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to only send clients data about players that should be visible on their screen. Set to 1 to send clients data for all player, regardless of visibility.

name: sv_forcepreload
description: This command, if set to 1, forces server side preloading. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not force server preloading. Set to 1 to force preloading.

name: sv_friction
description: This command sets the world friction. Default value is 5.2.

arguments.label: Friction
arguments.description: Your desired world friction, default is 5.2. Higher numbers = more friction.

name: sv_full_alltalk
description: This command, if enabled (1), allows players from any team (including spectators) to speak to and hear eachother over voice chat. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable full alltalk. Set to 1 to enable full alltalk.

name: sv_game_mode_convars
description: This command prints to console the default values of convars for the current gamemode.

name: sv_gameinstructor_disable
description: This command, if set to 1 (enabled), will force all clients to disable their game instructors.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not force clients to disable their game instructors. Set to 1 to force clients to disable their game instructors.

name: sv_gravity
description: This command sets the world's gravity. Default value is 800. Higher values make gravity more powerful, lower values make gravity less powerful (lower allows you to jump higher, fall slower, etc).

arguments.label: Gravity
arguments.description: The amount of gravity to set the world's to. Default is 800.

name: sv_grenade_trajectory_dash
description: This command, if enabled (1), will make the grenade trajectory style be "dot-dash". You need sv_grenade_trajectory to be set to 1 for this to have any effect.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to have the default grenade trajectory style (line). Set to 1 to enable the dot dash grenade trajectory style.

name: sv_grenade_trajectory_thickness
description: This command sets the thickness of the grenade trajectory lines drawn when the sv_grenade_trajectory command is enabled. Default is 0.2.

arguments.label: Thickness
arguments.description: Your desired grenade trajectory thickness. Default is 0.2. Higher numbers are thicker, lower numbers are thinner.

name: sv_grenade_trajectory_time
description: This command sets the length of time, in seconds, that grenade trajectories display for after having been drawn. Default is 20, so after 20 seconds they disappear.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to show a grenade trajectory for before hiding it.

name: sv_grenade_trajectory_time_spectator
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that grenade trajectories are drawn on the screen for spectators. Default is 4, so after 4 seconds, for spectators, grenade trajectories disappear.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to show a grenade trajectory for for spectators.

name: sv_holiday_mode
description: This command sets the holiday mode for the server. Default is 0 (off). See argument information for help.

arguments.description: Set to 0 (default) for no holiday mode. Set to 1 for halloween mode. Set to 1 for winter mode.

name: sv_ignoregrenaderadio
description: This command, if set to 1 (enabled), will turn off grenade radio messages (i.e. "Fire in the hole!" messages).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not ignore grenade radio messages. Set to 1 to ignore (not hear) grenade radio messages,

name: sv_kick_ban_duration
description: This command sets, in minutes, how long a kick ban from the server lasts.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: The duration, in minutes, of a kick ban from your server.

name: sv_kick_players_with_cooldown
description: This command sets whether or not players who have been VAC banned or overwatch banned (or griefing banned) should be denied access to your server. Default is 1 - which prevents people with VAC/overwatch bans from connecting, but not those with griefing or match making cooldowns.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not kick any players (including those with VAC bans and overwatch bans). Set to 1 to kick players with overwatch and VAC bans. Set to 2 to kick all players with any form of ban or cooldown, including those from matchmaking like bans for damaging teammates, leaving too many games, etc.

name: sv_lagcompensateself
description: This command sets whether or not players can lag compensate themselves. By default this is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not allow players to lag compensate themselves. Set to 1 to enable.

name: sv_lan
description: This command sets whether or not the server is a LAN server. If a server is a LAN server there is no heartbeat, no Steam authentication, and no non-class C addresses. By default this is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make the server not a LAN server (default). Set to 1 to make the server a LAN server.

name: sv_log_onefile
description: This command, if enabled, logs all server information to one file, instead of individual (categorised) log files. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to log to multiple files (default behaviour). Set to 1 to log all information to just 1 file.

name: sv_logbans
description: This command, if enabled (1), will make server bans be logged in the server log. Default is 0 (does not log bans).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not log bans to the log file (default). Set to 1 to log bans to the log file.

name: sv_logblocks
description: This command, if enabled (1), will log when server queries are blocked. Default is 0 (does not log bans). Note that if you enable this, log files can become very large.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not log blocked queries in the log file (default). Set to 1 to log every time a query is blocked in the log file (can result in big log files as queries are blocked very often).

name: sv_logecho
description: This command sets whether or not all of text that is saved to the log file is also written in the console. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not also print log information in the console. Set to 1 to print everything that is logged to the log file to the console as well (default).

name: sv_logecho
description: This command sets whether or not all of text that is saved to the log file is also written in the console. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not also print log information in the console. Set to 1 to print everything that is logged to the log file to the console as well (default).

name: sv_logfile
description: This command sets whether or not server information should be logged in the log file. Default is 1 (enabled). Setting this to 0 will disable server information being logged.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to use multiple log files. Set this to 1 to use just one log file for everything.

name: sv_logflush
description: This command sets whether or not the log file should be flushed/saved to the disk whenever something is logged. By default this is disabled, meaning the log file is flushed/saved at intervals, as opposed to whenever a new line is added. If you enable this setting, it may cause lag.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 for default log file saving behaviour. Set this to 1 to save the log file to disk whenever a change is made (slow/laggy).

name: sv_logsdir
description: This command sets the directory to which log files are saved. Default is "logs".

arguments.label: Directory Name
arguments.description: The name of the directory that logs should be saved to (relative to your CS:GO directory).

name: sv_matchend_drops_enabled
description: This command sets whether or not drops at the end of the match are enabled. Rewards gameplay time is accumulated regardless.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable drops at the end of the match. Set to 1 to enable drops on the server (default).

name: sv_matchpause_auto_5v5
description: This command, if enabled, will automatically pause the match at the end of a round if the are less than 5 players on each team. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not pause the match if there are less than 5 players on each team. Set to 1 to pause.

name: sv_max_allowed_net_graph
description: This command sets the maximum value players can set their net_graph to on the server. Default is 1. Higher values show more information.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: The maximum value that clients can set their net_graph value to.

name: sv_max_queries_sec
description: This command sets the maximum amount of queries per second that will be responded to from the same IP address.

name: sv_max_queries_sec_global
description: This command sets the maximum amount of queries per second that the server will responsd to.

name: sv_max_queries_tracked_ips_max
description: The command sets the maximum amount of IPs that will be saved/logged for query-related rate limiting.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of IPs to track.

name: sv_max_queries_tracked_ips_prune
description: This command sets how often, in seconds, the tracked IPs for query rate limiting will be pruned.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The delay, in seconds, between each tracked IP prune.

name: sv_max_queries_window
description: The time window, in seconds, that average queries per second should be calculated over.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The time window, in seconds, to calculate the average from.

name: sv_maxrate
description: This command sets the maximum bandwidth rate allowed (both incoming/outcoming) per second (in bytes) for each connection to the server.

arguments.label: Bytes/s
arguments.description: The maximum bandwidth rate, in bytes per second. Set to 0 to disable.

name: sv_maxspeed
description: This command sets the maximum speed for each player on the server. A higher value will allow players to reach faster speeds. A lower value will make players be able to reach lower speeds.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The maximum speed players can reach. Default is 320. Higher = faster, lower = slower.

name: sv_maxuptimelimit
description: This command sets the maximum amount of time, in hours, that a server can run for before shutting itself down. Default is 0 (no limit).

arguments.label: Hours
arguments.description: The maximum amount of time, in hours, that the server can run for.

name: sv_maxusrcmdprocessticks
description: This command sets the maximum amount of ticks that can be processed per second when a user is catching up as a result of packet loss.

arguments.label: Ticks
arguments.description: The amount of ticks that can be processed as a result of packet loss. Default is 16. Set to 0 to disable.

name: sv_memlimit
description: This command, if set, will shutdown the server at the end of a game if the amount of memory it is using is above this amount in megabytes. Note that this doesn't limit memory during the game, it will only shut down the server at the end of the match if it is exceeding this amount. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.label: Megabytes
arguments.description: The memory limit, in MB. Set to 0 to disable.

name: sv_mincmdrate
description: This command sets the server's minimum tick rate. This can be used to change the server to 128 tick, in combination with the sv_minupdaterate command. Default is 64 tick.

arguments.label: Tick Rate
arguments.description: Your desired minimum command tick rate, e.g. 128 ticks per second.

name: sv_minrate
description: This command sets the minimum bandwidth rate that is allowed for clients connected to the server. Default is 16,000. 0 disables the limit.

arguments.label: Bytes/s
arguments.description: The minimum network rate, in byte/s, that a client can have. Set to 0 to disable limit (not recommended).

name: sv_minupdaterate
description: This command sets the minimum update rate for the server. This can be used in combation with the sv_mincmdrate command to change the server's tick rate (e.g. to 128 tick).

arguments.label: Tick Rate
arguments.description: Your desired minimum update rate, e.g. 128 ticks per second.

name: sv_minuptimelimit
description: This commands sets the minimum uptime hours required for the server to be stopped due to a memory amount above the amount set by sv_memlimit. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.label: Hours
arguments.description: The minimum amount of hours to be reached before the server can be stopped due to sv_minuptimelimit.

name: sv_noclipaccelerate
description: This command sets the acceleration multiplier for noclip mode. With this set to 5 (default) you accelerate 5 times as fast.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount to multiply the server's player acceleration by for those in noclip mode.

name: sv_noclipduringpause
description: This command sets whether or not you can move around during puases when in noclip mode. Default is 0 (not allowed).

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to not allow players in noclip mode to move during pauses. Set this to 1 to allow players in noclip mode to move when the game is paused.

name: sv_party_mode
description: This command can be used to enable (1) or disable (0) party mode. When in party mode, bombs and tasers will shoot confetti. By default, this setting is disabled.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to disable party mode (default). Set this to 1 to enable party mode, making zeuses (tasers) and the bomb shoot confetti.

name: sv_password
description: This command can be used to set a password required to connect to the server. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.label: 0 / Password
arguments.description: Set this to 0 to make it so that a password isn't required to connect to the server (default). Enter a password here to prompt users for it when they try to connect (they cannot connect if they do not get it correct).

name: sv_pausable
description: This command, if set to 1, will make the server pausable. By default this is set to 0 (server isn't pausable). If the server is pausable, users can type "pause" or "unpause" into the console to pause/resume the game.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to make the server not pausable (default). Set this to 1 to allow users to pause the server via the pause and unpause console commands.

name: sv_precacheinfo
description: This command prints to the console precache information.

name: sv_pure
description: This command, if set to 1, will make it so that the files of every client connected to the server have to match the server's files. Those in the pure_server_whitelist.txt file aren't checked.

arguments.description: Set this to 0 to not require clients files to match the server files. Set this to 1 to make it so that clients will be kick if their files don't match the server's.

name: sv_pure_consensus
description: This command sets the minimum number of file hashes that have to be agreed in order to form a consensus.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The minimum amount of file hashes required for a decision to be reached.

name: sv_pure_kick_clients
description: This command, if set to 1, will kick players who fail the sv_pure check (have different files). This is set to 1 by default. Set to 0 to issue a warning instead of kick.

arguments.description: Enter 0 here to issue only a warning to clients who fail the sv_pure check. Enter 1 here to kick clients that fail the sv_pure check.

name: sv_pure_listfiles
description: This command lists the server files that are checked with the client's files (for sv_pure 1).

name: sv_pure_retiretime
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, the server should have in idle time before the sv_pure file hash cache is cleared.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, of server idle before the sv_pure file hash cache is flushed.

name: sv_pure_trace
description: This command, if set to 1, will make the server print a message to console whenever trying to verify a CRC for a file.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not print to console when trying to verify a client's file(s) (default). Set to 1 to print a message to console when trying to verify a file.

name: sv_querycache_stats
description: This command prints to console statistics about the query cachhe, including the amount of queries in the cache, the amount missed, and free space.

name: sv_rcon_whitelist_address
description: This command can set an IP address to whitelist from rcon failed authentication bans. Failed authentication bans are bans issued when you get the rcon password wrong too many times - the IP address this is set to will never be banned for this reason.

arguments.label: IP Address
arguments.description: The IP address you wish to whitelist.

name: sv_regeneration_force_on
description: This command turns on regenerative health, if it is set to 1. Default is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable regenerative force. Set to 1 to enable regenerative force.

name: sv_region
description: This command sets the server's region (that shows in queries, etc) to the specified region. See argument information for regions.

name: sv_reliableavatardata
description: This command sets how players avatars are exchanged. Default is 0 (Steam). See argument information for help.

arguments.description: Set to 0 for avatars to be obtained via Steam. Set to 1 for users avatar data to be obtained from the users themselves. Set to 2 for users avatars to be obtained from the server.

name: sv_reservation_timeout
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, before a lobby reservation expires.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, before a lobby invite expires.

name: sv_search_key
description: This command sets the search key for dedicated servers you search for when in a lobby. Only servers with keys that match this key will be returned from the search. Set to 0 to disable.

name: sv_server_verify_blood_on_player
description: This command sets whether or not blood splatters should be verified with the server. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not verify player blood splatters with the server. Set to 1 to verify player blood splatters with the server (default).

name: sv_show_cull_props
description: This command, if enabled (1), prints a list of props that are being culled. By default this is set to 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable (default). Enter 1 to enable the debug messages.

name: sv_showimpacts
description: This command can be used to show bullet impacts. Bullet impacts are shown as colored squares at the location your bullets collided with something (e.g. a player, a wall). See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - disabled (default)
1 - enabled (show client (red) and server (blue) impact locations)
2 - show only client bullet impact locations
3 - show only server bullet impact locations

name: sv_showimpacts_penetration
description: This command, if enabled (1), shows extra information at the impact locations when sv_showimpacts is on. Default is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Set to 1 to enable.

name: sv_showimpacts_time
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that bullet impact squares show for before they are removed. Default is 4 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that bullet impacts should show for before being removed.

name: sv_showlagcompensation
description: This command enables (if set to 1) the lag compensated hitboxes of players. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Enter 0 to not display lag compensated hitboxes (default). Enter 1 to draw lag compensated hitboxes for players.

name: sv_showtags
description: This command prints to console the current server's public and private gametags.

name: sv_shutdown
description: This command will make the server shutdown after the current match (and any in queue) have ended.

name: sv_skyname
description: This can be used to change your client's skybox. Specify the name of a skybox to apply that skybox. See argument information for skybox names.

arguments.label: Skybox Code
arguments.description:
Your desired skybox's code. Codes are:
cs_baggage_skybox_
cs_tibet
embassy
italy
jungle
office
sky_cs15_daylight01_hdr
sky_cs15_daylight02_hdr
sky_cs15_daylight03_hdr
sky_cs15_daylight04_hdr
sky_day02_05
nukeblank
sky_venice
sky_csgo_cloudy01
sky_csgo_night02
sky_csgo_night02b
vertigo
vertigoblue_hdr
sky_dust
vietnam

name: sv_soundemitter_reload
description: This command flushes the sounds.txt system.

name: sv_spawn_afk_bomb_drop_time
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that a player much be AFK for in order for the bomb to be dropped.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, players have to be inactive for in order to drop the bomb automatically.

name: sv_spec_hear
description: This command sets which voice communications spectators can hear. Seea rgument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - only hear other spectators
1 - all players from all teams, including spectators
2 - only the team they're spectating
3 - only themself
4 - no one

name: sv_specaccelerate
description: This command sets the acceleration multiplier for spectators in noclip mode.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The value to multiply the server's sv_accelerate value by for spectators in noclip mode.

name: sv_specnoclip
description: This command, if set to 1, enables noclip mode for spectators. Default is 1 (eabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable noclip for spectators. Set to 1 to enable noclip for spectators.

name: sv_specspeed
description: This command sets the speed multiplier for spectators in noclip mode.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The value to multiply the server's sv_maxspeed value by for spectators in noclip mode.

name: sv_staminajumpcost
description: This command sets the stamina penalty you receive after jumping. The stamina penalty reduces your movement speed by this percentage (0.08 = 8%).

arguments.label: Penalty
arguments.description: The stamina penalty to apply when you jump.

name: sv_staminalandcost
description: This command sets the stamina penalty you receive after landing from a jump. The amount given is the percentage your speed is reduced by. 1 = you speed is reduced by 100%, 0.5 = 50%.

arguments.label: Penalty
arguments.description: The stamina penalty to apply when you land from a jump.

name: sv_staminamax
description: This command sets the maximum stamina penalty that you can receive. After reaching this value, your stamina penalty will not go any higher. Default is 80.

arguments.label: Maximum
arguments.description: The maximum value your stamina penalty can accumulate to (it is capped at this value).

name: sv_staminarecoveryrate
description: This command sets the rate at which your stamina recovers (in units per second). Default is 60.

arguments.label: Units/s
arguments.description: The rate your stamina recovers at, in units per second.

name: sv_steamgroup
description: This command sets the offical Steam group of the server. The ID can be found in your group's admin profile page.

arguments.label: Group ID
arguments.description: The ID, from the group's admin profile page, of the group to set as the server's official Steam group.

name: sv_steamgroup_exclusive
description: This command can be used to whitelist your server to only those in the server's Steam group (sv_steamgroup). Default is 0 (no whitelist). See argument information for settings.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not make your server exclusive to your Steam group. Set to 1 to allow other people to connect to the server only when someone from the Steam group is online (i.e. when the server is empty, no one can join). Set to 2 to make it so that only people from the Steam group can connect.

name: sv_stopspeed
description: This command sets the speed at which your player stops moving completely. When a player's speed is below this value, they will stop moving.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The speed at which players will stop moving at.

name: sv_tags
description: This command sets the server's tags that show in the community server browser. Separate each tag with a comma.

arguments.label: Tags
arguments.description: The tags to set for your server, each separated by a comma.

name: sv_visiblemaxplayers
description: This command can be used to set a "maximum players" number that's visible to people in the server browser and server queries. This number is only for show, and the actual maximum number of players that can join is set by the "maxplayers" command.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of players ("slots") that are shown to players in the server browser and in server queries for server lists.

name: sv_voiceenable
description: This command sets whether or not voice is enabled on the server. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable voice communication entirely on the server. Set to 1 to enable voice communication on the server.

name: sv_vote_allow_in_warmup
description: This command sets whether or not votes (e.g. vote to kick) are allowed during the warmup. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow voting in warmup (default). Set to 1 to allow.

name: sv_vote_allow_spectators
description: This command sets whether or not votes (e.g. vote for timeout) can be called or voted on by spectators. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make it so that spectators can't call vote or vote in them. Set to 1 to allow spectators voting rights.

name: sv_vote_command_delay
description: This command sets the delay, in seconds, before the action resulting from a vote happens. If this is set to 2, a player would be kicked 2 seconds after the vote has reached a decision.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait before issuing the action that results from a successful vote.

name: sv_vote_creation_timer
description: This command sets how often each player can call a vote, in seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, a player has to wait before calling another vote.

name: sv_vote_failure_timer
description: This command sets how long a player must wait before re-submitting a vote that has failed, in seconds. Default is 300.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that a player needs to wait before they can re-call a vote that didn't pass.

name: sv_vote_issue_kick_allowed
description: This command sets whether or not vote to kick players is enabled. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable vote kicks. Set to 1 to allow for vote kicks.

name: sv_vote_issue_loadbackup_allowed
description: This command sets whether or not players can vote to load match from the most recent backup. Default is 1 (enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable players voting to load the game from the latest backup. Set to 1 to enable this vote.

name: sv_vote_kick_ban_duration
description: This command sets the amount of time, in minutes, that a vote kick bans a player from the server for. Set to 0 to disable. Default is 15.

arguments.label: Minutes
arguments.description: The duration of a ban from a vote kick, in minutes.

name: sv_vote_quorum_ratio
description: This command sets the percentage of players that must vote in favor of an action in order for it to take place. 0.5 = 50%, 0.4 = 40%, etc.

arguments.label: Percentage
arguments.description: The percentage of players that must vote yes in order for a vote to be successful, given as a demical percentage, 0.5 = 50%, 0.55 = 55%, etc.

name: sv_vote_timer_duration
description: This command sets the duration, in seconds, that players have to vote for a vote that has been called.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, players have to vote on a vote timer.

name: sv_workshop_allow_other_maps
description: This command sets whether or not workshop maps outside of the server's map cycle can be played on the server. By default this is enabled (1).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not allow players to play other workshop maps. Set to 1 to allow players to play other workshop maps.

name: takepoint
description: This command makes you perform the "You take the point" radio command.

name: takingfire
description: This command makes you perform the "Taking fire...need assistance!" radio command.

name: teammenu
description: This command opens the team selection menu, which allows you to choose a side (or to spectate).

name: think_limit
description: This command sets the maximum think time in milliseconds. If the think time exceeds this amount, a warning will be printing to console. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: Your desired think limit, in milliseconds.

name: thirdperson
description: This command puts you in third person mode. Use firstperson to return.

name: timeleft
description: This command prints to console the amount of time that remains in the match.

name: toggle
description: The command will toggle a convar on and off (between 0 and 1), or cycle it through its values.

arguments.label: Command
arguments.description: The command (convar) you wish to toggle.

arguments.label: Values
arguments.description: The command (convar) you wish to toggle.

arguments.label: Values
arguments.description: Optional. If you don't specify any values here, the command will be toggled between 0 and 1. Specify a list of values to toggle through, separated by spaces (e.g. "0 1 2 3" without quotes).

name: toggleconsole
description: This command toggles visibility of the console. Obviously if the console is closed, you can't use this command - it is primarily used in binds (where you can execute commands without the console being open)./

name: togglescores
description: This command toggles visibility of the scoreboard.

name: unpause
description: This command unpauses the game, provided it was previously paused with the "pause" command, use mp_unpause_match to unpause other pauses.

name: voice_caster_enable
description: This command sets whether or not voice casting is enabled, and if so, the account number of the user who is casting. We assume (untested) that the account number is the 3 ID of the caster without the STEAM_0:1 part of the ID. Format is usually STEAM_0:1:#####.

arguments.label: 0 / Account #
arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Specify the account number (Steam ID without the STEAM_0:1: part) of the caster here to enable.

name: voice_caster_scale
description: This command sets the volume of the GOTV caster. Default is 1, lower numbers (decimal) are quieter. 0 is off.

arguments.description: A number between 0 and 1 to represent the scale of the caster's voice. 1 being loudest and 0 being muted. 0.5 would be 50% volume.

name: voice_recordtofile
description: This command, if enabled (1), will record microphone data and voice data to the files 'voice_micdata.wav' and 'voice_decompressed.wav'.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable recording to file (default). Set to 1 to enable recording voice to file.

name: voice_reset_mutelist
description: This command unmutes all players who have been muted with the voice_mute command.

name: volume
description: This command sets the volume of your game, 1 being loudest and 0 being muted.

arguments.description: A value between 1 and 0 to set your volume to. 0.5 = 50% volume, 1 = max volume.

name: weapon_accuracy_nospread
description: This command, if enabled (set to 1), will disable weapon inaccuracy spread, meaing weapons will be 100% accurate at any distance. Default is disabled (1).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make it so that weapons have differing accuracy at distances (default). Set to 1 to make weapons 100% accurate regardless of distance.

name: weapon_debug_spread_show
description: This command can be used to enable the display of weapon accuracy. See argument information for help.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable. Set to 1 to show accuracy box of weapon at crosshair. Set to 3 to show accuracy box with a dynamic crosshair (that changes when you shoot).

name: weapon_recoil_cooldown
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that it takes for recoil to recover in between shots. After this amount of time, recoil will be reset to the same as it is when you shoot your first bullet. If set to 0, you can continuously tap without having any recoil.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, you must not fire a shot for in order for your recoil to fully reset. Default is 0.55.

name: weapon_recoil_decay1_exp
description: This command sets the decay factor exponent for weapon recoil. Default is 3.5.

name: weapon_recoil_decay2_exp
description: This command sets the decay factor exponent for weapon recoil. Default is 8.

name: weapon_recoil_decay2_lin
description: This command sets the linear term decay factor exponent for weapon recoil. Default is 18.

arguments.label: Decay Factor
arguments.description: Your desired linear recoil decay factor.

name: weapon_recoil_scale
description: This command sets the scale factor for recoil - i.e. the higher this number is, the bigger recoil will be.

arguments.label: Scale
arguments.description: The number to multiply weapon recoil by. Default is 2. 0 would make there be no recoil. 4 would make their be 2x as much recoil.

name: weapon_recoil_suppression_factor
description: We tested this command and found that it may not work at all or as intended. This command sets the "initial recoil suppression factor". This factor sets how much the first shot (or the amount of shots set by weapon_recoil_suppression_factor) of a gun has its recoil supressed for. If you set this to 0, there would be no recoil after the first shot of guns (but shots after that would be normal recoil). With this at 0.5, the first shot of a gun would have 50% of its normal recoil.

arguments.description: A number between 0 and 1, your desired suppression factor for the first bullet fired by a gun, or the first number of bullets set by weapon_recoil_suppression_shots.

name: weapon_recoil_suppression_shots
description: We tested this command and found that it may not work at all or as intended. This command sets the number of shots that are fired before a weapon uses normal (unsuppressed) recoil. Suppression is set by weapon_recoil_suppression_factor cvar.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of bullets that are affected by weapon_recoil_suppression_factor, if set to 1, only the first bullet would be affected.

name: weapon_recoil_suppression_shots
description: We tested this command and found that it may not work at all or as intended. This command sets the number of shots that are fired before a weapon uses normal (unsuppressed) recoil. Suppression is set by weapon_recoil_suppression_factor cvar.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of bullets that are affected by weapon_recoil_suppression_factor, if set to 1, only the first bullet would be affected.

name: weapon_recoil_variance
description: We tested this command and found that it may not work at all or as intended. This command sets the amount of variance between each recoil impulse. In other words, this command can be used to change how random recoil is (with this set to 0 it would be the same pattern every time).

arguments.description: A number between 0 and 1 that represents the amount of variance that recoil has. 0 would make every recoil pattern the same, 0.5 would make every recoil pattern have some randomness.

name: weapon_recoil_vel_decay
description: This command sets the decay factor for weapon recoil velocity.

arguments.label: Decay Factor
arguments.description: The decay factor for recoil velocity.

name: weapon_recoil_view_punch_extra
description: This command controls how hard your screen shakes when you are affected by recoil. Default is 0.055.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: A number that represents how much your view shakes when you are affected by recoil (i.e. fire a gun). 0 would make there be no shake, 0.5 would be a lot of shake. Default is 0.055.

name: weapon_reload_database
description: This command reloads the weapon database.

name: weapon_reticle_knife_show
description: This command sets whether or not your crosshair shows when you have your knife equipped. Only makes a change for crosshair styles that hide your crosshair when holding a knife.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not show crosshair when holding knife. Set to 1 to show crosshair when holding knife.

name: workshop_publish
description: This command opens the workshop publish dialog.

name: workshop_start_map
description: This command loads the workshop map with the specified ID.

arguments.label: File ID
arguments.description: The ID of the workshop map you wish to load/start. This is the number part at the end of the workshop page URL after ?id=.

name: workshop_workbench
description: This command opens up the workshop workbench dialog.

name: ammo_item_limit_healthshot
description: This command sets the maximum amount of healthshots that you can hold at once.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of healthshots that you can carry at once.

name: cash_team_survive_guardian_wave
description: This command sets the amount of money a team receives when they survive a wave in the guardian coop gamemode.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of money the team should receive for surviving a wave.

name: cl_countbones
description: This command will render and count the amount of bones (bones of players and entities) on the screen, if set to 1.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Set to 1 to render and count bones of entities.

name: cl_crosshair_sniper_show_normal_inaccuracy
description: This command, if enabled (1), will make it so that standing inaccuracy will also affect the blur of a sniper's crosshair. By default, this is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not show inaccuracy when standing still (default). Set to 1 to blur crosshair for standing inaccuracy as well as moving.

name: cl_crosshair_sniper_width
description: This command sets the width, in pixels, of the width of the crosshair when scoped in with a sniper rifle.

arguments.label: Pixels
arguments.description: Your desired width of the sniper crosshair, in pixels.

name: cl_crosshair_t
description: This command, if enabled (1), will make your crosshair a "T" style crosshair, in which the top line of the crosshair isn't drawn (so there are only 3 crosshair lines, not 4). Default is 0 (disabled / normal crosshair).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable T crosshair (default). Set to 1 to enable.

name: cl_drawhud_force_deathnotices
description: This command sets circumstances under which deathnotices should be drawn (deathnotices is another word for kill feed that appears in the top right). See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - Default, draw deathnotices only when HUD is enabled
1 - display killfeed/deathnotices even when HUD is disabled
-1 - never show deathnotices

name: cl_drawhud_force_radar
description: This command sets the circumstances under which the radar is is displayed. See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - Default, draw radar only when HUD is enabled
1 - render the radar even when the HUD is disabled
-1 - never show radar

name: cl_drawhud_force_teamid_overhead
description: This command sets the circumstances under which the "team ID" is drawn over your teammates heads (this is their name, weapons they're holding, etc). See argument information for help.

arguments.description:
Options are:
0 - Default, draw team ID only when HUD is enabled
1 - show team ID even when the HUD is disabled
-1 - never show team ID

name: cl_mute_all_but_friends_and_party
description: This command, if enabled (1), will mute communication from all players that aren't your friend on Steam, or in your party. Default is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not mute anyone. Set to 1 to mute everyone who isn't your friend or a member of your party.

name: cl_mute_enemy_team
description: This command, if enabled (1), will mute communication from all enemy players. Default is disabled (0).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not mute enemy team. Set to 1 to mute enemy team.

name: cl_playerspray_auto_apply
description: This command sets whether or not graffiti is automatically applied when you close the graffiti menu. Default is enabled (1).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not automatically apply graffiti when you close the graffiti menu. Set to 1 to apply graffiti when the graffiti menu closes.

name: cl_spec_swapplayersides
description: This command, if set to 1, will swap the player names and team names to the other side of the screen for spectators. Default is set to 0 (normal side).

name: cl_teamid_overhead_always
description: This command is similar to the +cl_show_team_equipment command. This can make the arrow that usually only appears above a teammate's head when you hover over them always show for all of your teammates (so you can see where they are through walls). You can also use this command to show names/equipment above teammate heads. See argument information for help.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not show team ID or equipment over head. Set 1 to only show team ID over head (the arrow that usually only appears when you hover over a teammate). Set to 2 to show team ID and equipment permanently above teammates heads.

name: cl_weapon_debug_show_accuracy
description: This command, if enabled, will draw a circle on your screen that represents the accuracy (or "effective range") of your next shot you fire.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not show accuracy circles (default). Set to 1 to show.

name: cl_weapon_debug_show_accuracy_duration
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that the circles drawn by cl_weapon_debug_show_accuracy show for. Default is 10 seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that accuracy circles should show for.

name: clear_bombs
description: This command clears/removes any bomb(s) that have been planted, halting the countdown.

name: demo_goto
description: This command skips to the specified tick in the demo. See argument information for options.

arguments.label: Tick
arguments.description: The tick you wish to go to (or the amount of ticks to skip ahead if relative).

arguments.label: Relative (0 / 1)
arguments.description: The tick you wish to go to (or the amount of ticks to skip ahead if relative).

arguments.label: Relative (0 / 1)
arguments.description: Optional. Specify a 1 here to make the the amount of ticks you specify be the amount of ticks you skip ahead in the demo, rather than the tick number to skip to.

arguments.label: Pause (0 / 1)
arguments.description: Optional. Specify a 1 here to make the the amount of ticks you specify be the amount of ticks you skip ahead in the demo, rather than the tick number to skip to.

arguments.label: Pause (0 / 1)
arguments.description: Optional. Specify a 1 here to pause the demo after skipping ahead.

name: demo_info
description: This command prints to console information about the demo that is currently playing.

name: healthshot_health
description: This command sets the amount of health that a healthshot heals.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of health that a healthshot should heal. Default is 50.

name: hostage_is_silent
description: This command, if set to 1, will make hostages silent. They won't make any noises and/or code driven response rules lines.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not make hostages silent (default). Set to 1 to make hostages silent.

name: mapoverview_icon_scale
description: This command sets the scale multiplier for icons on the overview map (that spectators can open usually by pressing CTRL). If set to 2, icons would be 2x the size they usually are on the overview map. Default is 1.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: Your desired multiplier for the size of icons on the overview map.

name: mp_coopmission_mission_number
description: This command is used to change the co-op mission you're playing, such as those found in Operations.

arguments.label: Mission Number
arguments.description: The number you enter here should correspond with the number of the mission you want to play. To play Mission 3, enter a 3.

name: mp_damage_vampiric_amount
description: This console command means that players gain health for doing damage to enemies. This scales with how much damage the player does to an enemy.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: A number that signifies how much health you want to gain for doing damage to your enemies. The higher this number, the more health is gained for the damage you deal.

name: mp_dm_bonus_respawn
description: This command is used in deathmatch. When there's a bonus weapon, this command determines whether, when accepting it, you are given it auotmatically or if you respawn with it.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to be given the weapon automatically, and a 0 after the command to be given the weapon by making you respawn with it (default).

name: mp_dm_bonus_respawn
description: This command is used in deathmatch. When there's a bonus weapon, this command determines whether, when accepting it, you are given it auotmatically or if you respawn with it.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to be given the weapon automatically, and a 0 after the command to be given the weapon by making you respawn with it (default).

name: mp_dm_bonusweapon_dogtags
description: This console command selects whether or not bonus dog tags are dropped when a player gets a kill with the bonus weapon in deathmatch.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to make dog tags drop on bonus weapon kills, and a 0 after the command to not have them drop.

name: mp_dm_dogtag_score
description: This command sets the points earned for picking up a dog tag in deathmatch (earned by getting a kill with a bonus weapon while _mp_dm_bonusweapon_dogtags is turned to 1).

arguments.label: Score
arguments.description: The score points you earn for picking up dog tags. This is set to 0 by default.

name: mp_dm_kill_base_score
description: This command sets the base score points you earn for killing a player in deathmatch. Cheaper, less powerful guns add 1 or 2 points onto the base score.

arguments.label: Base Score
arguments.description: The score points earned for getting a kill in deathmatch. You can't edit this command in live Valve deathmatch servers. The default value for this command is 10.

name: mp_dm_teammode
description: Use this console command to enable team deathmatch visuals and scoring.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: mp_dm_teammode_bonus_score
description: This command sets how many points you earn towards your team in team deathmatch for getting a kill with a bonus weapon.

arguments.label: Points
arguments.description: The bonus points you earn. Default value for this command is 1.

name: mp_dm_teammode_dogtag_score
description: This command sets how many points you earn towards your team for collecting dog tags in team deathmatch.

arguments.label: Points
arguments.description: The bonus points given for collecting dog tags. The default value for this command is 0.

name: mp_dm_teammode_kill_score
description: This command selects the number of points awarded to your team on each kill in team deathmatch.

arguments.label: Points
arguments.description: The points given for killing an enemy player. The default value for this command is 1.

name: mp_dogtag_despawn_on_killer_death
description: This command is used to determine whether or not dogtags should despawn (vanish) when the person that won them dies.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to make dogtags vanish when the person who won them dies (default), and enter a 0 to make them stay.

name: mp_dogtag_despawn_time
description: This command is used to set how many seconds dogtags can sit on the ground before despawning (vanishing) automatically.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The seconds dogtags can stay on the ground before despawning. Use a 0 after the command to make them never despawn. Default value for this command is 120 seconds (2 minutes).

name: mp_dogtag_pickup_rule
description: This command sets who is eligible to pick up dogtags on the floor in team deathmatch.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 to only let the killer (the person who earned the dogtags) pick them up. Enter a 1 to let anyone in the killer's team pick them up. Enter a 2 to let anyone in the victim's team pick them up. Enter a 3 to let the killer and victim's team pick them up. Enter a 4 to let anyone pick them up.

name: mp_economy_reset_rounds
description: This cheat command lets you reset every player's money every X amount of rounds.

arguments.label: X
arguments.description: Every X rounds, reset every player on the server's money. If you enter a 7, every 7th round everyone will have their money reset. Use a 0 to never reset people's money.

name: mp_endmatch_votenextmap_wargames_modes
description: This command shows you what modes you can vote for when a match ends during War Games.

name: mp_endmatch_votenextmap_wargames_nummaps
description: This command changes the maximum number of maps that can be shown in the end game vote when in War Games.

arguments.label: Maps
arguments.description: The amount of maps that can be shown in the vote. By default this command is set to 3.

name: mp_endmatch_votenextmap_wargames_nummodes
description: This command sets the maximum amount of other War Games modes to be included in the end of map vote.

arguments.label: Modes
arguments.description: The max number of modes that can be voted on. The default value for this command is 1.

name: mp_equipment_reset_rounds
description: This cheat command lets you reset every player's equipment every X amount of rounds.

arguments.label: X
arguments.description: Every X rounds, reset every player on the server's equipment. If you enter a 7, every 7th round everyone will have their equipment reset. Use a 0 to never reset people's equipment.

name: mp_ggtr_always_upgrade
description: This cheat command allows you to choose how many upgrade points are awarded at the end of every demolition mode round.

arguments.label: Points
arguments.description: The upgrade points a round rewards. The default value for this command is 0.

name: mp_global_damage_per_second
description: Entering a value after this command causes each player in the server to take that amount of damage per second. This is non-lethal, so they can't die from this.

arguments.label: DPS
arguments.description: The damage per second you want to do to players. The default value for this command is 0 (off).

name: mp_guardian_bot_money_per_wave
description: This console command controls how much money bots get each wave that a player completes.

arguments.label: Money
arguments.description: The money bots get when a player clears a wave. This is not additive, so they will have this command at the start of each new wave.

name: mp_guardian_player_dist_max
description: This console command sets how far a player can get from the bombsite before they are killed.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: Distance from a bombsite before a player is killed. The default value for this command is 2000.

name: mp_guardian_player_dist_min
description: This console command sets how far a player can get from the bombsite before they are warned that they are moving too far away from the bombsite.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: Distance from a bombsite before players are warned that they're going too far. The default value for this command is 1300.

name: mp_guardian_special_kills_needed
description: In an operation, this is the number of kills you need to get with a special weapon.

arguments.label: Kills
arguments.description: The kills needed with a special weapon. The default value for this command is 10.

name: mp_guardian_special_weapon_needed
description: This is the special weapon needed to finish a mission in an operation to achieve the special kill count.

arguments.label: Weapon
arguments.description: The weapon code of the special weapon you want to use. The default value for this command is awp for the AWP.

name: mp_halftime_pausematch
description: This command, when approved by the server admin, pauses the game when halftime has been reached (just as the 15th round is won total, combining the team's scores).

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to attempt to pause the game during halftime, and a 0 after the command to not do so (default).

name: mp_heavyassaultsuit_aimpunch
description: This console command determines how much extra aim punch a player receives when getting shot wearing an assault suit.

arguments.label: Aimpunch
arguments.description: A number used to signify the extra aimpunch the player wearing the assault suit receives when getting shot. The default value for this is 1.

name: mp_heavyassaultsuit_cooldown
description: Sets the cooldown time on purchasing an assault suit in select game modes.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The cooldown time in minutes before a player is allowed to purchase the assault suit again. The default value for this command is 5.

name: mp_heavyassaultsuit_deploy_timescale
description: This command sets how quick a player wearing the heavy assault suit (available in Heavy Assault Suit mode) can draw their weapon.

arguments.description: Enter a 0.5 after this command to set the draw speed to half speed, and a 1 after the command to set draw speed to normal. The default value for the command is 0.8.

name: mp_heavyassaultsuit_speed
description: This command determines the max movement speed of a player when they are in the heavy assault suit.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The maximum movement speed of a player when they are in the heavy assault suit. The default value for this command is 130.

name: mp_heavybot_damage_reduction_scale
description: This command can be used to make players in heavy assault suits take less damage than usual from bullets.

arguments.description: Enter a 0.5 after the command to half the damage players take from bullets when in a heavy assault suit. Enter a 1 after the command to not change how much bullet damage they receive. Default value for this command is 1.

name: mp_items_prohibited
description: This command allows you to prohibit items or guns from being used in your server.

arguments.label: Items
arguments.description: A list of comma-separated items you wish to ban from your server. By default there are no banned items.

name: mp_logdetail_items
description: Turning this command on produces a log any time that a player acquires a new weapon.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on and start producing log entries, and a 0 after the command to turn it off (default).

name: mp_logmoney
description: This command is ued to turn money logging on or off.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to enable money logging so you can track what you spend and earn, and a 0 after the command to turn it off (default).

name: mp_max_armor
description: This command sets what level of armor can be purchased in your server - no armor, kevlar body, or kevlar body and helmet.

arguments.description: Enter a 0 after the command to not allow players to buy any armor. Enter a 1 to allow players to buy just a kevlar body. Enter a 2 to allow players to purchase a kevlar body and helmet.

name: mp_randomspawn_dist
description: If you are using the mp_randomspawn command, this command is used to determine whether or not you test distance with that setting.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn on distance testing, and a 0 after the command to turn it off.

name: mp_starting_losses
description: This command is used to set what the initial loss streak is. It means you can collect the max loss bonus quicker.

arguments.label: Loss Streak
arguments.description: What loss streak you choose to start the game on. Using a value like 5 will give you the max loss bonus from the start. Default value for this command is 0.

name: mp_taser_recharge_time
description: This console command sets the recharge time when using the taser/zeus.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The research time you want to set. Set this to -1 to disable being able to fire the same taser multiple times (default).

name: mp_team_timeout_max
description: This command is used to set the number of timeouts each team gets a match.

arguments.label: Timeouts
arguments.description: The max number of timeouts. The default value for this command is 1.

name: mp_team_timeout_time
description: This is the console command used to set how long each timeout a team calls lasts.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The amount of time a timeout lasts in seconds. The default value for this command is 60 seconds (1 minute).

name: mp_teamscore_max
description: This command is used to set how many maps are needed to be won by a team to win the series.

arguments.label: Maps
arguments.description: To create a best-of-three (bo3), set this value to 2. To create a best-of-five (bo5), set this value to 3. The default value for this command is 0.

name: mp_weapon_self_inflict_amount
description: This interesting console command is used to set how much damage an attacker takes for missing a shot.

arguments.label: Damage
arguments.description: The ratio of damage you want to take if you miss a bullet. This is non-lethal, so can drop you to 1hp but won't kill you. The default value for this command is 0 (off).

name: mp_weapons_allow_heavy
description: This command dictates which team, if any, can purchase heavy guns such as shotguns and heavy machine guns.

arguments.description: There is no argument of 1 in this command. Enter -1 after the command to allow any team to purchase heavy guns. Enter a 0 to not allow either team to purchase heavy guns. Enter a 2 to allow T's to buy them, and enter a 3 to allow CT's to buy them. The default value for this command is -1.

name: mp_weapons_allow_heavyassaultsuit
description: This command sets whether or not the heavy assault suit is allowed in a server.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to allow the suit, and a 0 to disable it.

name: mp_weapons_allow_pistols
description: This console command is used to set which teams can buy pistols in a server.

arguments.description: There is no argument of 1 in this command. Enter -1 after the command to allow any team to purchase pistols. Enter a 0 to not allow either team to purchase pistols. Enter a 2 to allow T's to buy them, and enter a 3 to allow CT's to buy them. The default value for this command is -1.

name: mp_weapons_allow_rifles
description: This console command is used to set which teams can buy rifles in a server.

arguments.description: There is no argument of 1 in this command. Enter -1 after the command to allow any team to purchase rifles. Enter a 0 to not allow either team to purchase rifles. Enter a 2 to allow T's to buy them, and enter a 3 to allow CT's to buy them. The default value for this command is -1.

name: mp_weapons_allow_smgs
description: This console command is used to set which teams can buy SMGs in a server.

arguments.description: There is no argument of 1 in this command. Enter -1 after the command to allow any team to purchase SMGs. Enter a 0 to not allow either team to purchase SMGs. Enter a 2 to allow T's to buy them, and enter a 3 to allow CT's to buy them. The default value for this command is -1.

name: mp_weapons_allow_typecount
description: This console command determines the rules behind players purchasing the max amount of weapons each round.

arguments.label: Max Weapons
arguments.description: The max number of one type of weapon a player can buy in a round. The default value for this command is 5. Enter a 0 to disable purchasing all together, and a -1 to have no purchase limit.

name: mp_weapons_max_gun_purchases_per_weapon_per_match
description: This console command sets the maximum number of times a player can purchase a weapon per match.

arguments.label: Max Purchases
arguments.description: The maximum number of times you can buy a certain weapon in a single game. The default value for this command is -1, which means there isn't a limit by default. The maximum value for this command is 1, meaning it can't be set higher than 1 purchase per game.

name: r_drawmodelnames
description: This command, if set to 1, will draw the names of the models of entities in the game (e.g. guns on the floor, etc).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not draw model names (default). Set to 1 to draw model names.

name: reload_store_config
description: This command will reload the store (buy menu) configuration, applying any changes you've made to the config files.

name: sound_device_list
description: This command lists all audio devices you have available.

name: sound_device_override
description: This command sets the audio device the game will use to the audio device with the specified ID (find audio device IDs with sound_device_list).

arguments.label: Device ID
arguments.description: The ID of the audio device you wish to use as your audio device for CS:GO. Find ID with sound_device_list.

name: +spray_menu
description: This command opens up the graffiti spray menu. Hide with -spray_menu.

name: -spray_menu
description: This command hides the graffiti spray menu.

name: sv_autobuyammo
description: This command, if set to 1, will make you automatically refill your ammunition when you enter a buyzone during buy time.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable (default). Set to 1 to automatically restock on ammo when you enter a buy zone during buy time.

name: sv_bot_buy_decoy_weight
description: This command sets the "weight" (or chance) of a bot buying a decoy grenade. Think of this as the amount of "raffle tickets" for a virtual raffle between this weight and the weights of all other grenades when a bot is deciding which grenade to buy.

arguments.label: Weight
arguments.description: The weight (or chance) of a bot buying a decoy grenade. Higher number = more likely.

name: sv_bot_buy_flash_weight
description: This command sets the "weight" (or chance) of a bot buying a flashbang grenade. Think of this as the amount of "raffle tickets" for a virtual raffle between this weight and the weights of all other grenades when a bot is deciding which grenade to buy.

arguments.label: Weight
arguments.description: The weight (or chance) of a bot buying a flashbang grenade. Higher number = more likely.

name: sv_bot_buy_grenade_chance
description: This command sets the chance (percentage) a bot has of buying a grenade when they have leftover money after purchasing armor and weapons. Default is 33, which would be equivalent to 33%.

arguments.description: The chance a bot has of buying a grenade with leftover money, 50 would be 50%.

name: sv_bot_buy_hegrenade_weight
description: This command sets the "weight" (or chance) of a bot buying a high explosive grenade. Think of this as the amount of "raffle tickets" for a virtual raffle between this weight and the weights of all other grenades when a bot is deciding which grenade to buy.

arguments.label: Weight
arguments.description: The weight (or chance) of a bot buying a high explosive grenade. Higher number = more likely.

name: sv_bot_buy_molotov_weight
description: This command sets the "weight" (or chance) of a bot buying a molotov grenade. Think of this as the amount of "raffle tickets" for a virtual raffle between this weight and the weights of all other grenades when a bot is deciding which grenade to buy.

arguments.label: Weight
arguments.description: The weight (or chance) of a bot buying a molotov grenade. Higher number = more likely.

name: sv_bot_buy_smoke_weight
description: This command sets the "weight" (or chance) of a bot buying a smoke grenade. Think of this as the amount of "raffle tickets" for a virtual raffle between this weight and the weights of all other grenades when a bot is deciding which grenade to buy.

arguments.label: Weight
arguments.description: The weight (or chance) of a bot buying a smoke grenade. Higher number = more likely.

name: @panorama_debug_overlay_opacity
description: This command adjusts the transparency of the menu in the Panorama UI.

arguments.label: Transparency
arguments.description: How transparent/opaque you want the menu background to be. The default value for this is 0.8. Set the value to 1 to remove all transparency.

name: @panorama_force_sort_child_ops
description: This is a cheat command for the panorama UI.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn the cheat on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: ai_show_connect
description: This console command brings up text in the bottom left of your screen displaying the allowed connections between hubs for the selected hull type.

name: ai_show_hull
description: This cheat command shows the allowed hulls between each node. You will see the display in the bottom left of your screen.

name: cash_team_winner_bonus_consecutive_rounds
description: This console command sets the bonus cash earned by the winning team for winning multiple rounds in a row, similarly to how losing multiple rounds in a row gives you increasingly more cash for each loss. By default this command is set to off.

arguments.label: Bonus Money
arguments.description: The amount of money you want to add for the winning team each time they win another consecutive round. This amount stacks, so if set to $500 the winning team will earn $500 more than they did last round for a victory up until a cap.

name: cl_crosshair_recoil
description: This cheat command sets whether or not taking damage/aimpunch causes your crosshair to shake and move around to display the effect.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn on crosshair recoil when getting hit, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: cl_drawhud_specvote
description: This command dictates whether or not spectators of a game can see the Call Vote UI whenever a vote is called, such as whether a player should be kicked.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to enable spectators to see the Vote menu (default), and a 0 after the command to disable it for spectators.

name: debug_drawbox
description: This console command produces a debug box in your client.

name: debug_drawdisp_boundbox
description: This console command produces a debug box to check invalid displacements in your client.

name: dump_panorama_css_properties
description: This command produces a detailed list of all properties from the Panorama UI that use CSS (a coding language).

name: dump_panorama_css_properties_memstats
description: This command produces a list of all the Panorama properties in your client's memory stats into your developer console.

name: dump_panorama_events
description: This command is used to show all of the event types used in the Panorama, and how they are triggered. Something for those of you who understand code!

name: dump_panorama_js_scopes
description: This console command prints a list into your developer console of all JavaScript scopes used in the Panorama UI, and explains what they are used for.

name: ime_hkl_info
description: This command produces an extensive technical lists of IME HKL info.

name: ime_info
description: This command prints out a list in your developer console of IME information.

name: ime_supported_info
description: This technical console command produces a list of IME Supported information statistics in your developer console.

name: launch_warmup_map
description: This console command will place you in a 10 minute deathmatch game, filled entirely with bots. It is just like playing the deathmatch game mode, but is offline.

name: mat_draw_resolution
description: Toggling this command on shows all off the textures in the game. It essentially makes your screen look like you're in the Matrix.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: mp_disconnect_kills_bots
description: Turning this console command on causes bots to die if they disconnect. mp_disconnect_kills_players must be enabled (enter a 1 after the command) for this command to work.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: mp_disconnect_kills_players
description: Turning this command on causes players to die in game if they disconnect. This means rather than just vanishing, they'll drop items they have equipped and a death will be added to the scoreboard for them.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: mp_footsteps_serverside
description: This command decides whether or not the server always plays footstep sounds. This is used to produce footsteps in your client.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on (default), and a 0 to turn it off.

name: mp_suicide_time
description: This console command is used to set how long, in seconds, you have to wait before you can perform another suicide in game.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The number of seconds you must wait before committing suicide in game again. The default value for this command is 5.

name: net_graphipc
description: Enabling this command shows IPCs on your net graph, when that is brought up with the net_graph 1 command.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to show IPCs in the net graph, and a 0 to hide them (default).

name: player_competitive_maplist_2v2_7_0_3F9CD3AE
description: Lists the competitve map playlist you have active.

arguments.label: Maps
arguments.description: The map codes of all the maps you want to have in your active competitive playlist.

name: player_wargames_list2_7_0_604
description: This command is used to set what game modes you want in youe War Games playlist.

arguments.label: Maps
arguments.description: The game codes of the maps that you want included in War Games. When entering this command you will a list of the ones active. Simply enter the command again with all the game modes except the ones you want to remove them.

name: r_disable_static_prop_loading
description: When turned on, this command causes static props on a map not to load when you load into its map.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to stop props from loading when coming into a map, and a 0 after the command to turn it off (default).

name: snd_mainmenu_music_break_time_max
description: This command sets the max amount of time to pause from opening up the CS:GO menu to the music starting.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The max number of seconds until the main menu music kicks in when you reach the screen. The default value for this command is 0.

name: snd_mainmenu_music_break_time_min
description: This command sets the minimum amount of time to pause from opening up the CS:GO menu to the music starting.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The minimum number of seconds until the main menu music kicks in when you reach the screen. The default value for this command is 0.

name: spec_cameraman_set_xray
description: This console command toggles between spectators seeing X-ray vision, them not seeing it, or them seeing what the person they're spectating sees.

name: sv_load_random_client_names_file
description: This command loads the specified file that contains random words.

arguments.label: File Name
arguments.description: The file name of the file you'd like to open.

name: sv_maxunlag
description: This console command sets the maximum lag compensation in seconds.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: Your desired max lag compensation in seconds. The default value for this command is 0.2. You can enter a value between 0-1.

name: sv_talk_after_dying_time
description: This command sets how many seconds after dying players can still talk for. By default this is set to 0, which disables the feature.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The number of seconds players who have just died can speak for. Set it to 0 to disable the command (default).

name: sv_vote_issue_loadbackup_spec_authoritative
description: When this command is turned on, admins are able to load matches without needing to wait for players to give their ready signal through a vote.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: sv_vote_issue_loadbackup_spec_safe
description: Turning this command on allows server admins to load a match in backup, but only when the round is in safe time.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on (default), and a 0 to turn it off.

name: test_convar
description: Turning this command on will skip the interruption when saving a favorite in the buy menu.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn it on, and a 0 after the command to turn it off (default).

name: tv_broadcast_url1
description: This console command pastes the URL of your servers broadcast relay 1 into your developer console.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_listen_casual
description: This command is used to adjust what your default map is for casual mode. By default it chooses a random map.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you want to use in Casual.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_listen_competitive
description: This command is used to adjust what your default map is for competitive mode. By default it chooses a random map.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you want to use in Competitive.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_listen_deathmatch
description: This command is used to adjust what your default map is for Deathmatch mode. By default it chooses a random map.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you want to use in Deathmatch.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_listen_scrimcomp2v2
description: This command is used to adjust what your default map is for 2v2 scrim mode. By default it chooses Inferno.

arguments.label: Map Code
arguments.description: The map code of the map you want to use in 2v2 scrims.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_listen_skirmish
description: This command is used to adjust what your default game mode is for skirmishes. By default it chooses flying scoutsman.

arguments.label: Game Mode
arguments.description: The Game Mode of the map you want to use in skrimishes.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_official_casual
description: Sets your default map group to use in Casual from the official map pool.

arguments.label: Map Group
arguments.description: The Map Group you want to use when playing Casual.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_official_deathmatch
description: Sets your default map group to use in Deathmatch from the official map pool.

arguments.label: Map Group
arguments.description: The Map Group you want to use when playing Deathmatch.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_official_survival
description: Sets your default map to use in Survival game modes.

arguments.label: Map
arguments.description: The map used in survival game modes.

name: ui_playsettings_mode_listen
description: This command is used to select between game modes for your player settings.

arguments.label: Game Mode
arguments.description: The default game mode for this command is casual. Set it to competitive to change it to 5v5 matchmaking.

name: ui_playsettings_mode_official
description: Sets the game mode used in official games.

arguments.label: Game Mode
arguments.description: The default game mode for this command is casual. Set it to competitive to change it to 5v5 matchmaking.

name: ui_playsettings_warmup_map_name
description: Use this command to set your default map for warming up (this is translated into loading you into a Deathmatch server with bots).

arguments.label: Map
arguments.description: The map code of the map you want to use.

name: ui_vanitysetting_model
description: This console command chooses the file path for the player models. It can be changed to another specified file in CS:GO.

arguments.label: File
arguments.description: The file path of the model you would like to use.

name: ui_vanitysetting_team
description: Sets which team is assigned to the vanity setting command.

arguments.label: T / CT
arguments.description: Enter a T after the command to set it to work on the Terrorists, and a CT to assign it for the Counter-Terrorists.

name: viewmodel_recoil
description: This command sets how much recoil is shown by the viewmodel when being shot at and taking aimpunch.

arguments.label: Recoil
arguments.description: A value between 0-1 to set your viewmodel recoil to when being shot at. The default value for this command is 1. Use a lower number to reduce the recoil.

name: voice_positional
description: This command, if set to 1, will make the volume of voices (player microphones) correspond to their distance from eachother. Players close to eachother would be louder than those at greater distances. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable positional voices (normal voice chat). Set to 1 to make the volume of voices change based on the distances between players.

name: voice_positional_seconds_after_death
description: This command sets the amount of seconds that players will have positional voices for after death - i.e. a player can speak from their dead body for this amount of seconds after being killed/dying.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that players can speak for after death (when voice_positional is enabled).

name: ammo_grenade_limit_breachcharge
description: This command sets the amount of breach charges that a player can hold at any given time. Default is 3.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of breachcharges that a player can hold at any given time.

name: cl_compass_enabled
description: This command sets whether or not the compass, in the Danger Zone gamemode, appears at the top of the screen (for your client only).
