arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable the compass at the top of screen. Set to 1 to enable (default).

name: cl_dangerzone_approaching_sound_radius
description: This command sets the radius for the "Approaching Sound" in the Danger Zone gamemode.

arguments.label: Radius
arguments.description: The radius the "Approaching" sound effect should be played within.

name: cl_dangerzone_moving_sound_volume
description: This command sets the volume of the "Moving Sound" in the Danger Zone gamemode.

arguments.label: Volume
arguments.description: The volume of the Danger Zone moving sound effect.

name: cl_dangerzone_sound_volume
description: This command sets the volume of sound effects from the Danger Zone gamemode.

arguments.label: Volume
arguments.description: The volume of Danger Zone sound effects.

name: cl_dz_playagain_auto_spectate
description: This command, if enabled (set to 1), will make you automatically switch to spectator mode after pressing play again in Danger Zone. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not automatically spectate after pressing play again in Danger Zone (default). Set to 1 to automatically switch to spectate when searching for another Danger Zone game.

name: cl_lock_camera
description: This command, if set to 1 (and cheats are enabled), will lock your camera in position. When you look around, your viewmodel will still move, but your camera will stay fixed. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to unlock camera (default). Set to 1 to lock your camera in its current position.

name: cl_lock_camera
description: This command, if set to 1 (and cheats are enabled), will lock your camera in position. When you look around, your viewmodel will still move, but your camera will stay fixed. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to unlock camera (default). Set to 1 to lock your camera in its current position.

name: cl_player_proximity_debug
description: This command, if set to 1, can be used to debug player proximity. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not debug player proximity. Set to 1 to enable player proximity debug information.

name: cl_rappel_tilt
description: This command sets the amount of tilt that your character will have when rappelling from a helicopter (after spawning) in deadzone. Some players refer to rappelling as skydiving or parachuting from the helicopter.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of tilt that your camera should have when rappelling out of the helicopter in Danger Zone.

name: cl_sun_in_reflection_h_scale
description: This command sets the horizontal scale of the sun in reflections (in water, etc). Default is 2.

arguments.label: Scale
arguments.description: The horizontal scale of sun in reflections.

name: cl_sun_in_reflection_v_scale
description: This command sets the vertical scale of the sun in reflections (in water, etc). Default is 2.

arguments.label: Scale
arguments.description: The vertical scale of sun in reflections.

name: cl_tablet_mapmode
description: This command sets your tablet's map mode (how the tablet displays) in Danger Zone. Map mode 1 will rotate based on where your character is facing, map mode 2 will not rotate and will always face north.

arguments.description: Currently known map modes are 1 (rotate based on your character's camera position, default) and 2 (always face north, no rotation). There may be others.

name: contributionscore_assist
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for getting an assist.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add for an assist.

name: contributionscore_bomb_defuse_major
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives when they defuse the bomb with at least one enemy still alive.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_bomb_defuse_minor
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for defusing the bomb with no enemies still alive.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_bomb_exploded
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) the players on the terrorist team receive if still alive at the end of the round when the bomb explodes. The player who planted the bomb will always receive this contribution score, regardless of whether they are alive or not.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_bomb_planted
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for planting the bomb.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_cash_bundle
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for picking up a cash bundle (Danger Zone).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_crate_break
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for breaking an item crate (Danger Zone).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_hostage_kill
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for killing a hostage. As this is a negative action, usually this is set to a negative amount, which subtracts contribution score.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_hostage_rescue_major
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives for rescuing a hostage.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_hostage_rescue_minor
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) alive counter-terrorist players receive when a hostage is rescued.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_kill
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives when they kill a non-friendly player.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_kill_factor
description: By default this command is disabled (0). This command sets the percentage of a player's contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives when they kill them. If this was set to 10, you would receive 10% of a player's contribution score when you kill them (e.g. 10 if the player you killed had 100 contribution score).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_objective_kill
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_suicide
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives when they kill themselves (e.g. from their own grenade).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: contributionscore_team_kill
description: This command sets the amount of contribution score ("score" in leaderboard/TAB) a player receives when they kill a friendly player.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of contribution score to add.

name: dz_clearteams
description: This command clears (deletes) all existing Danger Zone teams.

name: dz_jointeam
description: This command can make you, or another player, join a specified Danger Zone team. See argument information for help.

arguments.label: Team #
arguments.description: The number of the team you wish to join. Specify 0 to leave your current team. If you are an admin of the server, you can make another player join this team by specifying their name or Steam ID after this number.

arguments.label: User ID / Name
arguments.description: The number of the team you wish to join. Specify 0 to leave your current team. If you are an admin of the server, you can make another player join this team by specifying their name or Steam ID after this number.

arguments.label: User ID / Name
arguments.description: Optional, if you do not specify a user ID or name here, you will join the team with the specified ID. The Steam ID, or name, of the player you wish to make a member of the specified team.

name: dz_shuffle_teams
description: This command will shuffle all teams in Danger Zone.

name: healthshot_allow_use_at_full
description: This command, if set to 1 (default) will allow players to use healthshots when already at maximum health. Set to 0 to disallow.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow players from using healthshots when already at full health. Set to 1 to allow players to use healthshots when already at full health.

name: healthshot_healthboost_damage_multiplier
description: This command sets the damage multiplier for damage dealt by a player after having consumed a healthshot. The damage they deal will be multiplied by this number. The amount of time this applies for is set by the healthshot_healthboost_time cvar. Default is 1 (disabled).

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The multiplier to apply to all damage dealth after consuming a healthshot. 1.5 would multiply damage by 1.5 (a 50% increase).

name: healthshot_healthboost_speed_multiplier
description: This command sets the speed multiplier for a player after having consumed a healthshot. Their movement speed will by multiplied by this number. The amount of time this applies for is set by the healthshot_healthboost_time cvar. Default is 1 (disabled).

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The multiplier to apply to a player's movement speed after they consume a health shot. 2.5 would multiply damage by 2.5 (increasing it by 150%).

name: healthshot_healthboost_time
description: This command sets the amount of time, in seconds, that a player receives healthboost for after consuming a healthshot. This is also the amount of time that the damage and speed multipliers will have an effect for.

arguments.label: Seconds
arguments.description: The amount of seconds that a health shot should apply a health (and damage/speed if enabled) boost for.

name: mp_damage_scale_ct_body
description: This command sets the multiplier for damage dealt to the body of counter-terrorist players. Default is 1. Set to 0 to disable body shot damage.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount to multiply the damage dealt to counter-terrorists bodies by (i.e. multiply damage dealt by bullets that hit the body by this amount).

name: mp_damage_scale_ct_head
description: This command sets the multiplier for damage dealt to the head of counter-terrorist players. Default is 1. Set to 0 to disable headshot damage.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount to multiply the damage dealt to counter-terrorists heads by (i.e. multiply damage dealt by bullets that hit the head by this amount).

name: mp_damage_scale_t_body
description: This command sets the multiplier for damage dealt to the body of terrorist players. Default is 1. Set to 0 to disable body shot damage.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount to multiply the damage dealt to terrorists bodies by (i.e. multiply damage dealt by bullets that hit the body by this amount).

name: mp_damage_scale_t_head
description: This command sets the multiplier for damage dealt to the head of terrorist players. Default is 1. Set to 0 to disable headshot damage.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount to multiply the damage dealt to terrorists heads by (i.e. multiply damage dealt by bullets that hit the head by this amount).

name: mp_death_drop_breachcharge
description: This command, if set to 1, will make it so that breachcharges are dropped on death. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make players not drop breach charges on death. Set to 1 to make breach charges be dropped on death (default).

name: mp_death_drop_healthshot
description: This command, if set to 1, will make it so that healthshots are dropped on death. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make players not drop healthshots on death. Set to 1 to make healthshots be dropped on death (default).

name: mp_drop_grenade_enable
description: This command, if set to 1, will make it so that players can drop grenades that they are carrying. Default is 0 in all gamemodes with the exception of Danger Zone.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow players from dropping their grenades. Set to 1 to allow players to drop grenades from their inventory.

name: mp_endwarmup_player_count
description: This command sets the amount of players that need to connect to the game for warmup to be ended early. Set to 0 to wait until all players are connected (default).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of players required to join the server for warmup to end and the game to start (instantly). Set to 0 to wait until all players connect.

name: mp_only_cts_rescue_hostages
description: This command, if set to 1 (default on all game modes with the exception of Danger Zone), will make it so that only counter-terrorist players can rescue hostages. Set to 0 to allow all players to rescue hostages.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to allow all players to rescue hostages. Set to 1 to make it so that only counter-terrorists can rescue hostages (default).

name: mp_plant_c4_anywhere
description: This command, if set to 1, allows players to plant C4s at any location. If set to 0, the C4 can only be planted at bomb sites.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to only allow the C4 to be planted at bombsites (default). Set to 1 to allow the C4 to be planted at any location.

name: mp_require_gun_use_to_acquire
description: This command, if set to 1, will make it so that guns must be +used on (usually the E key) in order to be picked up by players. Default is 0 (guns are picked up when they are walked over).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make it so that guns are picked up when walked over (default). Set to 1 to require players to press E (or +use) on weapons in order to pick them up.

name: mp_tagging_scale
description: This console command is used to adjust the level of tagging players take when hit.

arguments.label: Tagging Value
arguments.description: A number used to represent the amount of tagging you want players to take. The default value for this command is 1. Use a lower number to increase tagging, and use a higher number to reduce tagging.

name: parachute
description: In game modes where applicable, such as Danger Zone (the Battle Royale mode) this command equips your parachute.

name: pick_hint
description: Entering this command into your console will print out one of the hints that are shown in various CS:GO loading screens, such as advising players to stab enemies in the back if they find themselves behind them.

name: r_drawopaquedetailprops_reflect
description: When this command is turned on it causes props to reflect light.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: r_drawopaquedetailprops_refract
description: When this command is turned on it causes props to refract light.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: r_underwateroverlay_drain_speed
description: This command alters the drain speed shown on the underwater overlay.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The drain speed used in the overlay. The default value for this command is 0.4.

name: radio
description: This console command opens up the radio menu with a list of radio calls to the left of your screen. Use a radio call or enter the command again to dismiss the screen.

name: skybox_disablereflection
description: This command is used to toggle between having reflections enabled or disabled in your skybox. Turning off reflections can fix issues for some players where textures don't show properly on the map.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to turn on reflections (1), and a 0 to turn them off.

name: snd_dzmusic_volume
description: This console command adjusts the volume of the music played when you win a game of Danger Zone (the Battle Royale mode).

arguments.label: Volume
arguments.description: The volume you want Danger Zone victory music to play at. The default value for this command is 0.2. Use a larger number to increase the volume, and a smaller number to decrease volume.

name: spec_replay_on_death
description: This command is used to adjust how you spectate your death. Enter a value above 1 after the command to begin seeing delayed replays.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after the command to enable delayed replays and also to segregate your voice and text chat, and a 0 to turn the command off (default).

name: survival_check_num_possible_final_zone
description: Enter this command into your developer console to print a number that shows all possible final zones in Danger Zone, the Battle Royale game mode.

name: sv_air_max_horizontal_parachute_ratio
description: Toggle this command to change the horizontal ratio used when parachuting down to the ground in Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Ratio
arguments.description: The horizontal ratio you desire. The default value for this command is 0.87.

name: sv_air_max_horizontal_parachute_speed
description: This console command adjusts how quickly you can move horizontally while parachuting down to the ground in Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The speed you'd like to set. The default value for this command is 240. Use a larger number to increase speed, and a small number to decrease speed.

name: sv_airaccelerate_rappel
description: This console command sets how fast you move while rappeling down to the ground in Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: The rappel speed you'd like to set. The default value for this command is 2.2.

name: sv_allchat
description: This command sets whether or not you can receive text chat from players in the "all chat" channel.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on (default), and a 0 to turn it off.

name: sv_coach_comm_unrestricted
description: When this command is turned on, it overrides any restrictions on how coaches can communicate through the in-game comms.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: sv_cs_player_speed_has_hostage
description: This cheat command sets the movement speed of players when they're carrying hostages, such as in hostage mode or in Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: Player's movement speed. The default value for this command is 200. Increase the value to increase movement speed, and decrease the value to lower movement speed.

name: sv_disable_radar
description: Turning this console command on disables your radar.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to disable your radar and hide it, and a 0 after the command to leave your radar active (default).

name: sv_drowning_damage_initial
description: This console command sets the initial damage per second you take as you drown. sv_drowning_damage_max is used to set the max damage this can scale to as you stay in water longer.

arguments.label: DPS
arguments.description: The damage per second drowning does to you. The default value for this command is 2. Set it higher to take more damage from drowning, and lower to take less damage.

name: sv_drowning_damage_max
description: This console command sets the max amount of damage your player takes a second when drowning once the damage has scaled to it's highest level. This happens the longer you remain underwater.

arguments.label: DPS
arguments.description: The damage per second you take when drowning after you've been under the water for a while. The default value for this command is 5. Set it higher to take more damage from drowning, and lower to take less damage.

name: sv_dz_autojointeam
description: This command, if set to 1 (default), will make it so that players are automatically assigned a team in Danger Zone. Set to 0 to disable (players must choose a team with dz_jointeam).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable auto team assignment. Set to 1 to enable.

name: sv_dz_cash_bundle_size
description: This command sets the amount of money a cash bundle adds to a player's balance when picked up. Default is $50.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of money each cash bundle should add to a player's balance when picked up (e.g. 50).

name: sv_dz_contractkill_reward
description: This command sets the amount of cash bundles (not the amount of cash) to give a player when they kill a target assigned to them (contract target mission).

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of cash bundles a player should be award for completing a contract kill mission.

name: sv_dz_exploration_payment_amount
description: This command sets the amount of cash bundles to give a player for exploring into a sector of the map.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of cash bundles a player should be award for exploring a new sector.

name: sv_dz_hostage_rescue_reward
description: This command sets the amount of cash bundles (not the amount of cash) to award a player when they sucessfully complete a hostage mission in Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of cash bundles a player should be award for completing a hostage rescue mission.

name: sv_dz_jointeam_allowed
description: This command, if set to 1, allows players to leave and join other teams with the dz_jointeam command. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disallow players from using the dz_jointeam command (default). Set to 1 to allow players to use the command.

name: sv_dz_player_max_health
description: This command sets the amount of health players have in Danger Zone. Default is 120.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of health each player can have in danger zone.

name: sv_dz_player_spawn_armor
description: This command, if set to 1, will make players spawn with armor in Danger Zone. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make players not spawn with armor in Danger Zone (default). Set to 1 to make players spawn with armor.

name: sv_dz_player_spawn_armor
description: This command, if set to 1, will make players spawn with armor in Danger Zone. Default is 0 (disabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to make players not spawn with armor in Danger Zone (default). Set to 1 to make players spawn with armor.

name: sv_dz_player_spawn_health
description: This command sets the amount of health that players spawn with in Danger Zone. Default is 120, which is also the default maximum amount of health players can have.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of health that players should spawn with.

name: sv_dz_reset_danger_zone
description: This command will restart the current Danger Zone game.

name: sv_dz_show_enemy_name_scope_range
description: This command sets the range a player must be within in order for the name tag to be shown when another player's crosshair hovers over them in the Danger Zone gamemode.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The distance an enemy must be within in order for their name to show up when a player hovers over their character in Danger Zone.

name: sv_dz_team_count
description: This command sets the maximum amount of players that can be in each team in Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The maximum amount of players that can be in each team (e.g. 2).

name: sv_dz_warmup_tablet
description: This command, if set to 1 (default), will give players a tablet during the warmup period in Danger Zone. Set to 0 to disable.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not give players a tablet during warmup. Set to 1 to give players a tablet during warmup (default).

name: sv_dz_warmup_weapon
description: This command will give players the weapon with the specified weapon code during the Danger Zone warmup period (e.g. "weapon_glock"). See this page for weapon codes. Set to 0 to disable weapons during warmup.

arguments.label: Weapon Code
arguments.description: The weapon code of the weapon players should be given during warmup.

name: sv_dz_zone_bombdrop_money_reward
description: This command sets how many cash bundles players receive at the end of each Danger Zone wave. Default is 15.

arguments.label: Amount
arguments.description: The amount of cash bundles players should receive.

name: sv_dz_zone_damage
description: This command sets the amount of damage per second that the "zone" (border) in Danger Zone deals. Default is 1.

arguments.label: Damage
arguments.description: The amount of damage per second the zone should deal.

name: sv_dz_zone_hex_radius
description: This command sets the radius of each hex on the map (tablet) in Danger Zone. Default is 2200.

arguments.label: Radius
arguments.description: The radius of each hex on the tablet (e.g. 2200).

name: sv_env_entity_makers_enabled
description: This command sets whether or not entity markers are enabled.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to enable markers (default), and a 0 to disable them.

name: sv_extract_ammo_from_dropped_weapons
description: Where applicable, this command will cause you to take the ammo from weapons as you drop them.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: sv_falldamage_to_below_player_multiplier
description: This console command scales and distributes the fall damage taken to two players if the first player landed on another player's head.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on (default), and a 0 to turn it off.

name: sv_falldamage_to_below_player_ratio
description: This command sets the ratio of damage taken by a player if someone lands on their head. It scales as the person dropping on them falls from greater distances.

arguments.label: Ratio
arguments.description: The ratio you want to set the damage to. By default this is set to 0.

name: sv_grassburn
description: This console command sets whether or not grass burn is enabled in the server.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn grass burn on, and a 0 after the command to turn it off (default).

name: sv_hegrenade_damage_multiplier
description: This command is used to set the damage of HE grenades. By default it is set to 1, which keeps it at the default level of damage.

arguments.label: Damage
arguments.description: The number you want to increase/decrease damage by. A number like 2 would double damage, for example.

name: sv_hegrenade_radius_multiplier
description: This command sets the radius in which enemies take damage by HE grenades.

arguments.label: Radius
arguments.description: The radius that players take damage from the point where a HE grenade blows up. Entering a 2 would double the radius, as 1 is the default value for this command.

name: sv_player_parachute_velocity
description: This command sets the speed at which you parachute on, applicable in game modes like Danger Zone.

arguments.label: Speed
arguments.description: Sets parachute speed. The default value for this command is -200.

name: sv_show_ragdoll_playernames
description: When turned on, this command shows player names even when ragdolling.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: sv_show_team_equipment_force_on
description: This command, when enabled, forces team equipment to show above player's nameplates in every game, unless it is prohibited by another setting.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn on always seeing team equipment, and a 0 to turn the feature off (default).

name: sv_spawn_rappel_min_duration
description: This command sets the minimum duration it takes you in Danger Zone to completely rappel down to the ground.

arguments.label: Time
arguments.description: The time in seconds you want the minimum value of rappeling down to be. The default value for this command is 8.

name: sv_tablet_show_path_to_nearest_resq
description: When this console command is enabled, it shows a path on your Danger Zone tablet (summoned by pressing TAB by default) to the nearest hostage rescue point.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to turn it on, and a 0 to turn it off (default).

name: sv_teamid_overhead_maxdist
description: This console command is used to override the max distance teammate overhead displays will display until, showing them regardless of distance.

arguments.description: Enter a 1 after this command to always see your teammate's nameplates, and a 0 to hide it when max distance is reached.

name: sv_water_movespeed_multiplier
description: This command sets how quickly you move in water compared to your normal movement speed.

arguments.label: Speed Multiplier
arguments.description: What you want to multiply your default movement speed by to set your in-water movement speed. Use the number 0.5 to half your default movement speed when in water, or the number 2 to double it, for example. The default value for this command is 0.8.

name: sv_water_swim_mode
description: Adjusts the swim mode used when you're in water.

arguments.description: The default value for this command is 0.

name: sv_weapon_encumbrance_per_item
description: Sets how encumbered you become based on the more weapons you are carrying. The default value for this command is 0.85.

name: tablet_c4_dist_max
description: Sets how far away you can be from C4 in Danger Zone for your tablet (brought up by pressing TAB by default) to still display it on its quadrant map.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The max distance. The default value for this command is 3000. The higher you set it, the farther you can be from C4 for it to still show on the tablet.

name: tablet_c4_dist_min
description: Sets how close you need to be from C4 in Danger Zone for your tablet (brought up by pressing TAB by default) to still display it on its quadrant map.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The minimum distance. The default value for this command is 400. The higher you set it, the more you'll increase the minimum distance of seeing the C4 on your tablet.

name: ui_nearbylobbies_filter
description: This command changes how your nearby lobby filter works.

arguments.label: Filter
arguments.description: The default value for this command is Survival.

name: ui_playsettings_maps_official_dangerzone
description: Sets the default map used in Danger Zone, such as the original map the mode released with, Blacksite.

arguments.label: Map
arguments.description: The map name of the map you want to set as your default in the Danger Zone mode.

name: ui_playsettings_mode_official_dz
description: This command sets the default game setting to be used in Danger Zone mode, such as the mode it was released with, Survival.

arguments.label: Mode
arguments.description: The game mode you want to set as your default in Danger Zone.

name: weapon_sound_falloff_multiplier
description: This command sets the falloff of weapon sounds when shooting, which adjusts how they get quieter.

arguments.label: Multiplier
arguments.description: The amount you want to multiply the default value of weapon shot sounds by to compensate for falloff. By default this command is set to 1 which gives it no influence. Use a lower value than 1 to reduce weapon sounds with falloff, and a higher value than 1 to increase it.

name: bot_goto_mark
description: This command will make a bot walk to the marked navigation area.

name: bot_goto_selected
description: This command will make a bot go to the navigation area that you currently have selected.

name: bot_mimic_yaw_offset
description: This command will set the yaw offset that bots will mimic you on. Default value is 180.

name: budget_bargraph_background_alpha
description: This command alters the translucency of the budget panel's bar graphs. Its default is set at 128.

arguments.label: Translucency
arguments.description: The translucency value you want the budget panel's bar graphs to appear in.

name: budget_bargraph_range_ms
description: The budget bar graphs range, measured in milliseconds. Default value for this command is 16.7.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The number of milliseconds you want to adjust the range of the bar graphs to.

name: budget_history_numsamplesvisible
description: This command alters how many samples are drawn in the budget history panel. Set this to a low number to improve overhead rendering. Its default value is 100.

arguments.label: Samples
arguments.description: The number of samples you want used in the budget history window.

name: budget_history_range_ms
description: This cheat command adjusts the budget history range in milliseconds. Its default value is 66.7 milliseconds.

arguments.label: Milliseconds
arguments.description: The number of milliseconds you want to adjust the range of the history range window to.

name: budget_panel_bottom_of_history_fraction
description: The command adjusts the bottom panel of the budget history panel.

arguments.label: Value
arguments.description: Enter a number between 0 and 1 (such as 0.5) to adjust the budget panel.

name: budget_panel_height
description: This command adjusts the height of the budget panel. Enter a value in pixels to set it to your preference.

arguments.label: Height
arguments.description: Enter a height (in pixels) to change how tall the budget panel is. Default value is set at 384.

name: budget_panel_width
description: The command adjusts the width of the budget panel. Enter a value in pixels to set it to your desired size. Default value is set at 512.

arguments.label: Width
arguments.description: The width (in pixels) of the budget panel.

name: budget_panel_x
description: This command sets how far away (in pixels) the buget panel is from the left side of the game screen.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The distance in pixels from the left side of the CS:GO client.

name: budget_panel_y
description: This console command sets how far from the top of the game screen (in pixels) the budget panel is shown.

arguments.label: Distance
arguments.description: The distance in pixels from the top of the CS:GO client.

name: budget_peaks_window
description: This command sets the number of frames to look at when calculating your peak framerate in game. The default value is just 30 frames.

arguments.label: Frames
arguments.description: The number of frames to test to find your peak framerate.

name: budget_show_averages
description: This console command selects whether or not you want the budget panel to show a list of averages in it.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to enable averages in the budget panel, and 0 to disable them.

name: budget_show_history
description: This command selects whether the history graph is shown in the budget panel. As it's frame intensive, it's advisable to keep this off on lower end PCs.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to show history, and 0 to hide it.

name: budget_show_peaks
description: This command sets whether or not the budget panel shows peak values.

arguments.description: Enter 1 to show peaks, and 0 to hide them.

name: budget_toggle_group
description: This console command toggles a budget group on or off.

name: c_maxpitch
description: This command sets your camera's maximum pitch.

name: c_maxyaw
description: This command sets your camera's maximum yaw.

name: c_minpitch
description: This command sets your camera's minimum pitch.

name: c_minyaw
description: This command sets your camera's minimum yaw.

name: cl_soundscape_printdebuginfo
description: This console command should print a list of the soundscapes into your developer console, however it can make your game client crash so use with caution.

name: editdemo
description: This command may not work. It will edit the demo with the specified name (place the demo file in the "csgo" folder, the "csgo" folder is in the folder that csgo.exe is in).

arguments.label: Name
arguments.description: The name of the demo file (without the .dem), that you wish to edit.

name: editor_toggle
description: This command will toggle focus between the demo simulation and the edtior.

name: enable_debug_overlays
description: This command will enable (if set to 1) the rendering of debug overlays. If set to 0, this command will disable the rendering of debug overlays.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable debug overlays. Enter 1 to enable debug overlays.

name: report_cliententitysim
description: This command will print to console all clientside simulations and the time it takes to execute. Default is 0 (disabled). Command will be set to 0 again after it has done calculating and printing.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable. Enter 1 to run report.

name: report_clientthinklist
description: This command will print to console all clientside simulations thinking and their thinking time. Default is 0 (disabled). Command will be set to 0 again after it has done calculating and printing.

arguments.description: Enter 0 to disable. Enter 1 to run report.

name: report_entities
description: This command will print to console a list of all entities (server-sided).

name: report_simthinklist
description: This command will print to console a list of all simulating/thinking entities (server-sided).

name: report_soundpatch
description: This command will print to console a report of the sound patch count (server-sided).

name: report_touchlinks
description: This command will print to console a list of all touchlinks (server-sided).

name: voice_inputfromfile
description: This command, if set to 1, will make voice input come from the voice_input.wav file, instead of your microphone.

arguments.description: Set to 0 to not use voice input from file (default). Set to 1 to use voice input from file.

name: voice_modenable
description: This command disables your microphone if set to 0 (you can still hear other players). Default is 1 (your microphone is enabled).

arguments.description: Set to 0 to disable your microphone. Set to 1 to enable your microphone (default).
